Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: Capacity building  on e-bus  deployment
Description:
ITDP will encourage knowledge and experience sharing 
from transit providers and local governments who have 
deployed electric buses in their public transport fleet for 
Transjakarta and other beneficiaries by initiating 
dialogues in the form of webinars, study tours, and other 
capacity building events. Approaching project 
finalization, the lessons learned from this project will be 
documented as a toolkit on electric bus adoption which 
will be bundled with the TCO, decision-making, and 
environmental benefit calculation tool. Both the toolkit 
document and the calculation tool will be disseminated 
to other cities in Indonesia through city-level workshops 
for public officials and local transit providers. The TCO 
and environmental benefit calculation tool can be used 
also by other cities and the national government who are 
also planning to develop bus electrification programs.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Pilot EV  Financing Tool  for Bangladesh  (Knowledge  Product 1)
Description:
This output would focus on addressing the following 
key questions:
a) What is the current demand for EVs among MSMEs 
in Bangladesh? What are the key concerns and issues 
for MSMEs in their consideration for adopting EVs in 
their businesses? 
b) What are the current financing options available for 
EVs?
c) Is there an opportunity to support increased uptake 
of EVs for MSMEs?
d) What are some of the existing EV-enabled business 
models among MSMEs in Bangladesh?
e) What are some new/ innovative business models 
that could be adopted by MSMEs? – including 
supporting evidence of successful delivery of these 
innovative models.
f) What is the recommended structure and delivery 
model for an EV Financing Tool that would enable the 
increased uptake of EVs?
The Knowledge Product will be delivered through the 
synthesis of information and evidence gathered from 
the following intermediate deliverables/ outputs 
(indicative number of pages excludes annexes):
1.1 MSME Demand & Needs Assessment Survey Report 
(20 pages), to be delivered by April 2021 
1.2 Financial Institutions Survey Report (15 pages), to 
be delivered by April 2021
1.3 Recommendations from MSME-FI Engagement -
Knowledge Product 1.1 (10 pages), to be delivered by 
June 2021
2.1 MSME Business Support Service Report (20 pages), 
to be delivered by October 2021
The above outputs are explained in the following 
sections. 
The Knowledge Product will be delivered to the 
Government of Bangladesh, the Development 
Partners, the MSME Support Group and the Financial 
Institutions Working Group. This will be achieved 
through an engagement workshop during which the 
key findings and recommendations from the 
Knowledge Product will be presented (estimated 
timing: October 2021)
This Knowledge Product represents a key body of 
research and evidence for the support of an MSME-led 
EV uptake programme in Bangladesh that could 
deliver significant emissions reductions in the longterm.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: MSME Demand  & Needs  Assessment  Survey Report
Description:
We aim to undertake a MSME survey involving 400 
MSMEs, including up to 50 women owned MSMEs. 
The sample frame for the survey will be developed 
from SME databases from IDCOL’s Partner NGO 
Networks, FIWG members’ Client Databases, SME 
Networks and Service Providers from select large 
corporates.
We will use stratified multi-stage random sampling to 
select 200 MSME from Dhaka, Chittagong and Sylhet 
(and/or Khulna Divisions), and judgemental sampling 
(direct recommendations from FIWG members, IDCOL 
Partner NGOs and Corporates) for another 200 
MSMEs. 
The Survey Questionnaire will be limited to a 
maximum of 5 pages (approximately 25 questions –
combination of quantitative and qualitative 
questions). This will be piloted among a group of 20 
MSMEs, including up to 5 women owned MSMEs, in 
the Dhaka Division. The final questionnaire 
(incorporating feedback from pilot) will be 
administered as a combination of door-to-door institutional survey and day-long engagement 
workshops. It is anticipated that a total of 150 MSMEs, 
both men and women led, would be engaged through 
the engagement workshops (3 workshops during 
which the questionnaire will be administered), and 
another 250 MSMEs (both men and women led) will 
be covered by the door-to-door institutional survey. 
The Demand/ Needs Survey Report will be delivered to 
the IDCOL Partner NGOs, the FIWG members, 
Development Partners, the Corporates and the survey 
participants. 
The Survey Report fulfils the following key functions:
(i) enable the delivery team to identify and 
recommend 30 MSMEs for the business support 
services under Output 2, of which a minimum of 10 
would be women-led businesses;
(ii) provide FIs and corporates an overview of the 
appetite and ability of MSME to transition to EVs;
(iii) provide an overview to MSME’s various current 
business models and services provided through EVs, as 
well as key enablers (and obstacles) to the use of EVs

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Financial  Institutions Survey Report
Description:
The sample frame for the survey will be developed 
from Bangladesh Bank database of registered financial 
and non-banking financial institutions, as well as 
microfinance institutions on the NGO Bureau 
database. The survey will use a stratified random 
sampling methodology for selection of institutions 
from the sample frame and will aim to maintain 
proportionality across various strata (size of MSME 
financing operations, type of institution, etc.). The 
survey questionnaire will focus on gathering 
quantitative and qualitative information on the type of 
financial products that is available for MSMEs – and if 
there are any financial products for financing EVs, an 
appreciation of the financing needs for MSMEs, 
securitisation mechanisms in different products, etc. 
The survey questionnaire would be limited to a 
maximum of 5 pages and 20 questions. The survey 
team from IDCOL will undertake the interviews with relevant respondents at each organisation. In some 
cases, multiple respondents from the same institution 
may be interviewed in order to collect suitable insights 
and discrepancies among regions. 
The Financial Institutions Survey Report will be 
delivered to the IDCOL Partner NGOs, the FIWG 
members, Development Partners, Corporates and the 
survey participants. 
The Survey Report fulfils the following key functions:
(i) establish a baseline for EV financing options 
available for MSMEs in Bangladesh;
(ii) explore challenges related to MSME financing 
faced by FIs;
(iii) identify key lessons from current financing 
mechanisms and delivery models for EV financing for 
MSMEs.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Establishing the  FIWG and the  MSME-FI  Engagement  Platform
Description:
For MSMEs and FIs. Some of the largest domestic and 
international banks operating in Bangladesh have 
already agreed to be a part of the FIWG. Ricardo and 
IDCOL will continue to leverage our existing networks 
and relationships in Bangladesh to ensure 
participation of key FIs in the FIWG and in the 
engagement with MSMEs. 
We will prepare a summary of proceedings from the 
FIWG and the MSME-FI Engagement Forum and 
circulate to all participating FIs and MSMEs. These 
summaries will also be annexed in Output 1. 
This output is key in ensuring engagement between 
two key beneficiaries of the programme, as well as to 
foster ownership of the programme outputs among 
the beneficiaries.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Provide business  support services  for MSMEs
Description:
This output involves the provision of business support 
services to selected MSMEs on the development of 
suitable business cases for the adoption, transition or 
scaling up of EVs in their businesses. Based on the 
results of the Demand & Needs Assessment Survey, 
we will establish a transparent and fair evaluation 
criteria for the selection of up to 30 MSMEs (including 
a minimum of 10 Women Entrepreneurs) to be a part 
of the business support services that would be 
delivered by the project. The project team will work 
with MSMEs in the development of their business case 
and models and support the preparation of their 
financing applications to FIs. 
Some of the key criteria for selection would include:
(i) Size and nature of the business;
(ii) High-level “Know Your Customer” (KYC) assessment 
to exclude any political linkages or conflicts of interest;
(iii) Technology readiness for business model;
(iv) Potential for emissions reductions;
(v) Scalability of the business model; 
(vi) Gender balance in MSME ownership and 
operation;
(vii) Level of social inclusion demonstrated by the 
business. 
The final MSME selection criteria would be discussed 
and agreed with the BEIS and UK PACT GRCF teams. 
The provision of business support services is a key 
output of the project. In the absence of these, it is 
unlikely that MSMEs would be able to develop and 
scale their business models incorporating EV-based 
and EV-enabled solutions and services. In most cases, 
MSMEs remain focused on their core business 
operation and tend to follow market drivers and 
demand from their clients. This means that they have 
little time to focus on the development of innovative 
EV-based models and deriving greater value from 
existing business operation through the introduction 
of new technology (such as EVs). Therefore, our delivery model focuses on the continued engagement 
and support to MSMEs.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Raise awareness, sensitise and  incentivise
Description:
Providers have experienced significant growth in the 
past few years and have a rider/ service provider base 
of over 300,000. We intend to engage with these 
urban mobility providers through capacity building 
workshops and knowledge seminars to develop their 
understanding around the potential of electrified 
urban solutions. 
These workshops would be designed to sensitise and 
build capacity in large urban mobility service providers 
and their rider base of the potential benefits and 
opportunities arising from the adoption of electric 
motorbikes. These workshops are expected to be daylong workshops and will include participants from the 
FIWG and MFEF to share some of the key experiences 
and learnings from the programme around enabling 
business models and financing mechanisms that could 
support the electrification of transport solutions 
provided by these MaaS providers. 
We aim to encourage and support the business 
thinking of these key urban service providers, by 
providing evidence through our programme on the 
potential and viability of electrified transport 
solutions, suitable financing options and mechanisms 
for e-mobility, and demonstrate long-term 
sustainability that would be key to their businesses.

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: GESI and  Engagement  with Women  Entrepreneurs
Description:
This is a cross-cutting output that will:
(i) Embed GESI considerations through all project 
outputs and ensure that these are considered in the 
design and implementation of all programme 
activities;
(ii) provide direct engagement and training to the 
minimum of 10 Women Entrepreneurs (WEs) selected 
as a part of the MSME business support services under 
Output 2. This would include monthly engagement 
and training sessions;
(iii) sensitise FIs, MaaS providers, and other 
programme beneficiaries on GESI issues (existing barriers, opportunities, benefits) surrounding 
sustainable urban transport
(iv) deliver business orientation training for 50 WEs on 
business models identified by the project as well as in 
the productive use of clean energy solutions that 
could be delivered as a result of implementing some 
of the business models

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Mpumalanga Provincial Government Green Economy Training and Strategy Support
Description: Many government officials, business leaders and investors do not have the knowledge needed to invest in, or create an enabling environment for, the uptake of sustainable infrastructure solutions. This limits their ability to be supportive and active in removing barriers to growth for green economy ecosystems. This output aims to upskill the Mpumalanga Provincial Government on the energy, water and waste economies in South Africa. The exact content will be co-designed with the province.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: SAREM Policy Recommendations
Description: This output aims to steer the government to act on the levers listed in SAREM that will achieve the greatest climate action results. SAREM will highlight several paths with a very strong focus on job creation and economic development, the goal of this output is to add a climate change lens to the thinking created in SAREM and highlight the paths that optimize for climate change as well as economic goals.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Mpumalanga Provincial Government Green Economy Strategy Support
Description: The green economy represents an exciting opportunity for local and provincial governments to create local strategies and policies to drive job creation and increased investment. This output will provide Mpumalanga Provincial Government  with the insights they need to prioritize and develop strategy to grow the regional green economy.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: SAREM Social Compact Mapping (industry champions of change)
Description: This output is a mapping of the appropriate stakeholders to be involved in the social compact of SAREM. Having the correct set of stakeholders signing the social compact is vital to the long term success of SAREM (South African Renewable Energy Masterplan), as these stakeholders will be the ones making the commitments to deliver on the plan.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: SAREM Validation Report
Description: This output is a validation of the South African Renewable Energy Master Plan (SAREM) with the appropriate stakeholders. This is an important step in ensuring that the SAREM and it's recommended actions are pragmatic, sensible and will lead to the  desired outcomes.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Market Intelligence Report highlighting the green economy investment potential in Mpumalanga
Description:
Through close working relationships with businesses, investors, government, and academia, GreenCape’s sector desks are in a unique position to collect, create, and disseminate free market intelligence on the green economy.

Our reports are written for investors and businesses who are currently active or interested in green economy sectors in the Western Cape and South Africa.

Each report provides an overview of the market within a sector, including key developments and achievements, the key players, legislation and regulation, market opportunities and challenges, funding opportunities, and an overview of general green economy investment opportunities.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Mpumalanga Investment Promotion Materials
Description: The goal of this output is to create promotional material highlighting the opportunity for local manufacturing and investment in the implementation of SAREM. This will be packaged in the form of a presentation and based on the insights gathered for the Market Influence Report. This will then be used to present to International Investment promotion agencies, potential investors and other stakeholders.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Second of two EV learning exchange workshops between City of Cape Town and City of Joburg
Description: An online learning exchange (half-day to full day, depending on availability & agenda). The purpose of the second workshop is to align the EV approaches of Cape Town and Joburg in order to influence policy and regulation. This workshop will further build Johannesburg staff capacity on building EV charging infrastructure. This workshop will also serve as a platform to compare modelling results.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Second of four capacity building sessions with CoJ EV steering committee and relevant national stakeholders
Description: Online session with key staff from relevant City departments, which provides an update of project progress and learnings to date, but also provide a platform for discussion / guidance. As such, national stakeholders may be invited, topic dependent. The sessions aim to ensure continued buy-in from all relevant stakeholders, alignment with City goals, while also acting as a knowledge-exchange and problem-solving hub. As such, this will be a flexible space that will include topics, as they arise, which may not fall neatly within other project activities / outputs, but has been highlighted as a need as the project progresses.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Third of four capacity building sessions with CoJ EV steering committee and relevant national stakeholders
Description: Online session with key staff from relevant City departments, which provides an update of project progress and learnings to date, but also provide a platform for discussion / guidance. As such, national stakeholders may be invited, topic dependent. The sessions aim to ensure continued buy-in from all relevant stakeholders, alignment with City goals, while also acting as a knowledge-exchange and problem-solving hub. As such, this will be a flexible space that will include topics, as they arise, which may not fall neatly within other project activities / outputs, but has been highlighted as a need as the project progresses.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Fourth of four capacity building sessions with CoJ EV steering committee and relevant national stakeholders
Description: Online session with key staff from relevant City departments, which provides an update of project progress and learnings to date, but also provide a platform for discussion / guidance. As such, national stakeholders may be invited, topic dependent. The sessions aim to ensure continued buy-in from all relevant stakeholders, alignment with City goals, while also acting as a knowledge-exchange and problem-solving hub. As such, this will be a flexible space that will include topics, as they arise, which may not fall neatly within other project activities / outputs, but has been highlighted as a need as the project progresses.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Capacity building workshop with City Power tariff team on tariff setting for EVs
Description: The workshop with City Power staff and NERSA representatives will draw on an EV tariff review and aims to build staff capacity to inform the determination of the City's EV tariff.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Registration process proposal for private EV chargers
Description: Based on experience in South Africa municipalities on registration of small-scale embedded generation, develop a guidance document that proposes a registration process for EV charging infrastructure, in order to assist CoJ and other  municipalities in implementing such a process to encourage the rollout of infrastructure by private entities.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: EV tariff proposal for submission to NERSA
Description: Expected result is an EV tariff for submission to NERSA. The tariff will need to balance the City's needs (e.g. revenue protection / creation), City's goals (e.g. sustainable, inclusive city) and consumer and industry needs (e.g. EV charging cost vs. ICE vehicle fuel-up cost).

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Feasibility study for the rollout of City-owned EV charging stations powered by renewable energy
Description: Review of regulatory environment to assess constraints / opportunities for implementing City-owned infrastructure; determine optimal locations of charging stations, in consultation with City, considering localised grid capacity constraints and major traffic corridors; and assess potential for each site to be powered by renewable ennergy (whether on- or off-site). This information will be drawn into an indicative "making the case" feasibility study, which aims to inform planning for / implementation of city-owned charging sites powered by renewable energy. The feasibility study will be presented as a visual presentation rather than a formal report as we have found that people are far more likely to read a visual presentation than a report and so that City staff can then reuse the presentations

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Policy briefing document for a City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Policy
Description: Policy briefing document is developed, based on other project outputs, which aims to inform the development of an EV policy by the City. The eventual EV Policy will state what the City allows and doesn't allow in terms of EV charging.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Feasibility study for e-Taxis
Description: Informed through a review of the taxi business model, consultation with industry experts and national government (potential for EV funding taxis through the taxi recapitalisation programme), as well as the proposed EV tariff and infrastructure rollout feasibility. Aims to highlight barriers / opportunities to shift the minibus taxi industry to EVs. The feasibility study will be presented as a visual presentation rather than a formal report as we have found that people are far more likely to read a visual presentation than a report and so that City staff can then reuse the presentations.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: CoJ EV Infrastructure Needs Assessment
Description:
This output will quantify the impact of electric vehicles on the City's electricity grid. To understand the infrastructure needs, realistic EV uptake scenarios will be developed using a vehicle parc model. These scenarios will then be workshopped with relevant city officials. Once the project team has agreed on the scenarios, these will be translated into infrastructure needs. A presentation documenting the infrastructure needs will be developed for City staff. Infrastructure needs will include:
- Electricity demand forecasts (kWh) and capacity demand forecasts (kW)
- EV charging requirements (no. of chargers and where they will need to be)
- Network requirements and where network strengthening will be required

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Paper submission for the Association of Municipal Electricity Utilities Convention
Description: Write / submit a paper to the AEMU (Association of Municipal Electricity Utilities) convention on topic “New customers and new revenue streams: How electric utilities can start preparing for EVs”, which will be based on learnings to date. Aims to disseminate learnings to a larger audience on a platform containing stakeholders that are likely to have a high level of interest, which may encourage further research / work on EV readiness in local municipalities, increasing readiness of a larger cohort of municipalities.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: A media briefing document describing the opportunity of e-Taxis
Description: Media briefing containing key elements / findings from the feasibility study and emissions reduction potential modelling, in order to highlight barriers / opportunities of shifting to EVs in the minibus taxi industry. Aims to build momentum / interest / awareness of this space. We will produce a brief the City can use for media briefings and will likely upload it as a resource on our Urban Energy Support website and reference it in our newsletter, but it will be up to the City as to how they want to approach the media.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Urban Energy Network meeting focused on electric vehicles
Description: Host an Urban Energy Network meeting focussing on EV infrastructure needs, City-owned EV chargers as a new revenue stream and supporting the rollout of e-Taxis. Stakeholders to build on SEA's existing network, including SALGA, SACN and a range of local municipalities (including metros and secondary cities). Aims to disseminate the learnings and findings from the project to a wider audience, in order to encourage work on EV readiness in other local municipalities in the country.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Anticipatory Governance training: 1-day workshop with key stakeholders and project beneficiaries to actively explore options with a particular aim of spurring on green hydrogen economy innovations connected to uncertain futures in the hopes of shaping the
Description: About 10 people from the primary and secondary beneficiaries along with union, and labour representatives of the project acquired Anticipatory Governance training for disruptive technologies that seeks to provide a proactive approach to enable government stakeholders to better anticipate and harness new technologies that support the development of a GHE. It also provides a strong innovative base for partnership creation across government, industry and training institutions to facilitate a JET and JLT within a green economy paradigm.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Policy briefing on key recommendations for industry focused TVET training on GHE
Description: The training funded by Bambili and EWSETA( Education & Water Sector Education Training Authority) helped graduates acquire skills to maintain and operate HFC technologies. The training evaluation analysis revealed gaps in the curriculum through the Gaps Analysis Report. The gaps analysis report and the training evaluation will inform the development of the policy briefing on how  the DHET (Department of Higher Education and Training) and TVET (Technical and Vocational Education and Training) College system could be better capacitated to offer GHE skills training that is aligned with industry needs and secure GHE jobs pipeline.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Policy Briefing on disruptive impact of the GHE on existing skills to enable interventions for a Just Skills transition
Description: Analysis on the disruptive impact of the GHE on existing skills will assist Department of Science and Innovation (DSI), South African National Energy Development Institute (SANEDI), Energy & Water Sector Education Training Authority (EWSETA), Department of Trade Industry and Competition (DTIC), Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) to prepare for a Just Skills transition enabled by targeted policy recommendations.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Policy Briefing on quantitative and qualitative analysis of the job creation, revenue generation and infrastructure requirements of the green hydrogen economy keeping in mind a Just Energy and Labour Transition
Description: Quantitative and qualitative analysis of the job creation, revenue generation and infrastructure requirements of the green hydrogen economy will assist targeted policy makers and the other primary beneficiaries (DSI, SANEDI, EWSETA, DTIC, TVET, media, business and labour representatives) to prepare for a JET and JLT enabled by targeted policy recommendations.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Policy Briefing on regulatory requirements of an enabling ecosystem for the green hydrogen economy
Description: Analysis of the regulatory requirements of an enabling ecosystem for the GHE will assist targeted policy makers to prepare for a JET and JLT enabled by targeted policy recommendations.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Policy Briefing on industry demand for hydrogen skills with the view to determine the future potential jobs pipeline
Description: Analysis of industry demand for hydrogen skills with the view to determine the future potential jobs pipeline will provide a strong evidence-base to policy makers and industry to support more rapid action in this area. Targeted policy recommendations drawing on the industry consultations will support such actions by the intended beneficiaries.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Policy Briefing on  carbon emission reduction  based on the hydrogen societal road map targets in line with more ambitious South African NDC targets
Description: Analysis on  the reduction of carbon emissions based on the hydrogen societal road map targets will provide a strong evidence-base to policy makers and industry to pursue more ambitious  South African NDC targets. Targeted policy recommendations drawing on this analysis will support  framing of the hydrogen societal roadmap within a green economy paradigm.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: TVET Gaps Analysis Report to assess the structural capacity constraints within the TVET college system and lack of alignment with industry needs
Description: The special report will provide a high-level assessment of the current nature and quantum of curriculum and training offered by the Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) College System that would be useful to the Green Hydrogen (including grey hydrogen applications where relevant) economy in South Africa, with a specific focus on industry gaps per sector (transport, mining, power generation, industrial and manufacturing processes and building/construction) and how to overcome these

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Handout on Anticipatory Governance for disruptive technologies, including the impact of the green hydrogen economy
Description: This Handout on Anticipatory Governance for disruptive technologies seeks to provide a framework which enables government stakeholders to better anticipate and harness new technologies that support the development of a GHE. It also provides a strong evidence-base for partnership creation across government, industry and training institutions to facilitate a JET and JLT within a green economy paradigm.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Multi-Stakeholder Workshop to share research findings through presentations and sharing of policy briefings amongst various stakeholder groups beyond the immediate beneficiaries and secondary beneficiaries
Description: Dissemination all research findings in close collaboration with Department of Science and Innovation

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: 1st visioning workshop for public-private-partnership dialogue: 2-hour training workshop on the use of strategic foresight, futures literacy, and the Three Horizons methodology
Description: This workshop is the 1st of 2 workshops that will contain a 2-hour training segment  for about 20 people that sensitises key stakeholders on the use of strategic foresight, futures literacy, and the Three Horizons methodology to co-create preferred South African Just Labour Transition futures that imaginatively captures the values and ideals of all stakeholders and ensures the successful implementation of the Hydrogen Society Roadmap (HSRM) and input into the South African Renewable Energy Masterplan (SAREM)

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: 2nd visioning workshop for public-private-partnership dialogue: 1-day workshop to review and improve the co-created preferred South African Just Labour Transition futures
Description: This workshop is the 2nd of 2 workshops that will establish/strengthen a Hydrogen Economy Network that sensitizes key industry players to the potential of the hydrogen economy. This 1-day workshop with primary and secondary beneficiaries will enable mutual understanding of the various needs of targeted stakeholders on the GHE and their ability and responsibility to help shape a JLT and JET together.

Project: Thailand Skill Share: Workshop to support Thailand to develop and adopt a cross-cutting policy for the promotion of electric vehicles on Thai roads
Result_Title: Proposed policy recommendations for Thailand's National EV Policy (based on UK best practice)
Description:
A half-day training workshop will take place in early May with members of the NEVPC – representatives from the Ministry of Energy, Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Industry, and other key government and private agencies who will help to formulate the EV policy in the future. The workshop will provide a general understanding of UK EV policy and commitment, policy formulation, the implications for CO2 emissions from transport, and policies and tax based incentives to promote the adoption of EVs.

Following the workshop, a summary report will be created which will present current UK best practice and define the recommended next steps to help Thailand to formulate their EV policy and agree areas of focus for future work. This will help to identify additional capacity building support required to enable Thailand to move forward with their EV policy documentation.

Project: Colombia inward skillshare: Green finance
Result_Title: Colombia-UK network in the green finance sector
Description: Strengthen the relationship of Colombian stakeholders with UK experts and services providers in the green finance sector.

Project: Colombia outward skillshare: Sustainable tourism in the Amazon
Result_Title: Colombia-UK workshops on the suitability of sustainable tourism and scientific research to protect forests
Description: Workshops between Colombia and UK organisations to share expertise around the suitability of sustainable tourism and scientific research as a strategy to protect forests, ensure sustainable rural development and consolidation of peace in areas that have been affected by conflict and improve understanding of UK experts and sustainable business models for the region.

Project: Colombia outward skillshare: Sustainable tourism in the Amazon
Result_Title: UK-Colombia network on sustainable tourism and scientific research
Description: Networks established between UK and Colombian experts and research facilities in order to establish and strenghten long-term relationships on sustainable tourism and scientific research.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Municipal Training programme and city-to-city learning exchange for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy and Climate Finance
Description:
Relevant municipal officials will be identified by each municipality (most likely from the electricity, urban planning and infrastructure departments) (3-4 officials per municipality, a total of 12 - 16 people per session). It is preferred that the same officials from each municipality attends every training session as the training sessions will build on one another. The municipal training programme consists of 6 structured half-day online events where municipal officials will be trained on a variety of topics related to renewable energy, embedded generation, climate change, and climate finance. This is required to enhance the skills of municipal officials and build capacity for the implementation and replication of these projects. This training will predominantly be held virtually, with one in-person session.

An overview of the training sessions is provided below:
a. Session 1: An introduction to climate change, NDCs and the Just Transition
b. Session 2: A Just Transition approach to renewable energy planning in the South African context
c. Session 3: Gender considerations for renewable energy and climate change
d. Session 4 (3-day workshop): The importance of renewable energy embedded generation and its co-benefits; The principles of renewable energy embedded generation policy development; Strategic planning and renewable energy embedded generation policy: Goal setting, monitoring and evaluation, Energy data collection 
e. Session 5: Introduction to climate finance and an exploration of finance models for the renewable energy embedded generation projects
f. Session 6: Key considerations to undertake a pre-feasibility study for a renewable energy embedded generation project

Each session will be developed further once the capacity assessment is complete.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Municipal and National Embedded Generation policy recommendations
Description: A policy gap analysis will be conducted for each of the municipalities to identify opportunities to improve and add to existing policy to support the implementation of embedded generation projects. This will be based on both desktop analysis and interviews with key stakeholders. Furthermore, through this activity and the process of implementing the project, there will also be an opportunity to develop recommendations for national policy on embedded generation projects.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: 4 Technical and Financial Pre-feasibility Studies
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Technical and financial feasibility studies will determine the necessary project details required to complete applications to the Development Bank of South Africa (DBSA), including but not limited to the proposed technology, site selection, electricity evacuation analysis, yield assessment and cost analysis.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: 4 Project Preparation Facility Applications to the Development Bank of South Africa (DBSA) to access Embedded Generation Investment Programme (EGIP)
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: The DBSA PPF (Project Preparation Fund) Application is required in order to access further project preparation support from DBSA and to access the financial mechanisms provided by the EGIP.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Financial Tool to estimate financial feasibility for embedded generation projects in South Africa
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: The financial model will be a tool that is applied in these project municipalities, but one that can also be used by other municipalities who are looking to develop financial feasibility studies for embedded generation projects more quickly.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Training resources for municipalities
Description: The training resources will be developed for each training session noted above. These training resources will be a set of PowerPoint slides, relevant videos and exercises for a highly interactive training session. All training resources will be digital as it is expected that all training sessions will take place through a virtual platform.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Embedded generation of renewable energy manual
Description: Building on the training resources developed, a manual will be developed to be used to support municipalities to identify and develop renewable energy embedded generation projects that can attract the necessary finance. This will be publicly available

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Lessons learnt communications product capturing project achievements and insights
Description: To share the lessons and tools emanating from the project to allow for wider scale replication and use by municipalities and others who were not directly part of the project. This output is required to ensure that other potential beneficiaries are aware of what the project has delivered so they may use the outputs to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the energy sector and to assist the primary beneficiaries to connect with a broader network of governments and institutions committed to renewable energy.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Project dissemination in global ICLEI Community, 100% Renewable Energy Network, and through social media campaign and webinar
Description: To disseminate the communication products in relevant networks within ICLEI and those held by partner organisations through sharing project articles and resources on relevant websites and in newsletters, engaging in webinars, and through a social media campaign. This will be further specified in the communications plan developed for the project.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Trends in Climate-related Financial Disclosure Report: What Does it Mean for South Africa
Description: Report showcasing international trends and best practice in CFD, and distilling what this means for SA. Result from a desktop review of international trends and best practice in CFD.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Transition risk scenario training
Description: Advanced training on scenario use as part of the process to quantify transition risk inherent in example portfolio. 3-hour interactive in-person and/or virtual (livestreamed) session targeting approximately 20 investment professionals.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Report on quantifying physical risk in South Africa: Data gaps
Description: Document with detailed description of the activities and data sources required to undertake an asset- and portfolio-level assessment of the financial cost of the physical impacts of climate change

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Online publication of learnings from report and factsheets on Climate Finance Disclosure  in South Africa
Description: 16-page digital online publication summarizing the learning from the knowledge products developed previously

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Audio-visual products to accompany CFD report and factsheets
Description: 4 voice pieces and 1 video content piece summarizing the content and message of the Climate Finance Disclosure report and factsheets

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Best practice example: Transition risk disclosure
Description: A short best-practice TCFD-compliant disclosure example based on modelling results, stakeholder inputs and earlier knowledge products.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Transition risk and climate-related financial disclosure training programme
Description: A training curriculum will be jointly developed and deployed, with inputs from ASISA and/or BATSETA,  to ensure that it fits within their existing training offerings and that their trainers are familiar and comfortable with the material. The material will also be developed with the needs of the broader stakeholder community to ensure that there is a demand for the training and materials. The material will made available through beneficiary platforms supported by ASISA and BATSETA.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: User-friendly transition risk analysis support toolkit
Description:
User-friendly climate-related financial risk and opportunity analysis (CFRO) toolkit with local information and approaches consisting of:
(1) Spreadsheet model that generates South Africa-specific information to augment existing transition risk scenarios and support transition risk analysis
(2) Toolkit user manual
(3) South Africa-specific scenario development guidance document

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: South Africa  Climate-related Financial Disclosure Fact Sheets
Description: 50 Fact sheets summarizing the CFD of 50 JSE-listed companies that represent a cross-section of highly invested companies.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Online repository of knowledge products
Description: Create a publicly available repository of knowledge products accessible to beneficiaries groups for up to a year after the end of the project in partnership with beneficiaries and/or stakeholders

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Virtual best-practice transition risk analysis webinars - asset management industry
Description: 8 x 4-hour interactive webinars  providing training for practitioners and specialists under the banner of the primary beneficiaries targeting 100 investment professionals. The training will focus on using the newly-developed CFRO toolkit to generate information that can support meaningful CFD in South Africa.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Best-practice transition risk analysis workshops - retirement fund industry
Description: 2 days of interactive workshops (two one-day workshops or series of shorter sessions) (including both virtual and in-person sessions) providing training for practitioners and specialists under the banner of the primary beneficiaries targeting 40 participants in total.  The training will be centered on the newly-created CFRO toolkit and enable asset owners to define the parameters they expect their asset managers to use when undertaking CFD It will also build on the earlier foundation phase training by further increasing their ability to evaluate the CFD that is provided and better understand the implications thereof for their portfolios.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Infographic summary document: The importance and state of climate-related financial disclosure in South Africa
Description: Infographic-focused summary document with state of play, insights, learnings and progress that can be shared at COP26.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Webinars to drive project impact
Description: 4 webinars where materials and knowledge products are explained and the process for accessing the toolkit and training is described targeting 100 participants.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Virtual foundation-level Climate Finance Disclosure webinars - general audience
Description: 8 x 2-hour webinars for broad range of interested parties identified by SC and AG. Targeting 100 participants in total. The purpose of the training is to familiarize participants with the basic concepts and terminology of CFD to enable them to engage with the CFD conversation. The training will also allow them to critically evaluate financial sector CFD actions and commitments.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Virtual foundation-level Climate Finance Disclosure workshops - asset managers
Description: 4 x half-day virtual interactive workshops inviting key influencers identified by SC and AG. Targeting 50 participants in total. The purpose of the training is to familiarize participants with the basic concepts and terminology to highlight the importance of CFD and to prepare them for the more advanced training to be provided  later

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Foundation-level Climate Finance Disclosure training - retirement fund industry
Description: 2 x 2-day interactive sessions (including a number of individual sessions) for representatives from GESI groups and key influencers in the retirement fund space (asset owner representatives and asset consultants) to be held in Johannesburg and Cape Town (if possible) or virtually if in-person gatherings are not possible). Targeting 35 participants in total. The purpose of the training is to familiarise participants with the basic concepts and terminology to highlight the importance of CFD and to prepare them for the more advanced training to be provided  later. The focus will be on capacitating asset owners to effectively instruct their service providers to provide useful CFD,  to evaluate the CFD that is provided, and to understand the implications of the CFD for their portfolios.

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: Just transitions capacity building workshop with local stakeholders in Mpumalanga
Description: One training workshop for local stakeholders  - the training will target stakeholders located in Mpumalanga but the exact topic and audience of the training will be determined in the first quarter through the co-development of the project plan

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: Policy/issue brief 1 and 2 covering key forward-looking solutions identified through interviews, research and dialogues
Description: Exact topic and audience of the brief will be determined in the first quarter through the co-development of the project plan.

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: One coherent series of 4 newspaper articles
Description: Set of recommendations for actions disseminated to a wide audience through newspapers

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: Project inception engagements in order to on-board stakeholders and co-develop the detailed project plan for co-ownership.
Description: The project inception aims to create awareness as well as buy-in from among key stakeholders. A sub-set will also be invited to seat on the project's Sustainability Task Team. Individual meetings will be held with each stakeholders to understand their priorities and their concerns. This will then be included in the project plan. The final result will be a co-developed and signed-off detailed project design and implementation plan.

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: Public workshop 1 - the exact topic/agenda of the workshop will be determined in the first quarter through the co-development of the project plan
Description: Partnerships between stakeholders established or strengthened: hosting a series of engagements that pool relevant and credible experts and vulnerable groups

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Capacity building training pilot project: Financial Institution (commercial bank)
Description: Pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to a commercial bank (from July to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance which includes an individualized 1 day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 5 key participants from the bank (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the organisation) and 10 additional participants.

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Capacity building pilot project: Financial Institution (pension fund or development bank)
Description: Pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to a pension fund or development bank (from July to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance  which includes an individualized 1 day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 5 key participants from the pension fund or development bank (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the organisation) and 10 additional participants.

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Capacity building pilot project: Municipalities
Description: Pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to each Municipality (from June to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance which includes an individualised 1 day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 3 key participants from each Municipality (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the organisation) and 10 additional participants per Municipality. (Therefore 6 key persons and 20 additional participants in total)

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Capacity building pilot project: National government (DEFF)
Description: Pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to DEFF (from June to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance which includes an individualized 1 day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 3 key participants from DFFE (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the operations) and 10 additional participants.

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Capacity building pilot project: National government (DPME)
Description: Pilot project delivering bespoke TA and capacity building to DPME (from June to November) to embed taxonomic practices and governance which includes an individualized 1 day training workshop at the close of the pilot session, with a minimum of 3 key participants from DPME (being decision makers with a key role in the implementation of the taxonomy in the operations) and 10 additional participants.

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Sustainable Finance Taxonomy Report
Description:
A technical document containing the following:
- An enhanced Phase-1 catalogue and standards of nationally-relevant green activities/innovation needs with more granular criteria, guidance and metrics for complex activities
- An advanced transition finance taxonomy (as sub-component of the green finance taxonomy), with explicit guidance, catalogue and criteria; informed by technology and sector decarbonisation pathways, sustainability-linked instruments; consensus on minimum roadmap requirements; green default monitoring processes
- A Social Finance Taxonomy, with a distinct catalogue and standards for social and socio-economic development activities aligned to and to transition to a green economy with recognition/ requirements, criteria, thresholds and just transition models;
- A non-compatible finance taxonomy: taxonomic exclusion principles; catalogue and criteria of activities, technologies and products that do significant environmental harm; process for reallocation from ‘transition’ to ‘non-compatible’ taxonomies

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Roadmaps
Description: Roadmap for Johannesburg Stock Exchange, South African Reserve Bank, financial sector, Department of Planning ,Monitoring and Evaluation  & Department of Environment, Forest and Fisheries and financial sector to translate the taxonomy into their pre-existing mechanisms, creating demand for the taxonomy and practice alignment.

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: User practice guidance, tools and templates associated with the Sustainable Finance Taxonomy
Description: User practice guidance, tools and templates dictated by the Taxonomy Working Group, specific to each component of the enhanced Green Finance Taxonomy and it's collective application

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Open access tools and templates informed by private sector FI pilot projects
Description: Generic tools and templates from private sector FI (financial institution) ;DFI ( Depository Financial Institution); Department of Environment, Forest and Fisheries , Department of Planning, Monitoring and Evaluation; municipality

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: 6 case studies for each user group
Description: Case studies for each user group (POLICY MAKERS & GOVERNMENT AGENCIES; FINANCIAL MARKET PARTICIPANTS; ASSET OWNERS) and basic sector guidance for each user group with recommendations for broader adoption (6 in total)

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: 3 virtual webinars for taxonomy user groups

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Result_Title: Sustainable Finance Taxonomy Version 2 National Launch Event
Description:
Organise and hold a (virtual) public awareness raising event to close the project, ensuring international investors’ participation and broad awareness raising of the project outputs. The event is planned to:
- Be 2.5 hours of participant content
- Include engaging presentation material, and presentations by an engaging project representative and national treasury
- Include a panel of key note speakers from national and international finance institutions and taxonomy users, with a facilitated panel session
- > 50 individual participants from < 25 individual organisations

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: 2-day training workshop with personnel (key decision makers) from the National and Provincial Department of Transport  to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles
Description: Online training workshop with 20-30 people. Day one will cover the following topics on e-mobility:  Public transport (road); fleet vehicles -government and industry; private vehicles; micro mobility for marginalised and vulnerable communities. Day two  will cover the following topics on e-mobility and charging infrastructure: electric busses; publicly accessible chargers; ancillary services from electric vehicle fleets. Hiten Parmar , Edem Foli and Julien de Klerk will be providing the training.

Description: Online training workshop with 20-30 people. Day two  will cover the following topics on e-mobility and  charging infrastructure: electric busses; publicly accessible chargers; ancillary services from electric vehicle fleets. Result_Title: 2-day training workshop with personnel (key decision makers) from the National Department of Mineral Resources and Energy to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles
Description: Online training workshop with 20-30 people. Day one will cover the following topics on e-mobility:  Public transport (road); fleet vehicles -government and industry; private vehicles; micro mobility for marginalised and vulnerable communities. Day two  will cover the following topics on e-mobility and charging infrastructure: electric busses; publicly accessible chargers; ancillary services from electric vehicle fleets. Hiten Parmar , Edem Foli and Julien de Klerk will be providing the training.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: 2-day training workshop with personnel (key decision makers) from the South African National Road Agency to develop their skill and knowledge on electric vehicles
Description: Online training workshop with 20-30 people. Day one will cover the following topics on e-mobility:  Public transport (road); fleet vehicles -government and industry; private vehicles; micro mobility for marginalised and vulnerable communities. Day two  will cover the following topics on e-mobility and charging infrastructure: electric busses; publicly accessible chargers; ancillary services from electric vehicle fleets. Hiten Parmar , Edem Foli and Julien de Klerk will be providing the training.

Result_Title: 2 x GESI and the Electrification of Transport webinars with members of the Business Women's Association and personnel (key decision makers) from National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises
