Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: 2-day training workshop to provide tools for the development of the guidelines and standards for electric road transport and charging document and to determine roles and responsibilities of each beneficiary
Description: Two-day training workshop with key personnel (decision makers) within National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprises, to provide tools for the development of the guidelines and standards for electric road transport and charging document and to determine roles and responsibilities of each beneficiary.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: 2-day  training workshop to provide tools for the development of infrastructure green procurement guidelines and standards to promote electric vehicle fleets and to determine roles and responsibilities
Description: Two-day  training workshop, with key personnel (decision-makers) within National and Provincial Government and State-Owned Enterprise,  to provide tools for the development of infrastructure green procurement guidelines and standards to promote electric vehicles fleet document and to determine roles and responsibilities of each beneficiary.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Training Manual for two-day training intervention on electric vehicles
Description: Content and material, covering the following topics, is produced: Public transport (road); fleet vehicles government and industry; private vehicles; micro-mobility for marginalised and vulnerable communities; charging Infrastructure; electric busses; publicly accessible chargers; ancillary services from electric vehicle fleets.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Guidelines and Standards for Electric Road Transport and Charging Infrastructure
Description: Developed guidelines and standards for electric road transport and charging. The document will contain recommendations around best practices to support the adoption of standards for electric road transport and charging. The recommendations will be submitted to the Department of Transport: Integrated Transport Planning Division, to support the following key performance indicator within the Green Transport Strategy: Develop green standards and guidelines for construction of low-carbon climate resilient road infrastructure,  including EV charger points. The recommendations will be targeting: Department of Transport: Integrated Planning Division and the South African National Roads Agency

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Green Procurement Guidelines and Standards to Promote Electric Vehicle Fleets
Description: Developed Infrastructure green procurement guidelines and standards to promote electric vehicle fleets.  The document will contain recommendations around best practices to support the adoption of green procurement guidelines to promote electric vehicle fleets. The recommendations will be submitted to the Department of Transport: Integrated Transport Planning Division, to support the following key performance indicator within the Green Transport Strategy: Develop guidelines for the procurement of vehicles throughout government to procure efficient vehicles, using clean energy technologies. The recommendations will be targeting: Department of Transport: Integrated Transport Planning Division; National Treasury: Senior Management responsible for Strategic Planning and Senior Staff within the Government Technical Advisory Centre; Department of Trade, Industry and Competition: Senior Management within the Industrial Development Division: Green Industries, Automotive Sector; Department of Environment, Forestry and Fisheries: Senior Management within the Climate Change and Air Quality Branch.

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Communication products (e.g. presentations, leaflets, press releases) for guidelines and standards for electric road transport and charging
Description: Press Release, Electronic leaflet and presentation for guidelines and standards for electric road transport and charging, made available for dissemination throughout the beneficiaries' organisations as well as the general public

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa
Result_Title: Communication products (e.g. presentations, leaflets, press releases) for guidelines and standards for green infrastructure procurement
Description: Press Release, Electronic leaflet and presentation for green infrastructure procurement guidelines and standards, made available for dissemination throughout the beneficiaries' organisations as well as the general public

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: 1st webinar on NBPER  process and user guidance
Description: Webinar based training session to ensure the targeted public and private sector building owners are familiar with the NBEPR, and understand the required process for issuance of EPCs. Accessible public and private sector training materials and user guidance will be introduced. We expect 100+ participants to attend, and will target building managers and others with responsibility for data collection and reporting in the buildings management space. The training webinar will be half a day in duration.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: 2nd webinar on NBPER  process and user guidance
Description: Webinar based training session to ensure the targeted public and private sector building owners are familiar with the NBEPR, and understand the required process for issuance of EPCs. Accessible public and private sector training materials and user guidance will be introduced. We expect 100+ participants to attend, and will target building managers and others with responsibility for data collection and reporting in the buildings management space. The training webinar will be half a day in duration.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Report capturing international EPC best practice and integration approaches, opportunities for a local EPC mechanism integrated into national carbon reporting framework
Description: The final deliverable is a report, that, through targeted technical assistance provided by the consortium, will output provide an overview of international best practice from operationalising EPCs (mainly the UK), and the required steps to integrate EPC mechanisms and required instruments in the South African EE policy framework for buildings.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Report of National Building Energy Performance Register (NBEPR)
Description:
Report 1 : The final deliverable is a report that will ensure that the NBEPR meets all user and technical requirements, and complies with local data regulations, and in line with international best practice. The consortium will work with a data scientist (funded by SANEDI) to support this process.

Report 2:This output will build on prior outputs and will finalise the functionality that the NBEPR must provide in order for it to maximize its impact. It will help to ensure the preferred NBEPR user requirements and functionality align well with reporting requirements as stated in the Draft EPC regulation, and in line with DEFF’s national emissions reporting requirements for buildings.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: National Building Energy Performance Register (NBEPR) built, tested and signed off on by South African National Energy Development Institure (SANEDI), accompanied by detailed NBEPR system specification
Description: A key aspect of this PACT project is to ensure that the Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) mechanism (as delivered by the NBEPR) accounts for and reinforces the wider buildings EE framework, and collates data from buildings to seed the database. This work package will therefore see the successfully developed NBEPR becoming the first highly integrated platform to operationalize EPCs in South Africa.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Policy recommendations for the  National Building Energy Performance Register (NBEPR) delivered to enabling environment actors
Description: The policy recommendations developed will contain a set of practical interventions to ensure wide adoption of EPC mechanisms across both the public and private sector in South Africa.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Energy Performance Certificates (EPCs) issued for a sample of state- and privately-owned buildings
Description: The issuance of the first EPCs for both private and public buildings sample buildings will, in effect, bring the National Energy Act regulations for the “mandatory display and submission of EPCs for buildings” into effect. However, importantly, learnings generated in arriving at this point (i.e. through working with building owners to collect and process data into an EPC-ready format) will be consolidated for the purpose of the roadmap described in the next output.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Roadmap for replication and improving EPC compliant data collection for state- and privately-owned buildings
Description: The roadmap will incorporate lessons learned in process of collecting data and issuing EPC's, as per the previous output. It is envisaged that the roadmap will be an invaluable tool for assisting both private and public sector in obtaining EPCs for their buildings and, resultantly, being able to identify EE improvement opportunities that lead to both monetary and carbon savings

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: 1st webinar of awareness raising roadshow for public and private sector stakeholders
Description: The roadshow will entail 2 engagements set a month apart (to maximise audience reached) for both the public sector (through SANEDI) and the private sector (through GBCSA members) to mainstream the NBEPR, and highlight is role in helping building owners become compliant with the upcoming EPC legislation (Notice 700 of 2020). We expect 50+ participants to attend, and will target individuals in decision making roles especially.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: 2nd webinar of awareness raising roadshow for public and private sector stakeholders
Description: The roadshow will entail 2 engagements set a month apart (to maximise audience reached) for both the public sector (through SANEDI) and the private sector (through GBCSA members) to mainstream the NBEPR, and highlight is role in helping building owners become compliant with the upcoming EPC legislation (Notice 700 of 2020). We expect 50+ participants to attend, and will target individuals in decision making roles especially.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Agenda 2030 sustainable development team
Result_Title: Develop Mexico's national strategy for sustainable growth and investment and contribute to the development of policy frameworks for sustainable finance
Description:
A government strategy for sustainable growth and investment, following on from  Presidencia's legislative strategy for Agenda 2030 implementation. Expected to serve as an umbrella for how an increase in sustainable investment can be achieved by bringing together funds, actors and innovative methods for financing.

The secondments will look for areas where the Agenda 2030 team's involvement can help advance federal frameworks for green finance. These areas may include consolidation of taxonomies for sustainable investment and ESG criteria, supporting the work of the Finance Ministry's Sustainable Finance Committee.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Agenda 2030 sustainable development team
Result_Title: Strengthening the sustainable development planning of Government of Mexico's projects and programmes
Description: Project-specific input from the government's cross-cutting sustainable development team into priority initiatives, making recommendations and seeking improvements to the sustainability of how they are carried out. This may include input to the trans-isthmic corridor and Sembrando Vida tree-planting programmes.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Agenda 2030 sustainable development team
Result_Title: Strengthening the Government of Mexico's engagement with the private sector on sustainable development ahead of COP26
Description: Strengthen the dialogue between federal government and the business community on sustainable development, with the aim of identifying opportunities for both to help the other, and of raising businesses' ambition on climate and sustainable development, mobilising relevant actors for commitments in the run-up to COP26.

Project: Mexico Secondments: Agenda 2030 sustainable development team
Result_Title: Recommendations on the uptake of sovereign investment in Mexico (Sovereign Sustainable Development Goals Bond)
Description: Following the issuance of Mexico's first sovereign bond tied to sustainable development, the secondees will lead on reporting on its impact. There may also be opportunities to share experience from the federal level with subnational governments and support the wider uptake of borrowing for sustainable public investment.

Project: Climate Transition Pathways
Result_Title: Low Carbon Pathways Report (2.2)
Description: The Low Carbon Pathways report will provide findings from the climate transition research and provide analysis on transition pathways and impact on job and social dimensions in electricity, mining, petro-chemical, and topical sectors, and will provide recommendations to the South African business community on developing, financing and implementing low-carbon pathways . The chapters will also be published as standalone documents.

Project: Climate Transition Pathways
Result_Title: Low Carbon Pathways Report (2.1)
Description: The Low Carbon Pathways report will provide findings from the climate transition research and provide analysis on transition pathways and impact on job and social dimensions in electricity, mining, petro-chemical, and topical sectors, and will provide recommendations to the government on developing ,financing and implementing low-carbon pathways . The chapters will also be published as standalone documents.

Project: Climate Transition Pathways
Result_Title: Recommendations for transition to low carbon economy
Description: Recommendation for proposed policy made to the DEFF and Department of Energy for South Africa on how to transition to a low carbon economy ahead of COP 26.

Project: Climate Transition Pathways
Result_Title: Low Carbon Pathways Report Launch
Description: A launch event to showcase the report produced incorporating all the research and inputs from stakeholders.

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: 4-day workshop with Veracrúz State Energy Agency on designing energy access programs
Description: Conduct 4-day training. The workshops aim is to create materials and resources, and to develop the skills and understanding of senior managers and managers, to assist them to have a better understanding of how energy access programs can be designed to satisfy the end-users needs, whilst being financially and technically sustainable. 12 hours of training in total
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Result_Title: 45 meetings with potential funding partners (15 for each state)

Description: Develop a pipeline to successfully achieve 15 potential investors meetings for each state, that can evolve to funding for energy access programs
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Policymaker's handbook on sustainable energy access programs
Description: 200 field visits to off-grid communities, data collected and processed, and 1 handbook developed that encompasses the information collected through field visits and workshops that can be used by policymakers to implement sustainable energy access programs
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Technical assistance for developing sustainable energy access strategies in Mexico
Result_Title: Conduct 4-day training. The workshops aim is to create materials and resources, and to develop the skills and understanding of senior managers and managers, to assist them to have a better understanding of how energy access programs can be designed to sat
Description: Conduct 4-day training. The workshops aim is to create materials and resources, and to develop the skills and understanding of senior managers and managers, to assist them to have a better understanding of how energy access programs can be designed to satisfy the end-users needs, whilst being financially and technically sustainable. 12 hours of training in total
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Establishment and institutionalisation of a Green Finance Task Force (GFTF) within CNBV
Description: This output aims to establish a network of key actors in green finance in Mexico. A task force group on green finance is needed to support coordination and communication among relevant areas within the CNBV. It will provide clear guidance in case of high employee turnover, ensure all efforts permeate evenly within the Commission and inform subsequent soft and hard regulation of the financial sector. Through the engagement with the Green Finance Task Force, a permanent Working Group will be established towards the end of the project to ensure continuity and follow up on the developing efforts on sustainable finance beyond the project. There are seven directorates initially identified to form part of the taskforce.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Webinar to disseminate the recommendations report on international best practices and emerging regulation for ESG integration and climate related risks disclosure by financial intermediaries
Description: This webinar will be used to socialise the report and its recommendations to a wider audience

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Webinar to disseminate the report and policy briefs developed on Green Financial Inclusion
Description: This webinar will be used to socialise the findings and recommendations in the report and policy briefs to a wider audience

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Report and policy briefs developed on Green Financial Inclusion
Description:
This output aims to provide recommendations (via report/policy brief) on green financial inclusion. Climate change impact has not been researched alongside financial inclusion, which is particularly relevant due to Mexico’s high climate vulnerability and social context. Hence, based on international good practices and the sustainability-climate-financial inclusion nexus, research and analysis will be performed on: 
• Financial inclusion challenges and opportunities for Mexico in a climate change context: Designing and improving access to financial products/services 
• Integration of gender considerations as part of ESG and climate risk analysis and gender-mainstream Financial products and services in Mexico
• Increased access to financial services for people with disabilities in Mexican commercial banks

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Report developed on international best practices and emerging regulation for ESG integration and climate related risks disclosure by financial intermediaries
Description: This recommendations report aims to develop will condense and present international best practices and emerging regulations for ESG integration and climate risks. It will incorporate research and analysis on international best practices and strategies on how to raise awareness, communicate, regulate ESG standards and integrate climate-related risks across the financial intermediaries (covering prudential regulation, including but not limited to supervision of governance and capital requirements, as well as stock markets regulation). The report will also analyse how to establish financial targets based on climate change stress tests. The Report will be a comparative perspective that presents relevant opportunities to advance integration of ESG standards and climate-related risks in Mexico’s financial sector.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Green finance dissemination campaign developed to raise CNBV’s awareness and support institutional transformation
Description: This output aims to disseminate  material/products on green finance. A dissemination campaign will be developed and implemented throughout the project’s life cycle to foster awareness and knowledge/understanding of ESG and green finance. Contents will be developed based on the outputs 1,2, 3, 4, and disseminated every two months. The dissemination material will support capacity building efforts and disseminate reports findings. Output activities will be developed in closed collaboration with CNBV’s Communication (internal and external) Directorates  and other relevant Directorates.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Green finance self-assessment tool for financial intermediaries
Description: This output aims to support a green finance self-assessment tool for financial intermediaries. The tool that allows regulated actors to assess where they stand on integrating ESG standards into FIs operations and decision-making processes and what specific actions they can undertake to increase their ESG capacities and integrate climate related risks into their operations and analyses. This is needed as FIs require guidance to identify the gaps they need to close regarding environmental, social, gender and climate-related risk to green their portfolios and mobilize green resources.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Modular online training content for new staff to be integrated into CNBV’s standard onboarding protocol
Description: The online training will be composed of 3-5 online modules equivalent to approx. 20hrs of training on ESG and climate risk developed and institutionalised

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Knowledge exchange and communication products developed and delivered based on findings and results of the outputs 2, 3, 4
Description: This output aims to disseminate communication products on the findings of previously implemented outputs. The output will establish and facilitate virtual mechanisms to openly share international best practices, experiences and know-how on ESG standards and climate-related risk among different stakeholders. These products are needed to share key messages to the sector towards greening the financial system; hence, influencing and bolstering efforts of actors towards acting on integration and disclosure of ESG standards and climate-related risks.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: Training delivered on Green Finance (ESG and climate-related risks and opportunities) to CNBV staff
Description:
This output aims to train key green finance actors (CNBV staff) on ESG and climate risk. The training will strengthen CNBV’s staff capacities on green finance through the following modalities is required to accomplish the international and national commitments on greening the financial sector:
1.	Three online technical workshops (due to covid-19) for GFTF members and CNBV staff
 - one webinar delivered to 40 people, 40% women;
 - two delivered to ten people in the Sustainable Finance Committee, four women)

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: Workshop 1: for pilot participants to feed into engagement framework design
Description: Workshops for pilot participants to feed into engagement framework design. We will aim for about 10 participants for each workshop

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: Workshop 3: to test Engagement Framework with investee companies
Description: Workshop for testing engagement framework with investee companies. Will aim for about 10 participants.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: Report to Chinese regulators on how to scale ESG across asset classes for pensions and insurers
Description: Recommendations report delivered to Chinese regulators, underpinned by research and recommendations and encorporating their feedback. The report will include an index and roadmap for asset owners.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: Recommendation report based on Asset Manager-Investor Engagement Framework pilot
Description: Asset Owners and Managers not participating in engagement pilot will be able to learn lessons from pilot participants. This will allow asset owners and asset managers to better engage with investee firms, holding them accountable on environmental, social, and governance issues. As part of the recommendations report, we will publish the framework used in pilot.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: ESG Awareness Campaign and Roadshows (Beijing)
Description: Physical workshops will be conducted in key financial cities in China (Beijing) to communicate the recommendations and lessons learnt with a wide range of Chinese financial institutions and relevant regulators.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: ESG Awareness Campaign and Roadshows (Shanghai)
Description: Physical workshops will be conducted in key financial cities in China (Shanghai) to communicate the recommendations and lessons learnt with a wide range of Chinese financial institutions and relevant regulators.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: ESG Awareness Campaign and Roadshows (Shenzhen)
Description: Physical workshops will be conducted in key financial cities in China (Shenzhen) to communicate the recommendations and lessons learnt with a wide range of Chinese financial institutions and relevant regulators.

Project: Capacity building for green investment and the Green Investment Principles(GIP)
Result_Title: GFLP capacity building event held by BIFS
Description: BIFS will hold this capacity building event through the Green Finance Leadership Platform(GFLP) to raise awareness of policy makers and financial regulators on the climate and environmental risks and urgency for policy change, educate investors on how to integrate climate and environmental factors into investment decision-making, and build the capacity for making more green investments. This event will target global attendees including existing and perspective GIP members. This event, similar to previous GFLP events, will likely be a multi-day event. More details on number of training participants and event duration are to be confirmed taking into consideration the latest development of COVID distruption.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Project: Capacity building for green investment and the Green Investment Principles(GIP)
Result_Title: Green Finance Training Session for Central Asia
Description:
The output will be delivered as an training session which will be tailored with local heated topics and market situation. The main objectives of this training session will  include:
1) Encouragement of green investment among financial institutions in Central Asia
2)Enhanced climate and environmental risk management capabilities
3)Communication among all key stakeholders for sharing the best practice in green finance
4) Tailored regional questions to be answered, such as how financial inclusion help to solve the local social problems or specific high carbon industries (energy, transport) could deal with transition risks
More details on number of training participants and event duration are to be confirmed taking into consideration the latest development of COVID distruption.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

1) Encouragement of green investment among financial institutions in Southeast Asia
2)Enhanced climate and environmental risk management capabilities
3)Communication among all key stakeholders for sharing the best practice in green finance
4) Tailored regional questions to be answered, such as how financial inclusion help to solve the local social problems or specific high carbon industries (energy, transport) could deal with transition risks. More details on number of training participants and event duration are to be confirmed taking into consideration the latest development of COVID distruption.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Project: Capacity building for green investment and the Green Investment Principles(GIP)
Result_Title: Green Investment Principles annual report and recommendations
Description: An annual report with main findings on overall and individual progress, implementation gaps and options for further actions, including areas for capacity building. May include the potential for revising the principles (e.g. GIP 2.0) to better reflect the evolving BRI, performance and demand of the GIP members, as well as changes of standards and technical progress.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Project: Capacity building for green investment and the Green Investment Principles(GIP)
Result_Title: White Paper on Insights from Green Projects by GIP Members
Description: This report will look into the details of some proud green investment projects by GIP Members and provide in-depth analysis on those projects, including environmental risk management throughout the whole process.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Project: Capacity building for green investment and the Green Investment Principles(GIP)
Result_Title: Media campaign with publications featuring demand and supply of green finance capacity building in the key regions along the B&R
Description: Communications for both GIP and non-GIP members. Output will include improved websites for GIP and the GFLP, newsletters, regular updates on the contents, communication disseminated and other writeups post events. The above communications products will be reported quarterly.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: First training workshop with key financial institutions on new environmental risk mitigation systems
Description: 2-day training workshop with more than 50 relevant participants on topics such as climate risk, disclosure, and the operationalisation of the GIP and GDG, enhancing their awareness and capacity of applying these new environmental risk mitigation systems.

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: Second training workshop with key financial institutions on new environmental risk mitigation systems
Description:
2-day training workshop with more than 50 relevant participants on topics such as climate risk, disclosure, and the operationalisation of the GIP and GDG, enhancing their awareness and capacity of applying these new environmental risk mitigation systems.

The focus of the training may be slightly different from first workshop as above, and some participants may also be slightly different. The second training will go deeper into certain aspects, and incorporate learning and follow up from the first session.

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: First workshop to harmonise GIP and Green Development Guidance with one another and with international best practices, as well as draft report of recommendations
Description: Harmonisation workshop with more than 20 relevant participants each focusing on further development, alignment, and operationalisation of GIP and Green Development Guidance, with policy makers and key financial institutions. Involving these target groups in the process, and providing the recommendations, will encourage stakeholders to adopt feasible and suitable approaches to mitigate climate change and reduce CO2 emissions in their investments and projects.

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: Second workshop to harmonise GIP and Green Development Guidance with one another and with international best practices, as well as final report of recommendations
Description: Harmonisation workshop with more than 20 relevant participants each focusing on further development, alignment, and operationalisation of GIP and Green Development Guidance, with policy makers and key financial institutions. Involving these target groups in the process, and providing the recommendations, will encourage stakeholders to adopt feasible and suitable approaches to mitigate climate change and reduce CO2 emissions in their investments and projects.

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: Press release to mark key project progress
Description: A set of communications products will be developed, including one or more press releases to mark key progress  in greening the BRI. These materials will help to increase attention, discussion and confidence among China’s government and financial institutions regarding the adoption of environment and climate risk mitigation measures.

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: Publicly presentable version of the training curriculum used in the training workshops with key financial institutions on new environmental risk mitigation systems
Description: A publicly presentable version of the training curriculum. These materials will help to increase attention, discussion and confidence among China’s government and financial institutions regarding the adoption of environment and climate risk mitigation measures.

Project: Harmonisation and capacity building for green finance in Belt and Road Investments
Result_Title: Recommendations report to harmonise GIP and Green Development Guidance with one another
Description: A publicly presentable version of the final recommendations report. These materials will help to increase attention, discussion and confidence among China’s government and financial institutions regarding the adoption of environment and climate risk mitigation measures.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Record of engagement, support and training to FIs towards enhanced disclosure
Description: Engage and build capacity of targeted FIs to respond CDP Financial Services Sector Questionnaire with aim to increase disclosure of FIs by 30% against baseline of 7 disclosers in 2020 cycle. A focus on financed impacts with increase transparency between FIs and their client companies to create change through the market.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Workshop in Beijing to build knowledge and capacity of stakeholders on disclosure and TCFD alignment.
Description: Collaborative online/onsite workshops to build skills of 100 stakeholders on environment disclosure in line with TCFD and to support the implementation of national/Shenzhen green finance policies.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Workshop in Shanghai to build knowledge and capacity of stakeholders on disclosure and TCFD alignment
Description: Collaborative online/onsite workshops to build skills of 100 stakeholders on environment disclosure in line with TCFD and to support the implementation of national/Shenzhen green finance policies.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Workshop in Shenzhen to build knowledge and capacity of stakeholders on disclosure and TCFD alignment
Description: Collaborative online/onsite workshops to build skills of 100 stakeholders on environment disclosure in line with TCFD and to support the implementation of national/Shenzhen green finance policies.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Engagement and capacity building of  corporates towards TCFD aligned disclosure
Description:
Engaging (emails, skype calls and face to face meetings) with 300 companies from high emission impact sectors to achieve 15% increase in the number of listed companies disclosing TCFD aligned information against 65 CDP respondents in 2020; and supporting FIs to manage their investment in these sectors.

This engagement and capacity building event will be held in each quarter.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Report of gap analysis of disclosure status against TCFD alignment of Chinese members of China-UK Pilot group.
Description: Gap analysis report following technical support to pilot companies and subsequent  gap analysis of disclosure status (and quality) of pilot listed companies against TCFD alignment.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Report of comparative analysis of environmental and climate disclosure policies, including HK and Mainland China.
Description: Review and comparative analysis of updated environmental/climate disclosure policies by main countries/regions, including policies of HK and Mainland China, enabling policy makers to be better informed of trends and changing trends and international best practice and comparative alignment of China's climate disclosure policies.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Report of GHG emissions data of CSI 300 index companies
Description: Produce 2 years CDP-modelled GHG emissions data of CSI 300 index companies, to equip investors with comparable and consistent GHG data and enable them to quantify the climate impact of their investments and therefore able to mitigate related risks. Data quality and comparability in China is a key concern across all sectors, and modelling data will not only support investors in the immediate term but will also provide the foundations for and efficient green finance market.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Anthology of case studies illustrating best practice  to measure  climate risks and facilitate ESG investment
Description: Compile case studies and disseminate an anthology of best practices of environmental data to measure the climate risks and facilitate ESG investment.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Panel discussion at COP 26 side event (online or in person) with dissemination of report to attendees
Description: Organise a panel discussion at COP 26 side event (online or in person) sharing the work of Chinese-UK pilot group and progress/achievements on corporate disclosure.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Dissemination to Chinese and UK media channels progress report with case studies illustrating best practice amongst the members of the China-UK pilot group
Description: Compile progress report focusing the improvement of Chinese companies, disseminate work through at least 2 Chinese and 2 UK media channels.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Assessment report of readiness of Chinese listed companies and FIs for TCFD-aligned disclosure
Description: Assessment of readiness of Chinese listed companies and FIs for TCFD-aligned disclosure, and dissemination of key findings with  policy makers, investors and companies.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Key TCFD technical materials and reports in Chinese. Chinese web page of TCFD knowledge hub
Description:
Compile and translate key TCFD technical materials and reports to share with key stakeholders.
Set up web page in Chinese on the TCFD knowledge hub for easy access and dissemination of materials.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: GESI briefing paper
Description: A foundational GESI briefing paper will be prepared drawing on existing published research. The timing of this will align for dissemination at key project workshop events listed in above sections.

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Meetings providing technical support for sub national supervisory agencies of Shenzhen, Shanghai, and Beijing
Description:
Technical support for policy makers from local governments (at least one meeting for each supervisory agency of Shenzhen, Shanghai, and Beijing) to exchange research learnings, trends in environment disclosure, and insights.

These technical supports will be provided in Beijing and Shanghai in Q2, Shenzhen in Q3

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: A record of key dialogue  issues aired  among key stakeholders
Description:
Facilitated dialogue with  key policy stakeholders at key CDP events, including CDP China annual report launch event, training workshops and CDP side events at COP26. The dialogue will bring together key players at national and sub national level that have influence on FI and corporate disclosure and reporting landscapes. Participants will share information, express a common voice on areas of mutual interest. The dialogue will aim to promote greater coherence and consistency and develop practical ways to bring alignment to the direction, content and ongoing development of reporting frameworks, standards and related requirements. A record of key issues aired will be recorded and extended across the dialogue sessions.

These events will be held in Beijing in Q2, Shanghai in Q3 and at COP 26 in Q4

Project: Promoting green recovery by championing the power of disclosure, transparency and UK-China collaboration
Result_Title: Chinese-UK Pilot group networked for exchange towards improved TCFD aligned disclosure
Description:
Establish Chinese-UK Pilot group of a minimum of 4 Chinese and 4 UK companies in environmental high impact industries to leverage learning and grow international dialogue towards quality disclosure aligned to TCFD and international standards.
Run 2 quarterly group webinars with UK companies to share knowledge with Chinese companies.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Investor-focused capacity building webinar to China-based asset owners on green bond market trends and to promote taxonomy-based investment screening and disclosure
Description: Investor-focused capacity building workshops to China-based asset owners on green bond market trends and promote taxonomy-based investment screening and disclosure.The attendees are expected to be in the range of 50-60, and the workshops will last for 2-3 hours.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: 1-day off-line workshop discussing green bond and sustainability bond standards, and a case study of innovative green debt instruments in facilitating sustainability action projects
Description: Collaborating with Tsinghua GFD Center to deliver an off-line training workshop on green bond and sustainability bond standards, the case study completed in Activity 2.2, and potentially Tsinghua’s work with the ISO on Sustainable Finance standardization.The number of attendees is expected to be around 80-100, and the workshops will last for half day to one day.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Recommendations report on harmonizing Chinese and international green taxonomies
Description: Final report with detailed analysis and recommendations on harmonizing  Chinese and international green project/asset standards and definitions

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: A report on the demonstration of compliance for China's green bond market participants
Description: An in-depth report on the demonstration of compliance, together with recommendations on how green bond market participants can further harmonize Chinese domestic rules and the requirements between China and the international markets.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Report on the demonstration of compliance for Chinese financial market participants
Description: An in-depth report on the demonstration of compliance, together with recommendations on how financial market participants can further harmonize Chinese domestic rules and the requirements between China and the international markets.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Report assessing the effectiveness and gaps of existing policies along with policy recommendations
Description: A report with a set of recommendations on how China’s central and local governments can further scale up the available financing for low-carbon transition through innovative and tailored policy incentives.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Issue paper on how innovative green debt instruments can facilitate sustainability action projects in China
Description: An issue paper on how innovative green debt instruments can facilitate sustainability action projects in China, with an indepth case study.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Final issue paper on financing low-carbon transition in China
Description: Final issue paper on financing low-carbon transition in China with 1-2 case studies on financing low-carbon transition in steel/hydrogen sector.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Green BRI project database
Description: Completion of the BRI green project database after a couple of rounds of demonstration of the BRI green project database product to invited audience. The database will support major financial institutions (e.g. BOC, ICBC, CDB, CCB etc.) that lend to the EM/BRI countries, many of whom are also signatories of the Green Investment Principles for the Belt and Road (GIP), to better identify green investment opportunities that aligned with international best practices in terms of contribution to climate goals.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Workshop launch of the green BRI project database
Description: Launch of the the BRI green project database at a dedicated workshop jointly organized by CBI, Refinitiv and GFC. The attendees would be primarily GIP members and we are targeting 30-40 attendees. The format would be presentation and roundtables, with Q&A sections.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Market blog and Quarterly Newsletter
Description: Market blogs and quaterly newsletters are produced by Markets Intelligence team on the latest trends in global green bond market.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: China Green Bond Market Annual Report 2020
Description: An annual report on the market development of the Chinese green bond market for 2020.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Climate Bonds Assurance Roundtables
Description:
Host of quarterly Climate Bonds Assurance Roundtables for the 17 of CBI's Approved Verifiers in China (e.g. EY, PwC, Deloitte, CCX, Lianhe Equator etc) who served as a primary green bond verifier in China. The attendees are expected to be in the range of 15-20, and the workshops will last for 2-3 hours.

The Assurance Roundtable is to provide a collaborative platform for Chinese green bond verifiers and prospective verifiers to share first-hand experiences and discuss the principles, approaches and practicalities of the Chinese and international green bond standards and certification scheme, in order to enhance capacity. The CBI team will also present on the progress of industry standards for climate bond certification, other regional/intl standards, and the key findings of the CBI issue papers.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Webinar of investor engagement
Description: Networking webinar on promoting understanding of investor appetite and showcasing green projects. This webinar aims to be part of the effort of creating a group of "first movers" to establish/strengthen climate-related networks among green bond investors, underwriters and issuers between Chinese and international market, and to enhance the capacity and influence of this group of practitioners in the making of policy agenda and market decisions that have implications on expediting the reduction of carbon emissions.

Project: Accelerating high-quality growth in China’s Green Bond market and supporting post-COVID green economic recovery
Result_Title: Side event in China Social Investment Forum week with the theme around Green bonds
Description: Side event in China SIF week with the theme around Green bonds, with the aim to enhance the knowledge of the market participants in terms of international standards and best practices, the development of green/thematic bonds market, and the green investment opportunties. The attendees are expected to be in the range of 50-60, and the workshops will last for 2-3 hours.

Project: Creating Enabling Conditions for Just Transition in México
Result_Title: National Just Transition Forum
Description: National Just Transition Forum.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Review and analysis of state of the art technologies for green hydrogen production and use in the energy and industry sectors (Report)
Description: A review of green hydrogen technologies in the energy and industry sectors, a review of national and international case studies of green hydrogen production projects in the previously mentioned sectors, and a map of key green hydrogen actors in Mexico and the United Kingdom.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Webinar on the opportunities for green hydrogen in Mexico and presentation of the existing technologies and experiences
Description: This dissemination event will present the results from the first Quarter and materials will be prepared from the project results. The event will include presentations from actors identified at this stage. This dissemination event is needed so that a green hydrogen network of actors is initiated. Given the current COVID-19 pandemic, this dissemination event will be delivered online. It is expected to have approximately 50 participants.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Green hydrogen implementation roadmap for Mexico, including assessment of GHG mitigation potential
Description: A roadmap document from the identification of possible barriers, opportunities, and co-benefits for a pilot project that could be replicated for a larger number of pilot projects. This report will include information received from interviewed stakeholders. As part of the report, a best practice manual considering GESI aspects for a pilot project will be included.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Networking visit to green hydrogen experts in the UK
Description: Visit to the main green hydrogen experts in the United Kingdom for key actors in Mexico (government officials, private sector and civil society) to establish a network that could grow so that a Mexico-UK collaboration can implement a pilot project in the future. Additionally, the visit will serve to obtain feedback from UK leading experts and establish a contact with potential presenters for the final dissemination event.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Dissemination event on the results of the assessment of green hydrogen greenhouse gas mitigation potential in Mexico and the UK experience
Description: This dissemination event will gather experts from the UK and present the results from the project. The aim is to provide information and consolidate the network of interested agents. Moreover, final comments and feedback can be obtained.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Assessment of green hydrogen as a mitigation option and its costs for Mexico’s NDC (Report summary)
Description: A summary of the project will be provided to INECC so that this can be included in Mexico’s NDC. This summary will also be provided to INEEL and the other beneficiaries.

Project: Assessment of the greenhouse gas mitigation potential of hydrogen. An implementation roadmap for Mexico
Result_Title: Establishment of a green hydrogen network enhancement hub on Mario Molina Center's website
Description: As part of the Mario Molina Center’s website a special section will be created so that this section contains all results from the project and serves as a hub for a hydrogen network of actors in Mexico.

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Evaluation report on the current state of the public charging infrastructure for electric vehicle
Description:
The report will be three parts:
1. Evaluation of the current state of the public charging infrastructure for electric vehicles, in the proposed dimensions: 
   a.Environmental, air quality and energy contribution
   b.Integrated and sustainable mobility (supply / demand approach)
   c.Development of new markets and inclusive economic growth 
   d.Decrease in inequalities and gender gaps
2. International experience and good practices - The analysis will focus on identifying the key problem drivers, policy, financial and market factors, including research and development activities which were implemented and/or present between 2014 – 2019. 
3.  Gap analysis and strategy for the expansion of the network charging infrastructure - we will identify gaps between the current state of the electric vehicle market in Mexico, and the lessons learned for successful deployment of electric vehicles in the international context. The output of this exercise will be a list of areas to address to improve electric vehicle take up. Including the vision of national Mexican stakeholders (public, private and civil society). For this,a session will be held with the stakeholders considered relevant.
Implementor: World Resources Institute (Centro de Transporte Sustentable de México, A.C.)

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Recommendations and risk assessment report of the expansion of the Federal Electricity Commission's Public Sector Energy Savings Program
Description:
Report with all the results and recomendations that increase the social, environmental and financial value for the expansion of the program.
For developing this report, we will do these specific activities:
1.	Define priorities with stakeholders within the current political and economic context; how much the network can be expanded, how much this expansion can contribute to elements such as the reduction of polluting material in transport. This will be with specific meetings
2.	Analysis of available and expected resources for the next 4 years
3.	Mapping of funding opportunities with international cooperation
4.	Recommendations and a risk assesment of CFE - PAESE´s expansion (Federal Electricity Commission - Public Sector Energy Savings Program)

Finally, we will have a meeting with CFE-PAESE (Federal Electricity Commission - Public Sector Energy Savings Program) and stakeholdres considered relevant, to present findings and a proposal for expansion of the infraestructura network.
Implementor: World Resources Institute (Centro de Transporte Sustentable de México, A.C.)

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Performance parameters and monitoring proposal
Description:
The performance parameters of the electric fleet in the different Metrobús corridors will be estimated and a short, medium and long-term monitoring strategy proposed (recommendations), with which detailed knowledge of the operating characteristics of the electric technology will be obtained in buses, by estimating the performance parameters of the electric fleet in the transport system of Mexico City. The specific result will be:
• Database of data collected in the field (GPS campaigns and on-board devices in the MB fleet)
• Characterization of the operations and infrastructure of Metrobus
• Performance parameters for electrification models
• Recommendations for an operation and performance monitoring of e-buses
Implementor: World Resources Institute (Centro de Transporte Sustentable de México, A.C.)

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: Macro planning exercise report
Description:
The report will be three parts:
1.	Construction of electrification scenarios at the system level (short, medium and long term) by corridor, taking as a basis the existing and planned corridors, as well as the incorporation of the electric fleet foreseen in the short term. The specific result will be:
a. Supply - demand analysis for current and future fleet and service sizing and identification of fleet segments and criteria for technological change.
b. Electrification alternatives modelling considering long term operation and technology performance and potential charging points identified.
c. Operational and energy requirements:
       i.	Fleet forcast scenarios per year by technology,
       ii.	Energy consumption and sizing of charging points

2.	Analysis of saturation of energy distribution networks in projected charging points. In accordance with the forecast of estimated energy requirements for future scenarios, the investment requirements will be estimated in the distribution network of the patios or other identified charging points ( CFE participation). The specific result will be:
a.	 Analysis of the saturation and availability of capacity in the distribution grid at the identified charging points. 
b.	Infrastructure requirements profile (charging infrastructure and energy distribution grid) D 

3.	Deepening the analysis for a short-term scenario (to be selected from: Line 1 Insurgentes, Line 4 or Line 5)
Implementor: World Resources Institute (Centro de Transporte Sustentable de México, A.C.)

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: 2 stakeholder workshops to identify possible new business models, including the conceptualization of identified alternatives
Description:
Stakeholders' main input will be cost analysis and risk matrix and analysis of operating and capital costs, based on existing financial models.
1.	Business model analysis and risk matrix:
     a. 	CAPEX and OPEX analysis and risk matrix based on existing financial models.
     b.  Strategic investment estimation (fleet, charging infrastructure and energy distribution network) - CFE participation
2.	Study of high-level economic and financial impacts,includes strategic environmental analysis, as part of a validation process of the existing financial models.
3.	Identification of investment alternatives and alternative business models for Metrobús, based on the results of the study through multi-stakeholder work groups and workshops

Two sessions are expected, one to share the general results of the study and a second session to evaluate alternative business models.

These sessions could be up to 10 people each, with an approximate duration of 4 hours.
Implementor: World Resources Institute (Centro de Transporte Sustentable de México, A.C.)

Project: Expanding sustainable infrastructure network for electric vehicles in urban transportation modes
Result_Title: 2 knowledge transfer workshops with the Comisión Federal de Electricidad
Description:
Share project results

Workshop based on the attributions of the business unit

Two high-level sessions are scheduled with approximately 10 people and an approximate duration of 2 hours per session
Implementor: World Resources Institute (Centro de Transporte Sustentable de México, A.C.)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Diagnostic report on shared knowledge of the territory’s current and future prospects under climate change
Description: We start by creating a diagnostic that charts and documents the environmental and socioeconomic state of the Apan altiplano, its main trends, and climate change’s current and potential impacts on a range of natural and man-made conditions relating to water as well as its impact on both forest sustainability and local livelihoods. We expect to produce a report containing the detailed analysis as well as other formats that will be adapted to the concerns of the different stakeholders. This will begin the cultivation of shared knowledge of the territory and of an understanding of short and longer-term impacts of climate change on water and other resources necessary to reproduce their livelihoods.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Recommendations report on inclusive and participative governance and funding for nature-based mitigation and adaptation to climate change
Description: With an eye towards implementation and scalability, we propose the creation of an inclusive governance management entity whose aim will be to foster environmental justice, ensure an equitable distribution of efforts and benefits among the different stakeholders, and provide transparency in decision-making and accountability for outcomes. Within the first year of the project (February 2021-january 2022), we will draft recommendations for the institutionalization of governance and funding mechanisms that both fit with the expectations of the main stakeholders, respect equity, inclusion and environmental justice principles, and are  compatible with the current legal system in Mexico
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Action plan report including the results of a collective priorization of potential nature-based solutions for climate change adaptation and mitigation
Description: In response to the issues identified during the diagnostic phase, our team of specialists will produce a list of potential solutions drawn from primary and secondary analysis of local, national, and international experiences and expertise. In this step, proposed interventions or solutions will be analysed in terms of potential impact, cost, feasibility, and acceptability as well as with anticipation of potentially adverse or negative effects. Through the participative priorization of water, land and forest management strategies we will refine the list of solutions highlighting the most cost-efficient ones capable of advancing climate change adaptation and mitigation efforts in Apan.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Practice-oriented capacity building training sesions for design and development of nature-based solutions
Description: Solutions identified as priority in the local context will undergo field testing, in a coordinated manner with the local actors. These tests will provide evidence of the suitability of these solutions as well as any barriers to their effective implementation, resulting in a catalogue of nature-based solutions suitable for climate adaptation in Apan and other altiplano territories. This way, we will provide practice-oriented capacity-building through collective exercises directed towards the design and development of water and soil management aimed at enhancing local stakeholders skills and experience to develop natural resources restoration capacities on their own. We will provide the capacity building sessions to at least 20 people.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Network building and establishment of a commission including representatives of the main beneficiaries to formalize a cross-stakeholder network committed to territorial management of natural resources and climate change mitigation and adaptation
Description: We start the process of convening local stakeholders, beginning with meetings targeted towards individual group leaders (ejidos, non-ejidal farmers, beer industry, urban residents of Apan). After meeting individually, we begin triangulating various dyads and triads of engagement, generating new venues of participation and co-production between various stakeholders. Through the establishment of a commission including representatives of the main beneficiaries we will formalize a cross-stakeholder network committed to territorial management of natural resources and climate change mitigation and adaptation. We will have laid the groundwork in earlier stages for these connections to be created and reinforced through consensus exercises focused on finding common ground for action.  The local commission will be established by the end of April 2021.
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Landscape conservation and livelihood restoration in the Mexican ejidal altiplano: the case of Apan, Hidalgo.
Result_Title: Targeted dissemination of products for transparency and information directed towards beneficiaries and local stakeholders.
Description:
Dissemination of main results and documents in local communities (publication of content, distribution of documents, exhibition of project results) and general communication of the project for transparency and information of local actors on progress and activities. This output will include evidence of:
- Dissemination of communications products around the diagnostic report on shared knowledge of the territory’s current and future prospects under climate change
 -Dissemination of communications products around the recommendation report on inclusive and participative governance and funding for nature-based mitigation and adaptation to climate change
- Dissemination of communications products around the action plan report including the results of a collective priorization of potential nature-based solutions for climate change adaptation and mitigation
Implementor: Eetestudio  (Espacio entre tiempo estudio SA de CV)

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: 3 tailored workshops to government on corporate climate action
Description:
Three workshops tailored to consider the needs of the government beneficiaries. The aim of this output is to integrate the SBTi as a complementary tool for regulatory and market instruments aimed at reducing GHG emissions.
Proposed workshop themes (to be explored in more detail with the government beneficiaries): 
a) Available SBTi resources for financial institutions to align their lending and investment activities with the Paris Agreement.
b) The SBTi framework and how it could contribute to enhance the NDC implementation and its transparency through private sector actions, the strengthening of corporate MRV frameworks, as well as the potential synergies with environmental audit programs and the ETS.
c) Incorporating and boosting corporate climate action of small and medium-sized enterprises.
We expect that each workshop have at least 20 attendees from key staff and teams from the beneficiary institutions.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Public-private high-level dialogue between government and private sector
Description: 1 high-level dialogue between government authorities and private sector representatives to identify challenges and opportunities faced by corporate companies to set SBTs, as well as potential incentives and government programs that might facilitate the alignment of corporate action to the national climate policy.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Establish a 'Community of Practice (CP)' for 10-15 Mexican companies and key private sector associations
Description: Build a Community of Practice for 10-15 Mexican companies and key private sector associations. The CP aims to enable the increase of private sector knowledge on corporate climate action based on science, and foster their networks to set science based targets, utimately mainstreaming the concept in their own value chains, of which many are comprised by a large number of SMEs. The CP also aims to prepare the private sector to adapt to changing regulatory and business environments demanding more accountability and climate action.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: 7 workshops with the Community of Practice (CP) to increase knowledge on corporate climate action and foster their networks to set science-based targets
Description:
7 workshops to explain the SBTi framework, methodologies, tools and other available resources; explore the creation of synergies with public policies; share experiences and best practices; explain policies and financial instruments that enable science-based target setting processes; and cover key themes related to GHG emissions reductions and SBTs to help companies internalize other important benefits such as health co-benefits, labour creation and competitiveness. The CP workshops aim to enable the increase of private sector knowledge on corporate climate action based on science, and foster their networks to set science based targets, utimately mainstreaming the concept in their own value chains, of which many are comprised by a large number of SMEs. The CP workshops also aim to prepare the private sector to adapt to changing regulatory and business environments demanding more accountability and climate action.
We will ensure that on each training we have at least 20 representatives from private sector.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Technical assistance to 4 Mexican companies to pilot the corporate support model (CSM)
Description: A corporate support model (CSM) to facilitate the setting of SBTs for Mexican companies aimed to be replicated after the completion of the project. The CSM will be tested with 4 carefully selected companies consisting of a more in-depth advisory role including key staff training sessions, assessment of their GHG inventories, and advice on target setting models and options. One-to-one meetings with companies to 1) explain the SBTi framework and the benefits of science-based target-setting and to 2) define the objectives, scope and timeline of the support model.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Recommendations to 4 Mexican companies on the science-based target setting models and options
Description: Recommendations to 4 Mexican companies on the science-based target setting models and options (through the CSM pilot), including scenarios and sectorial pathways (if available) that best suit the companies' goals
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: 2-4 case studies of the CSM-supported companies
Description: 2-4 case studies of the CSM-supported companies highlighting the benefits of setting science-based targets, the chosen routes to achieve them, and a call to action to the private sector in Mexico to strenghten the national goals and policies.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: A public learning platform for government institutions and companies with SBT content and knowledge materials
Description: A public online learning platform (most likely to be hosted on an SBTi website for Mexico) with differentiated content for government institutions and companies, including the tailored workshops, recommendations, technical content and materials on setting SBTs derived from the project activities. This output aims to enable key stakeholders of government institutions and the private sector in Mexico to count with specific materials that help to widely spread the importance of corporte participation in the national climate action and broaden the scope of the SBTi in Mexico.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Final report with insights and lessons learnt of the project
Description: A final report that summarizes the insights and lessons learnt of the project. This output aims to enable key stakeholders of government institutions and the private sector in Mexico to count with specific materials that help to widely spread the importance of corporte participation in the national climate action and broaden the scope of the SBTi in Mexico.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Closing event
Description: A closing event will be organized to present the final report and reflect on the way forward. This output aims to enable key stakeholders of government institutions and the private sector in Mexico to count with specific materials that help to widely spread the importance of corporte participation in the national climate action and broaden the scope of the SBTi in Mexico.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Training workshops with 15 local governments on emergent strategies for active mobility and public space (105 trained decision makers)
Description:
19 training workshops with 15 local governments on emergent strategies for active mobility and public space with at least 3 government areas of each one to develop their skills in the following topics (105 trained decision makers):
(1) Active mobility with Sedatu team (one day)
(9) Emergent design process (3 per group divided on 8 sessions):
