1 Planning: 1. Coordination, 2. Choice of strategy type, 3. Zone *, 4. Communication (12 days)
2 Implementation and operation: 5. Design, 6. Resource definition, 7. Implementation and operation (9 days)
3 Evaluation: 8. Monitoring and evaluation (3 days)
(3) Climate Change mitigation and adaptation actions (one per group) (3 days)
(3) Leave No One Behind (one per group)  (3 days)
(3) Road Safety (one per group) (3 days)
The output will develop during April and May, and it will delivered from June to October

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Training webinars and feedback sessions through the “Mobility projects office” program with decison makers of other local governments and non-governmental stakeholders (240 trained attendants)
Description:
4 training webinars and feedback sessions through the “Mobility projects office” program with decison makers of other local governments and non-governmental stakeholders (2.5 hours maximum each session) on the following topics (240 trained attendants): 
(1) Design and implementation process of emerging infrastructures in collaboration with Ciudad Emergente (one day)
(1) Leave No One Behind in the context of urban design and public policies for sustainable mobility in collaboration with Centro para la Sostenibilidad Urbana  (one day)
(1) Active mobility to combat Climate Change in collaboration with WWF  (one day)
(1) Road safety in collaboration with Estrategia Misión Cero  (one day)

The output will develop during May and June, and it will delivered from July to October

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Technical site visits with local government decision-makers (105 trained decision makers)
Description:
15 technical site visists (one per city and of 3 days each one) with local government decision-makers (105 trained decision makers) will be carried out in order to address the knowledge acquired by local governments in the territory as well as to better understand the context of the city, identify and evaluate critical infrastructure issues or social aspects, and to have a closer approach with local governments.
The output will develop and delivered from November 2021 to January 2022

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Sustainable urban mobility policy diagnosis and recommendations
Description:
15 diagnosis and recommendations reports (one for each local government) will be developed through a survey for each city based on indicators on the current state of the sustainable urban mobility policies in Mexico, as well as specific recommendations with targeted actions to improve mobility, climate and environmental policies.  
The output will develop from June to September, and  it will delivered on September

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Technical reviews of local government projects
Description:
45 technical reviews of local government projects (3 for each one of the local governments). Decision makers of 15 local governments will learn or improve the planning, implementation, operation and evaluation of a project of emergent infrastructure for active mobility or public space.  
The output will develop and delivered from August to October

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Follow-up technical meetings with local  government decision-makers
Description: 24 follow-up technical meetings with local government decision-makers will be scheduled between workshops with the aim of maintaining constant communication with the cities and to oversee the progress of the projects. During the follow-up meetings we will resolve doubts about the components of the projects.  The follow-up technical meetings will be divided in 3 groups of work with 5 cities in each gruop, and will be develop during 15 days. The output will develop and delivered from August 2021 to January 2022

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Digital platform with tools for local governments
Description:
Digital platform for local governments will be develop with tools such as (1) training videos, (2) formats, (3) road traffic signaling library, (4) supplier catalog, (5) parametric costs calculator, and (6) witness stories of change, as well as other inputs that lead local governments in the implementation process.
The output will develop during 2021 and delivered on July (1st version) and September (last version)

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Guide for local governments to communicate emergent strategies for active mobility and public space projects
Description:
Guide for local governments to communicate emergent strategies for active mobility and public space projects focused on guiding local governments in the development of their strategies to communicate the projects and to involve minority groups during the development of strategies for active mobility and public space. This publication will have recommendations about inclusive language and graphic design, strategies of approach with the population, territorial governance strategies, etc. 
The output will develop from March to June, and it will delivered on June

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Call for proposal to Mexican local governments
Description:
Call for proposal to invite Mexican local governments to participate for obtaining the technical assistance to implement active mobility projects. At least 20 projects are expected to be evaluated and 10 selected.
The output will develop and delivered from May to June

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Blog about the project process
Description:
Blog about the progress of the project within the digital platform. The publications will be in charge of the consulting team but there will be the opportunity for other interested persons to publish relevant material on the subject, specifically those involved within the projects in the 15 cities. At least 20 publications will be develop during the project.
The output will develop and delivered from March 2021 to February 2022

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Dissemination strategy publications, infographics, and images disseminated through allied media and public relations
Description:
A dissemination strategy will be develop to make visible the impact of the project and strengthen the relationship of multilevel work between federal government and local governments. The dissemination will be carried out through allied media and public relations. The delivery of this output will be through a memory of the publications, infographics, and images that will be disseminated through these media.
The output will develop and delivered from March 2021 to February 2022

Project: Technical assistance for the implementation of emergent design for active mobility and public space
Result_Title: Digital publication summarising implementation process, evaluation of pop-up infrastructure and lessons learned from each city
Description:
A digital publication summarising the following information: 
(1) Description of the implementation process
(2) Lessons learned from each city
The output will develop on December 2021 to February 2022, and it will delivered on February 2022

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Description of data collection
Description: GPS data collection (coordinates each second) of the 7 current lines of Metrobus, including the electric buses arriving in Line 3 (Yutong) and Line 4 (Volvo)
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Energy analysis on the electrification of the Metrobus System
Description: Analysis of drive cycles for instrumented routes and simulations of different types of technology to determine energy consumption to validate assumptions and define strategies for charging and operational viability of buses (e.g., to make adjustments in the size of batteries needed). Also to calculate the total cost of ownership for the fleet and the electrification strategy for all of the system in the next 10 years.
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Financial Model of electromobility for Metrobus System
Description: Based on existing financial models (C40 for Line 3), updated financial model to assess financing options for the electrification of Metrobus Lines 1, 5, and Periferico, with sensitivity analysis
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Recommend structure for commercial and operational models and agreements between the operator and bus provider(s)
Description: Recommendations on concession agreements and compensation models for bus providers and operators to inform the design of the electrification strategy for Metrobus
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Pitch deck materials for investors
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: 10-15 slide PPT deck to mobilize investors and commitments to support the electrification of Metrobus
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Meetings with investors
Description: Introductions to at least five relevant investors
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Demand Study for Corridors 5 & 6
Description: Demand study for corridors 5 and 6. This will build on existing demand models, with key pieces of information updated, given a fully bottom-up study is not possible during Covid-19
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Financial model for Corridors 5 & 6
Description: Financial model to help evaluate options for the purchase and operation of trolley buses for private operators
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Recommend structure for commercial and operational models and agreements between the operator and bus provider(s)
Description: Recommendations on structure for commercial and operational models and agreements between the operator and bus provider(s), including operations, frequency, number of buses, and capacity
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Accelerating Fleet-wide electrification of public transport in Mexico City
Result_Title: Two webinars or working sessions on priority topics, identified with Metrobus and SEMOVI
Description: Two webinar sessions with ~20 people to strengthen the evaluation of electromobility projects, both technically and financially. Based on discussions, we will include presentation of case studies. We will also develop a policy memo on potential regulatory structures.
Implementor: Dalberg Advisors (Asesores en Desarrollo Dalberg S. de R.L.)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: A report that evaluates the effectiveness of different information platforms to articulate and monitor climate mitigation actions in the land use sector.
Description: A report that evaluates the effectiveness of different information platforms to articulate and monitor climate mitigation actions in the land use sector. The report will look at factors such as data inputs, advantages & disadvantages, and barriers to use of each platform, as well as the potential to integrate different platforms. Report should inform decision of state and national government agencies of which platform to use, and what inputs are required of each agency.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Inter-institutional working group formed between at least three national and six state institutions responsible for agreeing on criteria to monitor the agricultural frontier to monitor progress towards the net zero deforestation goal.
Description: Working group formed to agree on key criteria, methods and instituional arrangements to define and monitor forest and agricultural frontier at the state and national level. The group will agree the methods and responsibilities for monitoring deforestation and GHG emissions between the agencies
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Updated land use maps for Chiapas, Tabasco and Campeche uploaded on EO labs and/or other platforms
Description: Updated and validated maps available on EO Lab (and/or other appropriate platform as agreed) and reports generated for decision makers to help inform policy decisions on land use
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Land Use Sector Impact Reporting Dashboard set up and decision makers trained in its use.
Description: Business Intelligence Dashboard set up on the EO Lab that brings together all existing and newly generated spatial data products & decision makers trained in its use. Ecometrica will carry out EO Lab training for government users - presentations / workshops of how to use the interface. These will be short sessions (1-2hours ) that will explain functionaility as well as how to get the most out of the platform as a decision making tool, and a plan for how best to use it going forward (e.g. what data should be developed and/or uploaded).  Target participation will be at least one representative from each target institution
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: A report that analyses the contribution of government programmes or subsidies to deforestation or avoided deforestation in the key three states & infographics presented to key decision makers
Description: A report that analyses the contribution of government programmes or subsidies to avoided deforestation (or indeed an increase in deforestation) in Chiapas, Tabasco and Campeche. It will look at programmes such as Bienstar, Agricultural subsisdies in sectors such as cocoa and coffee, payment for ecosystem services (PES) schemes and forest management programmes and include communication dissemination products such as infographics.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Early Warning Deforestation Alert System
Description: The project will set up early warning deforestation alerts linked to existing land use maps using the EO Lab platform.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Training workshop(s) on use of early warning alerts & use of Earth Observation platforms for at least 4 women and 6 men from instutions responsible for acting on deforestation.
Description: EO Lab training for government users - presentations / workshops of how to use the interface. These will be short sessions (1-2hours ) that will explain functionaility as well as how to get the most out of the platform as a decision making tool, and a plan for how best to use it going forward (e.g. what data should be developed and/or uploaded). A training (or series of trainings, as appropriate) to build capacity of institutions to use early warning deforestation systems will be more technical. IT will either be delivered as an intensive 3 day training, with follow up support (and possible "refresher" training near the end of the project), or spread out over 5-6 shorter session. This will be agreed with beneficiares depending on capacity of staff.
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Strengthening the use of Earth Observation platforms to support the implementation of climate change mitigation goals in the forest and land use sector in three states in Mexico.
Result_Title: Policy briefs for incorporating new criteria and geospatial information tools into decision making for policy and programme development to achieve NDCs in the land use sector
Description: A report, presented to key stakeholders and beneficiaries with reccommendations on a) how to incoroporate geospatial tools into decision making and b) policy recommendations for agricultural subsidies linked to reducing deforestation based on evidence generated by geospatial tools
Implementor: Ecometrica Ltd. (Ecosistemas Consultoría Integral para Soluciones sustentables)

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: First renewable energy rural electrification project designed, structured and market of private-sector led off-grid projects provided to investors
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
Identify and support the design and structuring of three private-sector led off-grid projects and assist with securing investment commitments for the implementation of the projects, through a close work with MME. Selected projects will receive technical assistance from GGGI to complete required engineering design, feasibility studies or other outstanding project needs needed to bring the project to mature design stage. Structure projects will be marketed to a wide range of possible investors to secure investment commitments leading to funding and implementation.
Target: First (out of three) renewable energy rural electrification projects designed, structured and presented to investors for funding

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Technical reports and funding proposal # 2 developed for a prioritised project to be submitted to MME´s SGR program
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
GGGI will work closely with MME’s SGR team and prioritized subnational entities to identify, support and re-submit a high-priority project that was submitted to the SGR system in 2018-2019 but did not fulfill all technical and financial criteria to receive funding. GGGI will provide hand holding support to selected subnational entities throughout the revision process to ensure questions and comments from the SGR team are effectively addressed until funding approval.
Target: Second (out of two) funding proposal submitted to MME´s SGR program

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Technical reports and funding proposals # 1 developed for a prioritised project to be submitted to MME´s SGR program
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
GGGI will work closely with MME’s SGR team and prioritized subnational entities to identify, support and re-submit a high-priority project that was submitted to the SGR system in 2018-2019 but did not fulfill all technical and financial criteria to receive funding. GGGI will provide hand holding support to selected subnational entities throughout the revision process to ensure questions and comments from the SGR team are effectively addressed until funding approval.
Target: First (out of two) funding proposal submitted to MME´s SGR program

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: webinar to announce the advancements in the development of PERS plans during the 6th Anniversary of the Paris Agreement on December 12, 2021 with high-level speakers
Description:
Deliver one (1) webinar to announce the advancements in the development of PERS plans during the 6th Anniversary of the Paris Agreement on December 12, 2021 with high-level speakers, such as IPSE’s Director, MME’s Deputy Minister and UK PACT representatives.
Target: 1 webinar delivered

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Closing webinar with high-level speakers
Description:
Delivery of one (1) webinar with high-level speakers, such as MME´s Deputy Minister, IPSE´s Director and Mr. Ban Ki-Moon 8th Secretary-General of the United Nations and current GGGI President & Chair. The Webinar will serve to 1) raise awareness about the rural electrification solutions delivered by the project, 2) share lessons learned, 3) identify opportunities for scale up and replication, 4) raise visibility of the “Certified Rural Electrification Project Developer” to drive increased use 5) collect feedbacks.

The webinar is targeted to MME, IPSE and subnational entities.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Presentation on rural electrification commercial business models for rural electrification, international best practices and gender-energy nexus presented at Colombia´s 8th Finanzas del Clima 2021
Description:
Presentation on commercial business models for rural electrification, international best practices and gender-energy nexus at Colombia´s 8th Finanzas del Clima 2021.

The presentation is targeted mainly to MME, IPSE and subnational entities.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Webinar with high-level speakers to raise country ownership of rural electrification initiatives, collect feedback and promote exchange of ideas
Description:
Delivery of one (1) webinar with high-level speakers, such as MME´s Deputy Minister, IPSE´s Director and Mr. Ban Ki-Moon 8th Secretary-General of the United Nations and current GGGI President & Chair. The Webinar will serve to 1) raise the country ownership of rural electrification support initiatives being delivered by the project, 2) discuss the advances and collect feedbacks on the “Certified Rural Electrification Project Developer” course, and 3) promote the exchange of ideas, lessons learned and innovative business models around private sector contribution to rural electrification.

The event is targeted to MME, IPSE and subnational entities.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Report and presentation on rural electrification lessons learned, best practices and business models developed
Description: Report on rural electrification analysing and outlining: a) commercial business models for rural electrification, b) international best practices, c) gender-energy nexus, and d) one case study from the implementation of private sector led rural electrification projects (output 6). Main findings and recommendations will be collected into a power point presentation targeted to MME, IPSE and subnational entities.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Third renewable energy rural electrification project designed, structured and market of private-sector led off-grid projects provided to investors
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
Identify and support the design and structuring of three private-sector led off-grid projects and assist with securing investment commitments for the implementation of the projects, through a close work with MME. Selected projects will receive technical assistance from GGGI to complete required engineering design, feasibility studies or other outstanding project needs needed to bring the project to mature design stage. Structure projects will be marketed to a wide range of possible investors to secure investment commitments leading to funding and implementation.
Target: Third (out of three) renewable energy rural electrification projects designed, structured and presented to investors for funding

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Second renewable energy rural electrification project designed, structured and market of private-sector led off-grid projects provided to investors
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
Identify and support the design and structuring of three private-sector led off-grid projects and assist with securing investment commitments for the implementation of the projects, through a close work with MME. Selected projects will receive technical assistance from GGGI to complete required engineering design, feasibility studies or other outstanding project needs needed to bring the project to mature design stage. Structure projects will be marketed to a wide range of possible investors to secure investment commitments leading to funding and implementation.
Target: Second (out of three) renewable energy rural electrification projects designed, structured and presented to investors for funding

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Capacity building training modules developed, tested & transferred to MME and IPSE for continued use by subnational entities to develop sustainable rural electrification projects and high-quality funding proposals to the SGR system and public energy funds
Description:
Development of online training modules targeting subnational entities’ capacity gaps to develop rural electrification projects and access funding from the SGR system and Colombia’s public energy funds, including FENOGE, FAZNI and FAER. Before being handed over, the training modules will be validated with MME, IPSE and subnational entities through the delivery of two (2) pilot capacity building webinars to test the content and deliverability of the training material, collect and integrate feedbacks. The training material will be bundled into a “Certified Rural Electrification Project Developer” certificate made available via MME’s and IPSE’s websites for their continued use. The course will be embedded into the training and career development plan of subnational entities’ staff responsible for the planning of rural electrification efforts.
Target: one (1) web-based training modules developed and handed over to MME and IPSE

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Working group to convene target sub-national entities established
Description:
Establishment of Working Group(s) to facilitate sharing of best practices and lessons learned among subnational entities. Subnational entities face common challenges and capacity gaps but have limited, if any, opportunities to share knowledge and build on each other experience. The working group(s) will be established under the framework of IPSE´s ongoing engagement strategy with subnational entities and will be managed by IPSE after the project implementation period.
Target: At least one (1) working group established

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Technical assessment and report on the socio-economic characteristics, energy demand and renewable energy potential to advance the development of the Rural Energization Plans (PERS) plans across prioritized Department(s) developed
Description:
Delivery to IPSE of socio-economic studies, energy load profile analysis and mapping of FNCER energy sources to inform the development of PERS plans to define medium- and long-term rural electrification and development plans tailored to location-specific socio-economic characteristics and energy needs.
Target: at least one (1) PERS plan/project advanced

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Skills enhanced of local legislators to update Quintana Roo’s Climate Change Law
Description: Two high level events to raise awareness and train legislators about the relevance of having an updated Climate Change Law for Quintana Roo to support emissions reduction according to the state’s context and necessities.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Legislation recommendations to update Quintana Roo’s Climate Change Law
Description: A reform proposal to update Quintana Roo's Climate Change Law, supported by a participative process which will include interviews to experts of different sectors, as well as an online questionnaire for general public participation.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Partnerships/Networks created and/or strengthened with relevant actors of Mexico City to harmonize Mexico City’s Climate Change Law with other sectoral legislation
Description: A document of identification of legislators interested in harmonizing Mexico City's Climate Change Law with other sectoral legislation and bilateral meetings held with relevant legislators and their advisers, and other key officials.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Skills enhanced of local legislators to update Jalisco's Climate Change Law
Description: Two high level events to raise awareness  and train legislators about the relevance of having an updated Climate Change Law for Jalisco to support emissions reduction according to the state’s context and necessities.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Legislation recommendations to update Jalisco’s Climate Change Law
Description: A reform proposal to update Jalisco's Climate Change Law, supported by a participative process which will include interviews to experts of different sectors, as well as other activities.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Partnerships/Networks created and/or strengthened with local stakeholders for the update of Puebla’s Climate Change Law
Description: A document of identification of interested legislators and bilateral meetings with relevant legislators and their advisers, and other key officials.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Partnerships/Networks created with local stakeholders for the update of state climate change laws
Description: Four multilateral meetings with local stakeholders for the update of state climate change laws.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Communication products disseminated during the whole project
Description: Communication disseminated during the duration of the project, related to the issues addressed as to increase awareness among beneficiaries and relevant stakeholders

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Guidance knowledge product of recommendations/lessons learned for the update of state climate change laws
Description: A document of recomendations/lessons learned for the update of state climate change laws and a communication event to present the document.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Skills enhanced of local legislators on the relevance of harmonizing Mexico City's Climate Change Law with other sectoral legislation
Description: Capacity building exercise with Deputies of the new Legislature at the local level and relevant stakeholders and SEDEMA.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Legislation and policy recommendations for Puebla's Climate Change Law and regulations
Description: A reform proposal to update Puebla's Climate Change Law and/or regulation proposals related to climate change, supported by a participative process which will include interviews to experts of different sectors, as well as an online questionnaire for general public participation.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Skills enhanced of local officials- Puebla
Description: Two high level events to assess the necessities, raise awareness and train legislators about the relevance of having an updated Climate Change Law for Puebla to support emissions reduction according to the state’s context and necessities.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Partnerships/Networks created and/or strengthened with local stakeholders for the update of Quintana Roo’s Climate Change Law
Description: A document of identification of legislators interested in updating Quintana Roo's Climate Change Law and bilateral meetings with relevant legislators and their advisers, and other key officials.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Partnerships/Networks created and/or strengthened with local stakeholders for the update of Jalisco’s Climate Change Law
Description: A document of identification of legislators interested in updating Jalisco's Climate Change Law  and bilateral meetings with relevant legislators and their advisers, ad other key officials.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Partnerships/Networks created and/or strengthened with local stakeholders for the update of Guanajuato's Climate Change Law
Description: A document of identification of legislators interested in updating Guanajuato's Climate Change Law and bilateral meetings with relevant legislators and their advisors, and other key officials.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Skills enhanced of local legislators to present a proposal on Yucatán's Climate Change Law
Description: Two high level events to raise awareness and train legislators about the relevance of having an updated Climate Change Law for Yucatan to support emissions reduction according to the state’s context and necessities.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Legislation recommendations to present a proposal on Yucatán's Climate Change Law
Description: Yucatán's Climate Change Law proposal, supported by a participative process which will include interviews to experts of different sectors, as well as an online questionnaire for general public participation.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Skills enhanced of local legislators to update Guanajuato’s Climate Change Law
Description: Two high level events to raise awareness and train legislators about the relevance of having an updated Climate Change Law for Guanajuato to support emissions reduction according to the state’s context and necessities.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Two legislation recommendations to harmonize Mexico City’s Climate Change Law with other sectoral legislation
Description: One proposal for each of the two sectors [TBD] to harmonize two sectoral legislations with Mexico City's Climate Change Law.  These proposals will be presented to Mexico City's Congress and will build up on the raised awareness of the previous output as to support the presentation of each reform proposal.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Two high level event forums in Mexico City with legislators at local level
Description: These two high level events will aim to raise awareness on the relevance of harmonizing Mexico City's Climate Change Law with other sectoral legislation.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Legislation recommendations to update Guanajuato’s Climate Change Law
Description: A reform proposal to update Guanajuato's Climate Change Law, supported by a participative process which will include interviews to experts of different sectors, as well as an online questionnaire for general public participation.

Project: Strengthening the Legislative-Executive-Stakeholder dialogue on Mexico's climate change and energy goals at the national and subnational levels
Result_Title: Partnerships/Networks created and/or strengthened with local stakeholders for the proposal on Yucatán's Climate Change Law
Description: A document of identification of legislators interested  in submitting a Yucatán's Climate Change Law proposal and bilateral meetings with relevant legislators and their advisors, and other key officials.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Three published case studies disseminated through the Competitiveness and Innovation System of Colombia
Description: Three (3) case studies published for sharing of lessons learned, best practices, and recommendations for replication and scale-up of the accelerator mechanism by means of dissemination along with MinCiencias, other bioeconomy / innovation-focused stakeholders (i.e. Innpulsa, ProColombia, the Vicepresidency), and other low-carbon bioeconomy business owners.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Report of at least three (3) inclusive and low carbon-bioeconomy businesses accelerated with significant potential for scale-up/rapid growth
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: 3 inclusive and low carbon bioeconomy businesses accelerated. This will trigger the advancement of the National Bioeconomy Strategy led by MinCiencias, DNP, MinAmbiente, MinComercio, and other institutions by supporting the prioritized projects to reach commercial viability. The selected businesses will receive support in the process of validation for bioproducts with MinCiencias, as well as being connected with potential investors.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Three SENA sectorial knowledge network strengthened and reinvigorated in low carbon labour force development
Description:
Three (3) SENA sectorial knowledge networks strengthen and reinvigorated in low carbon labour force development. These networks serve as a forum to enhance sectoral knowledge and ensure that training delivered matches industry needs, that the latest sectoral knowledge is shared, that the latest generation of technology is integrated into training and research, and that the needs of the labour market are met, thereby contributing to Colombia’s competitiveness and productivity. This output will focus on the following SENA´s networks:

* Environmental Network. Includes different topics such as Recycling and waste management, water treatment, reforestation, ecosystem conservation among others. Reforestation issues will be covered here with the participation of the National Federation of Timber Industry - FEDEMADERAS, and community-based organizations as the private sector and citizen counterparts.  

This will be developed throughout a series of technical meetings, workshops, knowledge exchange, and guideline documents designed together with SENA and private stakeholders to provide a clear understanding of the sectorial needs and perspectives.

* Biotechnology Network. Bioeconomy training program will be developed in cooperation with this network and the participation of private sector counterparts like National Association of Businessmen of Colombia- ANDI, and research centers as Corporación BIOS, Biointropic, BIOTEC, among others).


* Electric Energy Network. Energy Efficiency is a priority training program to be developed within this network. We will work with the Colombian Council of Energy Efficiency CCEE in order to receive significant inputs.

Progress will be presented on 2021-Q2, 2021-Q3, 2021-Q4. In 2021 there will be a workshop for all three networks.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Low carbon and green growth guidelines, models, and data visualization tool proposed and submitted for Government adoption (DNP and MADS)
Description: Data Visualization Tool to enhance the capacity of DNP and other governmental management teams to make evidence-based decisions centered on the progress of low carbon national and international agendas including the GGP, post-COVID green recovery, and Agenda 2030. that will be based on the inclusive Green Growth Index and will be designed and functional for use by national and regional decision-making teams. This output includes 1 guideline document and 1 data visualization tool for enhancing low carbon and green growth national and regional decision-making teams.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Low carbon and green growth recommendations delivered to serve as part of the Basis for the upcoming National Development Plan (NDP) 2022-2026 based on the progress of GGP, green recovery, and the 2030 agenda implementation
Description: Recommendation that frames the assessment of the GGP, green recovery, and the 2030 Agenda implementation as technical inputs for the Environment and Sustainable Development Division of DNP to be included in the formulation of the technical document (Bases del Plan Nacional de Desarrollo, or the Basis for the National Development Plan). This output will serve as a fundamental technical input upon which the next National Development Plan will be built, which is led by the National Planning Department and renewed every four years.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Three new technical capacity building program fully developed with SENA for low carbon development targeting highly demanded technical skills in key Green Growth sectors
Description: Three (3) new low carbon technical capacity building programmes fully developed with SENA for future green jobs promotion and consolidation. Considering sectorial perspectives and demands would be required new technical expertise in energy efficiency, bioeconomy, and reforestation.

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Closing webinar
Description:
Delivery of one (1) webinar with high-level speakers, such as Minciencias Minister, Environment and Sustainable Development DNP director,  GGGI Country Representative, SENA General Director, and UK embassy representative. The Webinar will serve to 1) raise awareness about the bioeconomy acceleration mechanism and bioproducts, 2) SENA´s new technical low carbon programs, 3) Harmonization of the Green Growth Policy, Post covid  green recovery strategy, agenda 2030,  4) collect feedbacks.

It is targeted to:

DNP
MinAmbiente
MinCiencias
MinComercio
Investors
Academy representatives
Subnational entities
Clusters and trade union representatives
Citizens

Project: Accelerating development of new bioeconomy businesses and enhanced capacities for green jobs promotion and increased climate action ambition from policy implementation and integration.
Result_Title: Training sessions with different representatives from DNP, MADS and other key stakeholders regarding the use of the Data Visualization Tool
Description:
Technical assistance will be delivered to municipalities and departments on using the Data Visualization Tool, which will be based on the inclusive Green Growth Index and will be designed and functional for use by national and regional decision-making teams. This output is intended to enhance the capacity of DNP and other governmental management teams to make evidence-based decisions centered on the progress of low carbon national and international agendas including the GGP, post-COVID green recovery, and Agenda 2030. 

The duration of training is two hours per session. Around 5 sessions with the target audience will be needed. The number of attendees per session will be 10, for overall attendees of 50 persons.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Technical Assistance to the Ministry of Finance to identify the pipeline of eligible projects under the local Taxonomy and Engagement Tracker
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: The special Technical Assistance to the MHCP will entail a portfolio review to identify the pipeline of eligible projects under the local Taxonomy. This screening will be useful to tag projects that will be financed by the (i) Fonclima (a fund that intends to finance sustainable projects) and (ii) other financial instruments such as the Sovereign Green Bond. The engagement with the Ministry of Finance as well as with the Fund's Senior Committee will be done through calls and virtual meetings

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Taxonomy Technical Assistance to main financial market players
Description: The technical assistance to 3 beneficiary institutions will screen and review each of their portfolios with the local and international taxonomy, while providing them the knowledge to understand the process. Beneficiary institutions will broaden their skills in identifying green assets, screening criteria and being able to replicate the process. Each technical assistance is expected to last on average 3 months, as we hold meetings, review the portfolios and provide capacity building sessions. The technical assistance will be provided to 3 different institutions. For each institution, we expect to train 20-25  participants from the institution's internal staff.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Green Bond online capacity training sessions
Description: Two (2) in-depth capacity training sessions for verifiers, Ministry of Finance, industry associations and issuers. CBI has proved its capacity to provide Green Bond online training successfully through the COVID-19 pandemic. The target number of attendees for each training will consist of 20-25 participants and the duration of each training will be of 8 hours total. The training will cover the topics of: green bond basics and market overview, market dynamics, policy overview and the Colombian Taxonomy.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Four Short Online Trainings on the green bond basics, market overview and the Colombian Taxonomy.
Description: Four short online trainings, mainly for financial institutions and potential issuers, for disseminating local green definitions and specific material to deep dive in topics requiring broadened knowledge. The target number of attendees for each training will consist of 20-25 participants and the duration of each training will be of 4 hours total. The four trainings will covered the topics of the green bond basics, market overview and the Colombian Taxonomy.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Recommendations report on the use of CASA Colombia as a local proxy to the Climate Bonds Standard.
Description: Assess CASA Colombia as a recommended local code or proxy to the Climate Bonds Standard (CBS). CASA Colombia is a local scheme for residential construction developed by the Colombian Green Building Council. As a proxy, the program would receive international recognition, and Green Bond issuers using CASA will be able to get certification under the CBS.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Recommendations report including a section on available financial instruments and a section on Sustainable Projects Structuring Framework document
Description: Procedure document that includes sustainable project structuring framework. MHCP team will develop its’ skills with regards to structuring sustainable projects. This framework, in the future can be replicated by other Government agencies and regions/cities thereby building on UK Pact’s objectives. The report will include a section on the available sustainable financial instruments which will profile the financial instruments available for financing sustainable projects and list recommendations for their employment. The document will also include a section on the Sustainable projects structuring framework document which will be drafted to recommend the procedures that will allow the fund to structure projects that have a financing structure that supports, financial returns, risk profile and sustainability goals, and with profiles of financial products available in the market for sustainable projects. This report will be of use for any public or private sustainable fund to be implemented in the future. The fund will be conceived as blended finance mechanism.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Podcast series on sustainable finance
Description:
Podcast series containing five (5) episodes related to what has been developed throughout the project.  The podcast series on Sustainable Finance targets a broad and diverse audience. We have successfully rolled this out in other markets, which has proven to be an accessible communications tool due to the pre-recorded convenience and format. This output helps bridge the gap in the market for a sustainable, finance accessible, international knowledge-sharing medium for which there is growing demand. Also, for the design of an internal communication strategy to integrate green finance.

1st episode: 2021-Q2
2nd episode: 2021-Q3
3rd and 4th episodes: 2021-Q4
5th episode: 2022-Q1

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Fund structuring webinars
Description:
Two (2) specific fund structuring webinars  to engage with the sector and disseminate the development to make sure there will be sustainability in the fund and financial instruments designed.

Targeted to MHCP

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Fund structuring recommendations report
Description: Fund structuring report that will define sustainable key indicators and a sustainable investment policy applicable for credit allocation and portfolio investment. This recommendations paper will contain recommendations for a sustainable policy that is applied both in credit allocation and portfolio investment, the fund corporate governance policy according to international governance standard and an underwriting strategy that complies with the sustainable fund's policy.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Advisory to the Taxonomy Supervisory Committee on green definitions and alignment with global standards and best practices, this will result in a Colombian Taxonomy Tool integrating all the recommendations and technical criteria
Description: Support the Taxonomy Supervisory Committee on additional technical questions on green definitions in order to ensure the Colombian Taxonomy Tool will be in alignment to global standards and best practices to the final green definitions on the Taxonomy through information sessions with CBI’s technical experts. The support to the Taxonomy Supervisory Committee will be done as recommendation through the meetings, we will record the recommendations made through the meeting minutes.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Press release on project developments and green finance integration
Description: Press release as part of the communication strategy, related to what has been developed during the project, to help integrate green finance. This has been successfully rolled out in the past in other markets, which has proven to be an accessible communications tool. If the CASA Colombia as a local proxy to the Climate Bonds Standard assesment turns out successful, the press release will be used to announce it as part of the communication products.  However, if it turns out negative the press release as a public announcement related to the project in other form.

Project: Greening the Colombian Financial System: Implementing local green definitions to enable long-term investment into priority sectors.
Result_Title: Knowledge sharing webinar on project developments and green finance integration
Description: Final webinar related to what has been developed during the project, to provide an international knowledge-sharing medium for which there is growing demand and help integrate green finance. This have been successfully rolled  out in the past in other markets, which has proven to be an accessible communications tool. Around 30 to 50 people are expected to attend this webinar and to last for approximately one hour.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Bi weekly meetings with department champions to establish network of relevant decision makers of 5 primary beneficiary departments in transport and energy
Description:
BI-weekly meetings and stakeholder engagement strategy that  guarantee the ongoing participation of key actors (governmental and non-governmental) in the activities of sectoral vision creation and diffusion. A champion from each department will became the focal point of the project and bi-weekly calls will be set to follow up and agree on project activities/timeline and continue engagement and political buy-in. 

Progress will be presented on:
2021-Q2, 2021-Q3, 2021-Q4 and 2022-Q1

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Social media campaign of the narratives constructed by journalists and influencers for different types of audiences, elaborated from the visions of the 5 primary beneficiary departments
Description: The narratives and messages built by the stakeholders and the result of the journalist and influencers’ workshop. A communication campaign will be designed to present the long-term visions of each of the campaigns in which it seeks to inform and engage the public to support the vision.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Video launches to present the decarbonization pathway narratives of each of the 5 primary beneficiary departments
Description: Five (5) videos and complementary communications materials that communicate the visions of the 5 primary beneficiary departments. The videos will be made available to relevant social media accounts, to the institutional websites in Colombia, and to the UK PACT website. We are expecting to launch all five videos in January 2022. The videos are the final products presenting the five visions developed by the primary beneficiary departments: Antioquia, Bogotá, Boyacá, Cundinamarca and Valle del Cauca.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Catalogue of policy actions for transport and energy and priority subsectors identified for 5 primary beneficiary departments
Description: Catalogue of at least 100 relevant policy actions for energy and transport that can have high emissions reductions as well as generate economic recovery opportunities and promote low-carbon jobs in these sectors. These catalogues will encompass a diverse list of mitigation actions that will help the primary beneficiaries guide their long-term vision setting.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Theoretical workshops provided to enhance skills of relevant decision makers of 5 primary beneficiary departments in transport and energy policy actions for long-term sectoral vision development
Description:
Two (2) online theoretical workshops on sectoral long- term vision setting (1 workshop per sector: transport and energy) 3-4 hours each. In this workshop the catalogs will be presented, Case Studies of policy actions, and the methodology on how to build sectoral visions.
Expected attendance: 20-25 participants per workshop.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Online workshops provided to enhance skills of relevant decision makers of 16 department governments for long-term vision for a decarbonization pathway
Description: Two (2) online workshops on pathways frameworks and long-term vision setting (primary and secondary beneficiary departments) 3 hours each. The workshops will include: Pathways Framework Presentation, E2050 Presentation, Vision Presentation, Case Study by Guest Speaker. It is the same workshop done twice. The departments will be divided into two groups to have a manageable audience. Expected attendance: 500 total participants (250 per workshop) from 16 Colombian departments.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Personalised interactive story-telling workshops delivered with journalists and influencers to build sectoral transformation narratives
Description: Five (5) workshop trainings to be held in November (one per each of the primary beneficiary departments: Antioquia, Bogotá, Boyacá, Cundinamarca and Valle del Cauca). From the narratives and storytelling elaborated from the stakeholders of the long-term visions. Journalists and influencers will get involved to learn about these narratives and visions in order to disseminate them. At the same time, they become sensitized and aware of the issue of climate change in the energy and transport sectors. Expected attendance: 20-25 participants per departmental workshop.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Long-term visions for five departments (on energy and transport) developed and presented to E2050 for alignment at national level
Description:
Five (5) long-term visions, one per department. These documents will include a long-term GHG and non-GHG target(s), sectoral coverage and expected transformation in the energy and transport sector to 2050, that have been discussed and agreed among stakeholders. This vision will be the baseline to guide governments to continue building their pathway for decarbonization in the long-term. 
Each department will have a vision for the two priority sectors.

Project: Empowering territories’ for low carbon transformation
Result_Title: Practical workshops for relevant decision makers of 5 primary beneficiary departments in transport and energy to develop long-term sectoral visions
Description:
Two (2) online practical workshops on sectoral long-term vision setting (1 workshop per sector: transport and energy) 1 day each (5 breakout rooms) OR COVID permitting 5 in person workshops (one per each of the primary beneficiary departments: Antioquia, Bogotá, Boyacá, Cundinamarca and Valle del Cauca). 
Expected attendance: 20-25 participants per each departmental workshop.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Network established to foster better coordination at the national level
Description:
WRI and CEW will collaborate with national-level NGOs and government ministries, to create a space for dialogue and coordinate different agendas towards a more cohesive national EV plan. Specific coordination channels and/or areas of collaboration will be noted in an MOU, signed by various national-level stakeholders.

Beneficiaries part of the network include National-level government (such as planning, transporting, finance ministries) and other national-level stakeholders (such as GIZ, IDB, WWF, and other NGOs).

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Market analysis and risk assessment for each target city
Description:
Market analysis to research the available e-bus makes and models, charging options, and pricing for implementing e-bus programs in each city. WRI will also research and identify key risks associated with e-bus implementation that may face each city.

Each of the three target cities will receive the assessments. The Transportation Ministry and other relevant national-level stakeholders will also receive these knowledge products.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Establish commitment with three target cities for project implementation
Description: Three target cities will be identified, with assistance from the Transport Ministry and UK PACT (as appropriate). These three cities will be approached by the project team and formally agree (through writing) that they will partake in the project.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Guidebook, highlighting the work and major takeaways from the project for a larger audience
Description: Guidebook which highlights the work and major takeaways from the project to a larger audience. This is needed to document the lessons learned in the project, and preserve them for future use.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Communications products created to disseminate the guidebook to other transit agencies and to the general public (TBD)
Description:
Communications strategy which can include articles, blogs, and/or other deliverables to disseminate the key lessons from the guidebook. This is needed to scale the impact of the project past the immediate beneficiaries. Specific products will be defined within the strategy.

These communication products will be widely disseminated, but they will be targeted specifically towards officials in other Colombian cities (primary target) and towards other secondary beneficiaries. These targeted audience may include transit agency employees focusing on procurement, financing, or operations; city staff such as within the department of transportation or mayor's office; or technical experts at local universities or NGOs.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Recommendations financing options for national players, including COVID economic recovery recommendations
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: WRI and CEW will provide technical assistance for national players and the cities they work with, through more transparent and comprehensive communication, especially on financing. These skills will help ensure that cities understand the financing options and other resources available at the national level to help scale e-bus procurement plans, with special emphasis on financing in the face of Covid-19.

Project: Preparing the Road to Zero-emission Urban Mobility in Colombian Cities: Accelerating Electric Bus Adoption
Result_Title: Recommendations proposed to help cities plan for e-bus procurement
Description:
Recommendations and  expert guidance on actions to take to initiate and increase the procurement of electric buses, to be provided at meetings between WRI and city officials. These recommendations will be needed to help guide policymakers towards viable, actionable, and timebound electrification plans.

Each of the three target cities will receive recommendations. The Transportation Ministry and other relevant national-level stakeholders will also receive these recommendations, for their edification.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Training sessions to enhance capacities of city public servants to identify and evaluate potential projects for green finance mechanisms.
Description: The trainings aim to create capacities among city public servants on the identification and evaluation procedure and the methodologies developed  in order to select proyects, and increase eligibility to access green finance, as well as to receive feedback from cities on proyects' inputs or other externalities that may affect the selction process of proyects. Specific training session will be provided and will be customized and delivered on an individual basis per city. The training program will differentiate between old beneficiary cities: Naucalpan, Hermosillo, Zapopan, and  new beneficiaries: Ixtapaluca, Chihuahua, Mérida and Villahermosa. While some beneficiaries from old cities may have received similar trainings in the previous program, new trainings will incorporate lessons learned throughout the years' program and after the end of it.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Climate related stretategic multisectoral working groups involving two or more public institutions and external stakeholders identified through the project selection phase are created/strengthened with the aim to prepare low carbon proyects for access t
Description: Once potential bankable projects are shortlisted, a list of institutions involved in these shortlisted proejects will be identified and mapped to set up strategic multisectorial teams if they do not yet exist or strengthen them if they already exist within the governance structure of these cities. The establishement of these networks between the projects and the local governments and the early envolvement of related stakeholders have been proven to be very valuable in the ultimate goal to get the projects mature and ready to access finance in a more holistic view.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: On demand technical guidance documents for cities about specific projects to support and improve their access to finance
Description: As a result of the technical assistance provided and the identified gaps and technical information needed in the project, we will develop technical studies on request of each project to support its access to green financing (e.g. market studies, environmental analyses, business models design, engineering designs, impact assesments, etc.). Since this is an on-demand deliverable, clear definition of the sectors to expand guidelines on are to be defined.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Climate-related networks between financial institutions and local governments are strengthened with a view to increase access to finance for shortlisted projects
Description: Once shorlisted  projects are analysed and suitable financing mechanisms are identified, we expect projects to find finance interest from different institutions and collaboration networks are created or strengthen. For mature projects, we will accompany the project owners to start the journey to finance and  will get them  in touch with the established network of financial institutions or investors through a matchmaking process.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Coaching for less mature projects to get ready for accessing finance and wider lesson sharing
Description: For the less mature projects identified, we will carry out a finance readiness support process, working with these projects, meeting periodically and setting tasks along the process. As part of this process, we will host a Green Finance Innovation Workshop to share the trends and best pratices in this field and maximize the potential to access Green Finance.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Training sessions (disaggregated by gender) on impact assessment (ESG & SDG), economic evaluation & financial modelling
Description:
As part of the experience and lessons learned from Programme year 1, We identified two topics that are relevant for green finance and that are critical for the success in accessing to fincancing to the projects. The modality of these will be an online workshop. Due to the specifcity and confidentiality of the information needed for the development of business models, we will deliver a separate workshop on Economic Evaluations and Financial mode the Financial modelling for each city.

1. ESG & SDG  (General  to all beneficiaries)
 2. Economic Evaluations and financial modelling (Individual per city and per project)

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: On-demand project business case documents and financial analysis to support presentation of selected carbon emissions reductions projects to potential investors
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: As standard requirements to present any project to a possible public or private investor, it is necessary to at least provide financial evaluations with  executive documents containing all relevant information from the project from the technical and economical perspectives presented in a coherent, comprehensible and attractive format.  We will develop a set  of technical/ executive documents and financial models on-demand by each project and its green finance source. Financial models will be customized depending on the project financial mechanism or business model selected or aimed.

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Webinar series on sector-specific topics to increase beneficiaries' capacities to better prepare projects for financing
Description:
Along the project we provide a series of monthly webinars from april onwards on relevant sectorial topics relevant for beneficiaries that address knowledge gaps. With these series of webinars, we aim not only to increase the knowledge of the participants but also increase their capacities to better prepare projects for financing. These webinars will be about 1.5 hrs long  delivered on a monthly basis with the participation of a senior expert on the topic addressed. Due to the fact that these webinars will address specific demands we present a list of topics that may change or modify according to the needs. The proposed topics  are: 
-Green economic recovery: the role of cities
-Smart cities: smart technologies and low carbon actions
-Water and waste management, best practices in the framework of the circular economy 
-Forests and land management: Nature-based solutions
-Financing opportunities for sustainable mobility
-Funding opportunities for land and forest management
-Financing opportunities for renewable energy and energy efficiency
-Planning instruments for climate action to Green Finance from the municipalities

Project: Green Finance for the development of Smart Cities in Mexico II, working to accelerate the implementation of low carbon local projects and sustainable development
Result_Title: Final reports, lessons learned and study cases (communication products such as publcations, inforgraphics, etc.) disseminated
Description: In order to ensure our project's sustainability several pieces of knowledge dissemination materials will be developed , theses materials include: Final Report (containing a briefing of the works performed during the year's program), Lessons learned  in the preparation and maturing as well as with the seeking of financing, Infographies with processes and methodologies. The dissemination of these documents will be made by live  presentations  and shared trough meetings, forums, as well as in our social networks (e.g. website, YouTube, Linkedin). All non-confidential products shall be made available to all interested parts.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Urban Extent Growth and Land Use Change Report
Description:
A report will be produced with two sections: 1) A comprehensive report on the urban extent and land-use change for municipalities with more than 100,000 inhabitants. This report is a quantitative diagnosis that compares urban footprint projections included in the POTs’ (Plans of Territorial Planning for the acronyms in Spanish) along with the growth experienced by cities in the last 30 years; 2) a second section of the report will be produced with the relationship between deforestation trends and land use changes compared with the land use regulations in place (Forest reserves, national parks, POMCAS -Plans for the Management of Hydrographic Bodies, indigenous reservations and POTs) for Yopal, Tumaco, Florencia, Cartagena del Chairá, and San Vicente del Caguán.

Both sections of the report and their preparatory materials (for example, the inventory of the planning instruments for the municipalities analyzed) will be hosted in a micro site inside Fedesarrollo's website.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Urban Extent Growth and Land Use Change Event
Description:
The Urban Extent Growth and Land Use Change Report will be delivered through the publication of the study, explanatory materials, and all final data in an event hosted by Fedesarrollo and NYU’s Marron Institute (webinar). The webinar duration will be 1,5 hours, in an appropriate time to maximise viewership. We expect around 250-300 participants connected, and 1,000 views of the recording at Fedesarollo´s youtube channel.

It would be targeted to:
