The Municipalities with populations of +100,000 inhabitants included in the Report, the municipalities of Yopal, Tumaco, Florencia, Cartagena del Chairá, and San Vicente del Caguán
Municipalities with hot spots of deforestation.
The National Planning Department - DNP
Colombian Ministry of Housing, City, and Territories - MVCT.
Colombian Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Report on the current institutional arrangement of Colombian land-use and environmental planning
Description:
A report that identifies the interrelatedness of existing laws, regulations, and constitutional jurisprudence on land-use and environmental planning. Furthermore, the report contributes to simplify this complexity  and to enhance the stakeholder’s knowledge, promoting better design and implementation of public policies in this field. The report will pay special attention to the interaction between urban planning environmental management, adaptation and mitigation to climate change.
The output will be delivered as a guide for navigating land use and environmental planning regulation structures. 
The report will be hosted in a micro site inside Fedesarrollo´s website, and it is targeted to:
The National Planning Department - DNP
Colombian Ministry of Housing, City, and Territories - MVCT.
Colombian Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development 
Regional, departmental and municipal authorities.
The Colombian Congress.
Colombia’s Autonomous Regional Corporations or CAR.
Urban and city developers.
Local and regional development agencies.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Report on POTs' (Plans of Territorial Planning) implementation gaps of 15 municipalities
Description:
A report describing implementation gaps of the POTs in 15 selected municipalities across the country. Proper execution of the investment program (known in Spanish as “Programa de Ejecución”) is key for the POTs’ success, especially in terms of infrastructure, housing, and public amenities development, since it is through them that the Territorial Occupation Model (“Modelo de Ocupación Territorial”) materializes. 
The report will include an initial characterisation and evaluation of the POTs’ investment plans by looking for explicit connections with climate change adaptation and mitigation measures, and with greenhouse emissions by transport and industrial sectors. Second, the effectiveness of the POTs will be assessed. The degree of their effective implementation will be determined with impact indicators. This study will be complemented with a qualitative evaluation of the plans’ results through a set of interviews with strategic stakeholders. Third, best practices will be identified through the evaluation of the alignment of different planning instruments at the local level. 
This knowledge product is needed to understand the causes behind the limited effectiveness of planning instruments, complementing current literature regarding Colombian land-use planning and highlighting key implementation challenges that need to be tackled in an eventual reform.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Report of benchmark of current international literature and practices on land-use and environmental planning instruments that directly enhance the accomplishment of the Paris agreement’s goals.
Description:
A report that contains an in-depth comparative analysis of current trends in land use and environmental planning instruments for OECD countries and the global south countries. Specifically, the study will review the relation between land-use planning institutions and policies for emission reduction and climate change mitigation and adaptation. Colombian case studies will also be included in this research as well as the relation of such policies and institutions. This analysis will include the revision of gender and ethnic equality and social inclusion policies and actions.
It is targeted to:

The National Planning Department - DNP
Colombian Ministry of housing, city, and territories - MVCyT.
Colombian Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development 
Local governments for the following municipalities: Bogotá, Medellín, Cali, Barranquilla, Bucaramanga, Palmira, Soacha, La Calera, Rionegro, Bello, Jamundí, Soledad, Malambo, Girón, Piedecuesta, Pereira.
Private sector associations and investment promotion agencies (Camacol, Prosantander, Propacífico)

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Reform program of the national regulatory framework of land-use and environmental planning.
Description:
A proposal for institutional reform of the regulatory framework and instruments for land-use and environmental planning. This reform is a crucial step towards renewing and simplifying the existing planning frameworks through the POTs, Local Development Plans, and instruments of rural planning. Simultaneously, the Project is needed to promote more effective and cohesive planning of Colombian municipalities and metropolitan areas, with a strong emphasis on the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, environmental planning, sustainable development, gender equality and social inclusion.
The reform will be formulated as an input for the electoral discussion of the 2022 presidential and congressional campaigns.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Workshop on the current institutional arrangement of Colombian land-use and environmental planning
Description: A workshop session to train key stakeholders to navigate the current institutional arrangement of Colombian land-use and environmental planning. It is expected to have at least one participant for each of the municipalities that were part of the study, as well as national government officials and private sector representatives. The workshop will be planned for a 4-6 hour session and 50 participants in total are expected.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Webinar event: Diagnosis, benchmark and reform program of Colombian land-use and environmental planning
Description: A webinar that will present the main results of the project, including an overview of the POT implementation Gaps Report, a comparative analysis of current trends in OECD and the global south countries, and the main elements of the reform program. The possibility of including a panel with presidential candidates will be evaluated.  It is expected to have 500 participants connected, and 2,000 - 3,000 views of the recording at Fedesarollo´s youtube channel.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Guides and training materials with key findings from study results (both in-person and web-based) to be used by local authorities, the Ministry of Housing and Environment and the National Planning Department
Description:
A set of guidelines based on actionable interventions that ensure local implementation will be developed. These guidelines will facilitate an effective response to the challenges of rapid urbanisation, urban planning, expansion, and the densification of Colombian cities, and will outline ways to solve these challenges in the light of climate change mitigation and emissions reductions. 

This product is targeted to:

The National Planning Department - DNP
Colombian Ministry of housing, city, and territories - MVCyT.
Colombian Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development 
Regional, departamental and municipal authorities.
The Colombian Congress.
Colombia’s Autonomous Regional Corporations or CAR.
Urban and city developers.
Local and regional development agencies.

Project: Proposal of reform to the public policy and legal framework of territorial planning in Colombia in order to comply with the Paris Agreement
Result_Title: Training workshops with local government & key stakeholders on the implementation of simplified instruments to develop local planning institutional framework that is directed towards meeting the objectives of climate change mitigation & emission reduction
Description:
Training process by which key stakeholders can understand and be empowered by a simple set of instruments to respond to the challenges of climate change, emission reductions, and sustainable urban development. At least 15 workshops will be organised (one workshop per focal city), involving local authorities and key stakeholders at the local level. Every one of the focalized cities by the project will have a separate workshop to be arranged with the local and national authorities in the last quarter of the year. We expect at least 30-40 participants in each workshop, combining public and private local representatives, national government and other key constituencies.

Targeted to:

Local governments for the following municipalities: Bogotá, Medellín, Cali, Barranquilla, Bucaramanga, Palmira, Soacha, La Calera, Rionegro, Bello, Jamundí, Soledad, Malambo, Girón, Piedecuesta, Pereira.
The National Planning Department - DNP
Colombian Ministry of housing, city, and territories - MVCyT.
Colombian Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development 
Private sector associations and investment promotion agencies (Camacol, Prosantander, Propacífico)
The Colombian Congress.
Colombia’s Autonomous Regional Corporations or CAR.
Urban and city developers.
Local and regional development agencies.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Marketing Action Plan
Description:
Two (2) Marketing Action Plans named "Forests and Peace Community Tour - Marketing Action Plan Outline", one for Quinchas and one for Perijá. This will be the result of an ongoing process throughout the year with the communities. It will be perfected and fine-tuned after each marketing workshop and trip. 

The Plan should include at least:
1. Introduction
2. Strategic Objectives
3.Implementation
4. Selecting Target Markets
5. Positioning
6. Tactic for reaching Target Markets
7. Digital Content Marketing Strategy 
8. Action plan and budget
9. Measurements/Tracking

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Updated Quinchas scientific nature booklet
Description: A Scientific Nature Booklet updated for Quinchas that will provide scientific knowledge  on biodiversity to communities and visitors which aim to support conservation efforts. The current Booklet will be updated by adding more species with the support of RBG Kew, local biologists and with an open invitation to communities and tourists to incorporate traditional and local knowledge.q3

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Useful Plants booklet for Perijá
Description: A Useful Plants Booklet of Perijá will be developed to provide scientific knowledge  on biodiversity to communities and visitors which aim to support conservation efforts. It will be created through the characterization of useful plants of Perijá with the scientific support of researchers from the RBG Kew with a participatory approach with selected local communities.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: On-the-job field training sessions with selected communities on guiding nature tours in Quinchas and Perijá
Description:
2-days on-the-job training session per region to teach communities to recognise local species and to be able to explain their importance to the tourists. 

Number of trainees in Quinchas: at least 8 people from 3 townships.

Number of trainees in Perijá: at least 8 people from the communities of Estados Unidos and La Victoria de San Isidro (Perijá).

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Culinary course that incorporates native or traditional ingredients worth showcasing for touristic purposes in Quinchas and Perijá
Description:
1-week trainings per region to enhance culinary skills of the communities to attend both the tourists' tastes and to diversify actual diets of the communities with healthy and nutritious food, hopefully locally grown. This will also support recuperating traditional knowledge on the use of biodiversity for food supply and to make a connection between healthy ecosystems with useful edible plant species. 
Number of trainees in Quinchas: at least 10 people.
Number of trainees in Perijá: at least 10 people.

The trainings will be designed with biosafety protocols in coordination with the communities.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Training booklet featuring local ingredients and traditional recipes developed for tourism purposes in Quinchas
Description:
Two (2) culinary training booklets for communities, one per region, that contains everything learned during the culinary course (cooking lessons), as well as recipes that, when possible, incorporate native and traditional ingredients, and are balanced, healthy and taste good.
It can later be used to train other interested people of the region, providing better food options for tourists.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Detailed tourist plans/packages in Quinchas and Perijá
Description:
Two (2) multi-day tour plans/package, one for Quinchas and one Perijá, that will include: : (i) A description of the regions, (ii) the expected goals of the touristic routes, inviting tourists to be part of the expected vision of change (iii) a brief description of the eco-tourist attractions ( iv) the description of the tours with the detailed itineraries, (iv) the description of the services involved, (v) the investment (cost) of the different itineraries, (vi) references to relevant tools/information including biodiversity booklets and web pages. 

Each tourist plans/packages will be tested with 3 pilot tours with real tourists, that are able to provide feedback and recommendations. Recommendations will be analysed with tourists and communities to end up with better tourist plans/packages. 
The first pilot tour will be developed with Colombians that are more connected to the communities or willing to support. The second will have one international tourist if possible and involve Think Galapagos to support in refinement.  The third one could involve an influencer, national or international tourists and Think Galapagos and Acorn experts. The tours will involve small groups of maximum 6 people. All the arrangements will be developed with the communities, testing their skills. Each visit is a multiday tour, involving various activities.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: Practical lodging/homestay guides with basic infrastructure designs, including basic costs budget for Quinchas and Perijá
Description:
Two (2) practical lodging/homestay infrastructure guides, one for Quinchas and one for Perijá, to secure homestays where communities can receive the tourists and also improve their income generating potential from their stays. Moreover, the project will ensure the improvements are developed in a very cost-effective manner. At the end, communities will be able to use their infrastructure designs to adjust their houses with their own means and even to present them to local governments or financial entities that could end up supporting their development. 

It will include a baseline assessment of possible infrastructure facilities to be improved.

Project: Supporting livelihoods through Ecotourism Routes for Forest and Peace.
Result_Title: A practical guide of financial options the communities can use to mobilise resources
Description: One (1) financial guide that collects the links made throughout the project to funds, microlending schemes and other possible funders or donors, once the communities agree to develop basic improvements to accommodate tourists (home stays). The financing schemes can also be implemented in order to improve food and beverage facilities and better transportation options.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Briefing for subnational entities on green funding and project finance for green infrastructure
Description: Briefing that elaborates on how to identify the financial vehicle most aligned to the green project or projects subnational entities are aiming to finance, focusing on repayment methods and liquidity sources. The briefing is the result of meetings with at least 14 subnational entities (either states or municipalities) that sit together individuals from the environmental ministry as well as the finance ministry.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Green Invest MX 21, an exclusive event dedicated to mobilizing capital towards green infrastructure in subnational entities
Description: A 1-day event at the Mexican Stock Exchange (ideally, it will depend on how the current pandemic situation develops) where government officials from at least 6 states and 2 cities present their green pipeline to institutional investors as well as private equity fund managers. The event will be designed in such a way that the officials get to interact with the private sector, developing new connections that allow for capital mobilization.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Design and execution of a training programme on climate change and the relevance of mobilizing capital towards climate adaptation and mitigation activities
Description: 4 trainings (live with streaming or virtual) coordinated with the support of ITAM (Instituto Tecnológico Autónomo de México) and the GFI (Green Finance Institute) to identify the link between climate change and finance, designed for regulators, government, investors, and issuers. The topics vary for each training provided, with the topic for this specific training being: 1) climate change, economy, and finance. We expect the participation of 25 people in this training.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Progress reports in the process of supporting the Comité de Finanzas Sostenibles in the design of a National Taxonomy, risk evaluation scenarios and improving ESG disclosure. Each of the progress reports will focus on a specific part of the process to des
Description: Continuous participation at Banco de Mexico's Comité de Finanzas Sostenibles , providing input  for the formation of working groups, dissemination of best practices with 2 workshops on international experiences on taxonomies and design of a public policy exhaustive report on improvement of ESG disclosure. These activities aim to develop the market infrastructure needed to mobilize capital towards green initiatives and catalyze both public and private responsible investment. The Progress report 1 will focus on Elements and Existing Efforts: this issue will include a proposal for 1) the definition of the key elements and scope for the local taxonomy, 2) processes that ensure the development of the taxonomy is well supported and is widely accepted, 3) lessons learnt and best practices to assure international compatibility, 4) incorporation of national efforts in the design of local taxonomies and standards, 5) identification of opportunities, barriers and progress of late works that may contribute to the design of the taxonomy.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Scoping study on ESG disclosure
Description: The project team will develop a comprehensive report on mandatory ESG disclosure and best practices in developed and developing economies and design a series of recommendations for regulators and market players on disclosure. Some of the topics to be included in the reports are: adoption of TCFD recommendations, financial materiality, social risks focusing in vulnerable groups, governance focusing on gender and exploration of the adoption of gradual adoption of mandatory ESG reporting. This report will also include the design of recommendations for regulators and market players and peer review by a local financial expert. The document will be written in Spanish and a 10-pager brief will also be design. A 10-pager summary in English will also be developed for BEIS. We will also provide a presentation of the scoping study in a validation workshop to Comité de Finanzas Sostenibles members in a dedicated event (online or live) and reception of comments to be addressed in the final version, which will be edited and presented as a final product.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Scoping study on Climate Risks
Description: The project team will develop a comprehensive report on climate risks and their interactions with financial and systemic risks. Topics will include methodologies and tools to analyze. climate risks and integration in investment decision making, design of climate change scenarios under Cambridge Institute for Sustainable Leadership and NGFS methodologies; mobilization of resources to finance mitigation and adaptation projects; the transaction towards a low carbon economy and the achievement of the SDGs; enhancement of the green financial offer in Mexico. The report will be written in Spanish and a 10-pager brief will also be design. A 10-pager summary. We will also hold a presentation of the study in a validation workshop to Comité de Finanzas Sostenibles members in a dedicated event (online or live) and reception of comments to be addressed in the final version, which will be edited and presented as a final product.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Design and execution of a training programme (4 editions) for listed entities on how to report under TCFD and SASB standards to improve ESG disclosure
Description: In alliance with BMV (one of the two local stock exchanges), this component will improve local ESG disclosure by bringing access to the most innovative reporting methodologies on climate and environmental elements: TCFD and SASB. Through the four editions, the course will solve many of the issues when getting started with ESG disclosure as well as standardize the public available information in the financial markets. We estimate at least 20 participants for each training.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Mexican Green Investment Plan: a study that incorporates the design of a gap analysis that identifies the infrastructure and finance flows needed to achieve Mexico's NDCs
Description: The study will incorporate a review of public available information as well as interviews with key investors, three workshops with investors and banks, presenting the results in Glasgow (at the COP26) and Mexico. Minimal content included will be: introduction, background on the Paris Agreement and Nationally Determined Contributions, background to the Mexico NDC, climate mitigation gap, climate adaptation gap, gap analysis, findings, identification of key gaps, conclusions and next steps.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Presentation of the Mexican Green Investment Plan at COP26
Description: The team will hold a presentation of the document in a side-event at COP26 in Glasgow – either official side event or unofficial. The event will include the participation of a CCFV representative, a co-president, INECC and representatives of BEIS. A detailed report of the presentation will be produced.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Campeche: Four honey production capacity-building training models designed and implemented for strengthening capacities of 100 beekeepers (25% women).
Description: SEMABICC receives the four capacity-building training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project. The training will be provided to 100 beekeepers, with 25% of them being women.  We aim to provide a minimum of 36 raining sessions of 8 hours each session, 96 hours  per quarter, covering 33 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Quintana Roo: Four honey production capacity-building training models designed and implemented for strengthening the capacities of 750 beekeepers (20% women).
Description: SEMAQROO receives the four training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project. The training will be provided to 750 beekepers of which 20% are women. We aim to provide a minimum of 32  training sessions of  8 hours each session, 85 hours per quarter, covering 250 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Quintana Roo: Four capacity-building models developed for strengthening the capacities of 750 beekeepers (20% women)
Description: Academic program with the four capacity-building models will be developed to strengthen the capacities of 750 beekeepers (20% women), allowing them to diversify their products, establish quality controls and tracebility, in order to compete for exclusive and differentiated markets. SEMAQROO receives the four training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project. SEMAQROO receives the four training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Quintana Roo: Participatory road map for continuous beekeeping production and financial improvement, planning tool for the government and for producers.
Description: A participatory roadmap for the integration of the honey value chain in the region, identifying responsibles, specific roles and sources of funding.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Chiapas: Participatory road map for the integration of a second-level organization, planning tool for the government and for producers.
Description: This will be a participatory road map for the integration of a second-level organization, identifying the requirements for its formal constitution. Inlcudes responsibles, specific roles and sources of funding.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Tabasco: Design and implement a capacity-building and management training  model linked to a cocoa agroforestry system.
Description: SBSCC receives the capacity building training model designed and the work plan to implement it in Finca La Luz, Camalcalco, Tabasco. The training will be provided to 110 producers, with 20% of them being women.We aim to provide a minimum of 32  training sessions of  8 hours each session, 85 hours per quarter, covering 37 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Tabasco: Capacity building module for cocoa practices and alternative activities
Description: Academic program with the  capacity building module including cocoa practices, as well as identified alternative productive activities, and management models linked to a cocoa agroforestry system that occupies an area of 50 hectares of forest, being an important habitat for biodiversity and an important carbon reservoir. SBSCC receives the capacity building training model designed and the work plan to implement it in Finca La Luz, Camalcalco, Tabasco.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Tabasco: Study proposing productive alternatives for farmers
Description: This study will propose alternative productive activities associated to the conservation of the agroforestry system for farmers in Tabasco

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Tabasco: Develop a plan for the Integral Management of the Cocoa Agroforestry System, planning tool for the government and for producers.
Description: This roadmap will include a  plan for the Integral Management of the Cocoa Agroforestry System. Inlcudes responsibles, specific roles and sources of funding.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Campeche: Four honey production capacity-building training models designed and implemented for strengthening capacities of 100 beekeepers (25% women).
Description: SEMABICC receives the four capacity-building training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project. The training will be provided to 100 beekeepers, with 25% of them being women.  We aim to provide a minimum of 36 raining sessions of 8 hours each session, 96 hours  per quarter, covering 33 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Campeche: Participatory road map for continuous beekeeping production and financial improvement
Description: This will be a participatory road map, identifying responsibles, specific roles and sources of funding for the beekepers to continue improving their business models.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Yucatán: Six honey production capacity-building training modules delivered to strengthen the capacities of 650 beekeepers (20% women).
Description: SDS and JIBIOPUCC receive the six capacity-building training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project. The six modules designed will be delivered as capacity building to 650 beekepers in Yucatan, of which 20% are women.  We aim to provide a minimum of 36 raining sessions of 8 hours each session, 96 hours  per quarter, covering 216 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Yucatan: Six capacity-building models developed for strengthening the capacities of 650 beekeepers (20% women)
Description: Academic program with  six capacity-building modules will be developed to strengthen the capacities of 650 beekeepers (20% women), to improve their productive, financial, organizational and governance skills, which will allow improving the the regional apicultural activity that contributes to the conservation of the 135,000 hectares of the Pucc Biocultural State Reserve. SDS and JIBIOPUCC receive the six capacity-building training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Yucatan: Participatory road map for continuous beekeeping production and financial improvement, planning tool for the government and for producers.
Description: A participatory roadmap for the integration of the honey value chain in the region, identifying responsibles, specific roles and sources of funding.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Quintana Roo: Four honey production capacity-building training models designed and implemented for strengthening the capacities of 750 beekeepers (20% women).
Description: SEMAQROO receives the four training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project. The training will be provided to 750 beekepers of which 20% are women. We aim to provide a minimum of 32  training sessions of  8 hours each session, 85 hours per quarter, covering 250 producers each quarter.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Quintana Roo: Four capacity-building models developed for strengthening the capacities of 750 beekeepers (20% women)
Description: Academic program with the four capacity-building models will be developed to strengthen the capacities of 750 beekeepers (20% women), allowing them to diversify their products, establish quality controls and tracebility, in order to compete for exclusive and differentiated markets. SEMAQROO receives the four training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project. SEMAQROO receives the four training models designed and the work plans to implement them in the municipalities cosidered in the project.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Quintana Roo: Participatory road map for continuous beekeeping production and financial improvement, planning tool for the government and for producers.
Description: A participatory roadmap for the integration of the honey value chain in the region, identifying responsibles, specific roles and sources of funding.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Result_Title: Quintana Roo: Proposal to update the apicultural law in Quintana Roo
Description: We will design a first version of a proposal to update the apicultural law in Quintana Roo  in line with  environmental and protection of beekeeping policies, given the risks of the expansion of the agricultural and livestock frointiers.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Database with clusters of representative energy demand profiles (M3)
Description:
This will be an excel database with clusters of representative energy demand profiles identified by residential, industrial and commercial energy consumers to help UPME to understand the potential for the deployment of smart technologies by sectors and geographic regions.
This output will allow UPME to improve their level of understanding of demand at the client level and its potential for flexible provision, which will help them to improve their forecasts of regional and national demand, used as key inputs to define their National Energy Plans.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Report identifying the economic benefits of ToU tariff to end-users (M8)
Description:
The report will contain findings regarding the economic benefits that the implementation of a ToU tariff will bring to end-users in Colombia and the impact on net demand.
This output is relevant because the economic benefit for end users is a key driver for action that UPME needs information on before providing recommendations on ToU tariff implementation in the country.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Delivery of a public workshop to share findings and collect feedback from relevant stakeholders (M5)
Description: Key content of the report (identifying the economic benefits of ToU tarrif to end-users) disseminated through an expert workshop, or webinar depending on Covid-19 situation, to ensure relevance, with presence of MINEM and Network Operators among other stakeholders. Presentation delivered on workshop with all beneficiaries and a relevant number of supportive project stakeholders and disseminated by email to all attendees.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Excel-based tool to evaluate the economic benefit of implementing smart energy technologies to end users (M7)
Description:
This will be an Excel tool that will allow UPME and other beneficiaries to test how the implementation of different use cases (defined by technologies and business models) will affect the energy profile of representative clusters of demand presented in the database (Output 1), and produce benefit for all the end users that can be associated to each cluster. 

This tool will help UPME to assess the value and understand how it changes depending on the use cases. And similarly, the tool will provide the network operator key insights needed to implement an offer of ToU tariff that could be interesting to their clients.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Report containing  the technical and commercial feasibility analysis for the implementation of smart technologies for each cluster of demand (M9)
Description:
This report will contain the details of the technical and commercial feasibility analysis for the implementation of smart energy technologies on each site, and an outlined description of pilots to implement will be included for each based on the findings. 

This report is needed because (i) it will complement the level of understanding on the existence of flexible demand in Colombia and (ii) will help to define where and which type of technology to implement within the sites owned by the clients associated with each cluster of demand.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Report identifying barriers to investment in smart technologies by end users and recommendations to overcome those barriers (M11)
Description:
This report will contain the identification of perceptions and the barriers to flex demand and procurement of ToU tariffs in Colombia based on primary and secondary research lead by an expert on user behaviour and smart tariffs from Imperial College London with local support from Universidad Nacional team to adapt their assessment to the local context.  

The lack of social buy-in is a significant barrier to implement and grasp the benefits of smart grid technologies. This output will address these issues and provide expert recommendations based on the learnings from the UK experience and other international cases.

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Knowledge material developed for the training modules for the Diplomados and Short Courses on smart grids and digital transformation (M4)
Description:
'The delivery of the Diplomados and Short Courses will require course content and materials.  These courses will have modules with strategic content focused on decision-makers, and others with technical content focused on the technical staff of the beneficiaries and other supportive stakeholders of the project. Final versions of content and material are produced for each of the nine decks as follows:

- Diplomados on Smart Grids
- Diplomados on Digital Transformation
- Short course on Smart Grids
- Short course cybersecurity and interoperability
- Short course on Smart Grids IT and communications
- Short course on Smart Grids business models
- Short course on Smart Grids regulation
- Short course on digital transformation and emerging technologies
- Short course on organizational transformation

Project: Supporting the roll-out of smart grid technologies in Colombia Phase 2: Moving forward to implementation
Result_Title: Diplomados and Short Courses on smart grids and digital transformation (online & in-person) (M12)
Description:
The skills will be enhanced through the delivery of a structured training program that will have a minimum of 120 hours and deliver a diploma certificate of Universidad Nacional de Colombia to each attendee. This program will have modules with strategic content focused on decision-makers, and others with technical content focused on the technical staff of the beneficiaries and other supportive stakeholders of the project.  

Output 6 is needed because it is a clear need identified in our PACT 1 project to ensure that the key stakeholders of the Colombian energy sector have the skills to develop, operate and interreact with a smart grid in Colombia, which is a necessary condition to unlock the accelerated deployment of flexibility from the demand side and its associated carbon emission abatement potential. 

-20 people: Diplomados on Smart Grids
-20 people: Diplomados on Digital Transformation
-30 people: Short course on Smart Grids
-20 people: Short course cybersecurity and interoperability
-20 people: Short course on Smart Grids IT and communications
-12 people: Short course on Smart Grids business models
-12 people: Short course on Smart Grids regulation
-10 people: Short course on digital transformation and emerging technologies
-10 people:  Short course on organizational transformation  
Total: 154 = 40 Diplomados + 114 Short courses

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Cocoa value chain meetings and 6 x 1-day workshops
Description: Six 1-day Workshops (two for each Department) with 10-12 cocoa farmers and individual meetings to assess the current status of cocoa crops in the prioritized municipalities and allow for an exchange of experiences among producers and other parties of the cocoa value chain in the Amazon piedmont. Cocoa farmers will also discuss alternatives for new arrangements taking into account local biodiversity, improving women participation in the sector, and improving productivity. Strengthened network of local farmers based on knowledge exchange of Amazon cocoa tree arrangements.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Creation of strategic alliances with the media and academia to position an Amazon deforestation-free cocoa
Description: The awareness and appropriation strategy implies the creation of strategic alliances with the media and academia to promote and position an Amazon deforestation-free cocoa. In order to do this, alliances will be established through meetings and phone calls and in some cases, workshops.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Presentations, press releases, leaflets and social media content from the awareness and ownership strategy
Description:
The awareness and appropriation strategy implies the creation of multimedia content with key messages to position a deforestation-free Amazon cocoa among different audiences. The strategy will define the total number of publications in social media and press releases but it is expected to approximately publish 8 press releases (2 per each department and 2 at national level) and 50 publications in social media. Communication products will be disseminated over the duration of the project.

Progress report on this output will be presented on 2021-Q4 and 2022-Q1.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Guidelines on forest restoration and rehabilitation using cocoa agroforestry systems.
Description: Document with recommendations for implementation and/or improvement of cocoa agroforestry systems to promote forest restoration, connectivity and conservation at landscape scales in the Amazon piedmont, considering the current status of cocoa crops, recommendations made by other organizations, and local growers' preferences.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Capacity building programme delivered to key actors of cocoa value chain in Putumayo (government agencies, environmental authorities, producers' associations, intermediaries) for the implementation of deforestation-free agroforestry business models
Description: 1 workshop series that takes a 3-day training  with 75 key actors of cocoa value chain in Putumayo  (40% women) including: public officials, cocoa association members and environmental authorities. The workshops will strengthen the participants skills and knowledges in the topics prioritized and previously identified. Moreover, the workshops aim to build a sense of collective ownership over a common vision for deforestation-free cocoa for the region; for that purpose, we will deepen the Full Value Agreement methodologies in order to build alliances between different actors with common goals.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Capacity building programme delivered to key actors of cocoa value chain in Caquetá  (government agencies, environmental authorities, producers' associations, intermediaries) for the implementation of deforestation-free agroforestry business models
Description: 1 workshop series that takes a 3-day training  with 75 key actors of cocoa value chain in Caquetá  (40% women) including: public officials, cocoa association members and environmental authorities. The workshops will strengthen the participants skills and knowledges in the topics prioritized and previously identified. Moreover, the workshops aim to build a sense of collective ownership over a common vision for deforestation-free cocoa for the region; for that purpose, we will deepen the Full Value Agreement methodologies in order to build alliances between different actors with common goals.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Capacity building programme delivered to key actors of cocoa value chain in Guaviare (government agencies, environmental authorities, producers' associations, intermediaries) for the implementation of deforestation-free agroforestry business models
Description: 1 workshop series that takes a 3-day training  with 75 key actors of cocoa value chain in Guaviare  (40% women) including: public officials, cocoa association members and environmental authorities. The workshops will strengthen the participants skills and knowledges in the topics prioritized and previously identified. Moreover, the workshops aim to build a sense of collective ownership over a common vision for deforestation-free cocoa for the region; for that purpose, we will deepen the Full Value Agreement methodologies in order to build alliances between different actors with common goals.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Pilot implementation of at least one financing instrument or incentive articulated to the deforestation-free cocoa business model.
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: Implementation of a pilot based on at least one of the identified public and/or private financing instruments or incentives available. The pilot will include establishing required agreements with the stakeholders involved in the implementation  of the deforestation-free cocoa business model.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Business model for the cocoa value chain in the Amazon Piedmont developed
Description: Parameters and criteria that define a deforestation-free, climate smart and socially inclusive cocoa business model adjusted to the specific conditions of each sub-region.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: 6 x 1-day training workshops delivered to cocoa producers to improve skills for accessing environmental/conservation financing instruments and incentives to implement deforestation-free and climate smart business models
Description: Six 1-day training workshops (2 for each department to reduce group size and Covid risks) for 10-12 cocoa farmers each to strengthen their capacity for accessing financing instruments and incentives to implement a deforestation-free business model.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Baseline estimation report of environmental, socioeconomic, and productive indicators defined by the Monitoring, Reporting and Verification system of the Cocoa, Forests and Peace Agreement
Description: Contribute to the Monitoring, Reporting and Verification system of the Cocoa, Forests and Peace agreement, by providing the baseline estimates of environmental, socioeconomic, and productive indicators, including an assessment of deforestation linked to cocoa agroforestry in the Amazon Piedmont.

Project: Deforestation-free Cocoa for the Amazon Piedmont
Result_Title: Stakeholder engagements to promote the adoption of the proposed MRV system and develop a plan for scaling up implementation
Description: Meetings with key stakeholders such as producers associations, territorial entities, environmental authorities, international organizations, governmental agencies and other public-private actors that operate throughout the northern and western region of Guaviare to promote the adoption of the proposed MRV system for a deforestation-free cocoa, and develop a plan for scaling up the implementation of the MRV system for deforestation-free cocoa in the Amazon Piedmont developed. The scope of the scaling up will be decided based on the results of the pilot set up early in the implementation of the project.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Recommendations on a priority lanes network and modal transfer zones design for Bogotá-Region.
Description: Technical document that contains recommendations on the prioritization and agile implementation of various infrastructure projects for sustainable transport in Bogotá-Region, along with the explanation of the process followed to obtain these results. The objective is to determine which projects should be prioritized by developing a methodology that allows to quantify their impact on travel times, modal shift, and GHG emissions reduction. Also, it seeks to establish guidelines that allow speeding up the effective implementation of the chosen infrastructure projects. In addition, specific design recommendations will be given on one or two prioritized projects according to their magnitude and impact, to generate guidelines for a real and agile implementation of this specific infrastructure.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Recommendations on transport supply models and demand management strategies for Bogotá-Region.
Description:
It is a technical document that will contain recommendations for implementing in an agile way supply and demand models scenarios, based on their impact on sustainable mobility, to accelerate climate change mitigation and reduce travel times. Also, will contain the explanation of the process followed to obtain these results. 

For supply models, the impact of different schemes will be quantified by modelling proposals considered by Bogotá Mayor’s Office, Cundinamarca Government and other researchers: It will be included interoperable fare collection schemes, various types of modal integration, public or private bicycle systems implementation, reforms to the feeder buses schemes, among others. 

Regarding demand management strategies, starting again from previous studies carried out by Mayor’s Office, Cundinamarca Government and other researchers, the impact of measures such as congestion fees, urban tolls, peak and plate schemes, management of parking spaces, among others may be analysed.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: MaaS architecture for Bogota-Region, including a coupled MRV module for transport.
Description:
It is a technical document that will contain the technological guidelines required for nimbly implementing an interoperable MaaS platform in Bogotá-Region. The document will contain a conceptual architecture that will describe MaaS platform key components, as well as their interactions and functional requirements to guarantee interoperability between different public transport systems of the city-region.

The proposed MaaS architecture also includes guidelines for a coupled MRV module for the transportation sector. The idea behind this module is to make use of data from MaaS and transport sector GHG emissions reports, for their consolidation into a database appended to existing Bogotá´s mobility  Control Center.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Review and complementation of Mayor’s Office fund and use of funds exercise for the financing of regional projects
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description: It is an exercise to estimate available funds and give recommendations for their use in financing projects focused on promoting sustainable mobility. Also, a document will be delivered with the explanation of the process followed to obtain these results. In this case, Mayor's Office/SDM fund and use of funds exercise will be reviewed and complemented. Mayor's Office/SDM has been developing this exercise at regional level in conjunction with the academic institutions.

Project: Comprehensive plan and roadmap for sustainable mobility in Bogotá-Región during and after COVID-19
Result_Title: Technical and GESI guidelines for the regional institutional framework for continuity of sustainable mobility policies in Bogotá-Region, and pact proposal for reporting GHG emissions from transport.
Description: It is a document that will contain technical guidelines for the regional institutional framework in which regional authorities are currently working, and a pact proposal for a reliable emissions report towards the proposed MRV module. These technical guidelines will be focused on roles, responsibilities and required agreements between stakeholders for the coordination and integration of urban development and mobility projects, and to guarantee the availability and transparency of GHG emissions data from transport by means of a collaboration pact.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 90-hour certificate course for extension agents on behaviour change methodologies, andragogy, climate change literacy and climate smart agriculture
Description:
90-hour certificate course delivered to 40 extension service agents (extensionistas) to equip them with the skills, knowledge and tools needed to provide effective technical assistance to farmers for the sustained adoption of climate-smart agricultural practices and to provide them with new approaches so they engage with farmers in a more interactive, effective way. 
Target: 40 extension agents trained

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 1-day training workshops with farmer innovators on climate-smart agricultural practices and climate change
Description:
1-day training workshop with farmer innovators on introduction to climate smart agricultural practices and climate change with emphasis on i) soil management, ii) benefits of composting / how to properly process compost, and iii) importance of gathering climatic information for efficient irrigation. In addition, guidance on how to collect samples for soil analysis will be provided. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada). 

Farmer innovators understand the importance of soil components (chemical, physical and biological) and the relationship between soil and rainwater absorption.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 1-day training workshops with farmer innovators on soil analysis and fertilization
Description:
1-day training workshop with farmer innovators on i)  how to understand the soil analysis, and ii) how to develop a fertilization plan according to the results. In addition, explanation on how to keep and assess records on the costs of the inputs (especially fertilizers) will be provided. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada).

Farmer innovators are able to interpret the soil variables (PH, organic matter, CEC (cation exchange capacity)), to properly use fertilizers according to the soil analysis results with adequate dosage of inputs.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 1-day training workshops with farmer innovators on irrigation planning and use of cover crops
Description:
1-day training workshop with farmer innovators on i) how to develop and assess an irrigation plan using the agro-climatic data that farmers have collected through the project, and ii) use of cover crops to retain soil humidity. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada).

Farmer innovators understand how evapotranspiration and rainfall regime work and the importance to use climatic data for managing irrigation.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: In-person technical support via field visits and clinics
Description: Each farmer innovator will get an average of 5 visits during the project. Visit 1: soil sample collection process. Visit 2: verification of compost process and how rainfall and temperature information is being gathered. Visit 3: follow up on progress; assessment of agro-climatic information; support on specific challenges or opportunities. Visit 4: follow up on implementation of fertilization plan; assessment of agro-climatic information; support on specific challenges or opportunities. Visit 5: assessment of costs information and optimization plan; assessment of agro-climatic information; support on specific challenges or opportunities.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Ongoing mobile-based technical support to farmers on climate smart agriculture
Description:
Through the mobile technology platform the project will provide customized and timely recommendations on CSA topics delivered directly to farmers, with the purpose of offering continous technical support, optimizing the number of farmers to be reached in a cost effective way. The design and set up of the platform includes the development of agronomic content, inclusion of gender considerations and application of behavioural strategies. In addition, it includes an assessment on content disemmination, considering available services (SMS, voice) and farmers preferences. Call center agents, once recruited and trained, will collect farmer information and feedback, and provide customized and timely agronomic advice on a regular basis. One A/B test will be carried out to improve the delivery of the digital component of the service.
Target:
2,250 farmers receiving digital agronomic advice on CSA practices

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 1-day workshops with farmers and community leaders to become part of the CB-MRV system, emphasizing a gender approach
Description:
1 day training workshop with farmers and community leaders to become a part of the CB-MRV system, emphasizing a gender approach. Main aspects of the training include i) elements of the system, ii) data collection protocols, iii) data collection process. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada).

Through the CB-MRV system farmers start collecting the data to monitor their contribution to mitigate climate change.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 6 x 4-hour workshops with municipal authorities on behaviour change,climate change literacy and climate-smart agricultural practices
Description: 4-hour workshop with municipal authorities on i) introduction to behaviour change, ii) climate change literacy, iii) climate smart agricultural practices. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada) and 1 for state level authorities. Workshops will train municipal mayors, agriculture and environmental authorities on integrated landscape management, climate change literacy and behavioural approaches, generating increased commitment for implementation of CSA at landscapes levels.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Webinar with municipal mayors, agriculture, environmental authorities and state level authorities to motivate commitment towards implementation of CSA at landscapes levels
Description: Webinar will generate the space for participants to make a public pledge on their commitment with the project implementation in their municipalities and foster the communication of project progress with the authorities.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Webinar on integrated landscape management with municipal mayors, agriculture,  environmental authorities and state level authorities to exchange experience on the implementation of CSA at landscapes levels
Description: Webinar will enable municipal mayors, agriculture and environmental authorities to share lessons learned, feedback and recommendations for the implementation of CSA at landscape levels.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 4-hour workshop with municipal mayors and agricultural/environmental authorities on behaviour centered design on governance and community participation towards conservation
Description: 4 hour workshop for municipal mayors, agriculture and environmental authorities on behavior centered design on governance and community participation towards conservation. 5 workshops, 1 per municipality (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada). Workshops will enable municipal mayors, agriculture and environmental authorities to identify the steps of the behavior-centered design methodology developed by Rare and create prototypes to conserve the natural resources of their communities and motivate commitment towards implementation of CSA at landscapes levels.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Recommendation paper to influence planning instruments at the local level
Description:
Key findings and data from the project are shared through co-design sessions with the Governor's office and Cormacarena officials to craft a recommendations report to the Secretary of Agriculture to inform the PDEA as well as the Secretary of Environment and Cormacarena to inform the PRICCO.
Target:
1 report with recommendations on integration of sustainable agricultural practices and natural resource management at landscape-level

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Recommendation paper to strengthen the national reporting of carbon monitoring with data produced at the local level to contribute towards the national NDC system
Description:
Using carbon data gathered through CB-MRV system and other key results from the project, a recommendations report - will include technical support, accurate data and evidence contributing to the NDC targets - will shared and validated with key-stakeholders of the Consultative Committee; a working group with IDEAM and MADR will be established to review the recommendations and assess the level of adoption.
Target:
Report with region-specific information on carbon removals associated with the implementation of sustainable practices in cacao production

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Report consolidating the data collected through the community-based carbon monitoring system (CB-MRV), available for local communities to access new funding through the carbon market for reducing carbon emissions
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
Information needed for a Project Document required to register the project in one of the voluntary standards for carbon markets will be defined and then compiled through the CB-MRV system so that a project could be registered under one of the voluntary standards for carbon markets.
Target:
Report analyzing data collected through the community-based carbon monitoring system (CB-MRV) to support local communities’ access to new funding through the carbon market

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 6 modules of the diploma course
Description: Teaching material to impart new skills and bolster a different understanding of what successful extension support entails.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: CSA printed guides and digital tutorials on soil health, agro-climatic station, compost, microorganisms, biodiversity and production data records keeping form
Description: User-friendly guides and tutorials on priority practices to support agile uptake of new practices. Core to the behavior diffusion strategy, social marketing materials make CSA benefits easy to understand, encouraging more farmers to adopt these practices and to gestate a new farming 'norm'

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Report on behaviour diffusion strategy and lessons-learned
Description: Qualitative and quantitative research with extensionists and farmers will provide the insights for designing the behavior diffusion strategy to disseminate the knowledge and communication products in cost effective ways, adaptating all contents to the local context and develop the behavior change campaing. The report will highlight the key lessons learnt from this project and provide guidance on the adoption of a behaviour diffusion strategy for other stakeholders promoting CSA practices.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Community-based carbon monitoring system (CB-MRV) to enable local farmers and landowners to monitor their contribution to mitigate climate change
Description:
The CB-MRV system will be designed following government and international guidelines and farmers will be trained in its use. The project's mitigation contribution will be estimated based on a monitoring plan, identification of the chronosequence of cacao and citrus crops, collection of field samples, data analysis and development of models describing carbon trajectories associated with cacao/citrus crops, and complemented with the data from the CB-MRV system. The system is comprised of 3 elements: i) standardized protocols and procedures for collecting information, ii) local personnel trained on adequate data collection and iii) the database that aggregates the information collected. The system will be developed following the guidelines of the IDEAM Forest and Carbon Monitoring System and the National Forest Inventory.
System in established in June 2021, data collection throughout the project.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 2 webinars profiling local and regional leaders as CSA champions
Description: 2 webinars profiling local and regional leaders from different backgrounds such as representatives from farmer associations, officers from agricultural and environmental authorities and regional education institutions. Communication materials will provide a platform to share progress towards CSA and specific experiences and cases in the project´s municipalities (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada) and convince other municipalities to prioritize CSA practices.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 2 blogs/articles in local/regional media, written jointly with a local leader, to highlight the project's contributions
Description: Platform to share progress towards CSA and specific experiences and cases in the project´s municipalities (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada) and convince other municipalities to prioritize CSA practices.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 1 regional TV broadcasting to reach wider audiences
Description: Platform to share progress towards CSA and specific experiences and cases in the project´s municipalities (Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada) and convince other municipalities to prioritize CSA practices.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Virtual presentation targeting an international audience on the sidelines of UNFCCC COP26
Description: This will be organized in the context of UNFCCC COP26, the Global Landscape Forum, and/or the Global Food Summit, with participation of local stakeholders, to showcase the project.The aim is to host a discussion that puts the projects’ results and long-term ambitions in context with international sustainable development, climate and food system agendas, and generate momentum about how these can be applicable to other sectors and geographies.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: Dedicated webpage for the project
Description: Includes project materials such as videos, photos, and testimonials which will be regularly uploaded and will provide a more intimate and personal perspective on the project, a summary of project achievements and other relevant resources that the project generated such as some of the knowledge and communications products above.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 10 x 4-hour workshop on peer to peer learning methodologies to ignite social diffusion of targeted behaviors
Description: 2 workshops per municipality - Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada. A combination of in-person events (i.e. peer-to-peer workshops, public recognition event), digital space (i.e. WhatsApp group chat) and social marketing (i.e. radio) will be used to establish and reinforce a Profe network (“Profe” is an informal term of respect in Spanish denoting experience and expertise). This network is key to: i) create a community of practice whereby farmer innovators share their experience implementing and monitoring CSA practices, exchange ideas and solve shared challenges collectively, ii) provide the recognition when farmer innovators publicly commit to expand their land, and iii) actively encourage farmer innovators to share and  teach other farmers in their communities to adopt CSA practices that support reduced emissions.The purpose is to highlight the role of farmer innovators as Profes of CSA practices, acting as reliable teachers/ mentors to provide the skills, knowledge and social proofs for other farmers who want to adopt CSA practices. This is key to progressively create social pressure for broad-based adoption in the rest of the community. The “Profe” network also serves as a social movement to reinforce farming as a professional occupation and instil pride in farmers.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 public recognition events where farmer innovators pledge to expand CSA practices on their land and provide public sign up sheets to enroll more farmers
Description: One event per municipality. During the public recognition event farmer innovators will pledge to expand CSA practices on their land and provide public sign-up sheets to enrol more farmers

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 5 x 4-hour municipal workshop on community shared vision of climate smart agriculture and sustainable landscapes
Description: 1 workshop per municipality - Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo, Granada. Workshops on "community shared vision" supplemented with active exchanges cross the 5 municipal authorities build a shared understanding with a short-term action plan to advance implementation of CSA practices.

Project: Adopting New Technology, Mindsets, and Practices to Transform Colombia’s Agricultural Sector
Result_Title: 1-day public event where mayors from Cubarral, Lejanías, El Dorado, El Castillo and Granada pledge to act as advocates/champions of CSA in their municipality and to influence other mayors
Description: Through a public event, mayors pledge as champions and also provide public recognition for "Profe" farmers. Mayors provide public recognition for farmers who join the Profe network and expand CSA practices on their land.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Ranking of insitutional investors and accompanying report
Description:
Ranking published and accompanying report.
CCADI designs and updates the first climate change ranking for asset owners in Colombia with the purpose of creating an upward spiral of ambition among the industry players. With the purpose of increasing climate ambition among Colombian asset owners, the 2021 ranking will include not only pension funds and insurance companies, but also banks and private funds since these four beneficiaries are the largest asset owners in Colombia with assets under management of nearly USD 325.000 million, which is more than half of all assets in the Colombian financial system. In the past, the ranking has been a useful knowledge output for gathering information to better understand how each investor is managing climate change risks and opportunities increasing transparency of the financial sector.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Recommendations Report on climate smart practices of government credit institutions
Description:
Research on how Public Credit Institutions (Bancóldex, FDN, Fogafin, etc.)  align with the Paris Agreement (Art. 2.1.C), and address climate change issues within their operations and investments. 
The recommendations report will allow to diagnose and promote the implementation of the TCFD recommendations  the above financial institutions.

Recommendations will be delivered to Public Credit financial institutions (i.e. Bancoldex, Fogafin, FDN, Findeter, Finagro, etc.). Recommendations to close gaps between Paris Agreement regulations and Public/Private financial institutions, will be delivered to Superfinanciera (SFC) and Ministry of Finance (MHCP).

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Non-Disclosure Campaign (NDC) engaging FIs and corporates to disclose to investors on climate and deforestation
Description: Mail marketing and engagement campaign led by finance institutions in order to convince 78 national and international listed companies with presence in Colombia on disclosing TCFD information on climate and forest through CDP Platform.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Series of skill enhancement activities with real sector companies:  4 TCFD online workshops
Description:
Four (4) online workshops on TCFD to be delivered on 2021-Q3 and 2022-Q1.
Type: The online workshops are virtual capacity building conferences/trainings, developed through digital platforms such as Teams or WebEx.
Target: 78 national and international companies representatives
