Content: The first 2 online trainings will focus on raising awareness and TCFD fundamentals, and the the other 2 workshops carried out in Q4 will focus on best practices sharing and lessons learned after CDP disclosure cycle and the launch of the report. The online trainings will be recorded and uploaded into the CDP Education platform, as part of the content on the TCFD online course.
Duration: 2 hours each workshop, total of 8 hours.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Recommendations report about target companies adherence to the TCFD recommendations
Description:
Recommendation report to encourage listed companies to disclose information on climate-related risks and opportunities, and contribute to the implementation of TCFD by companies.

It will contain an analysis of the adherence and gaps of TCFD recommendations of national and international listed companies with presence in Colombia, 78 disclosing to CDP and 30 non-disclosing to CDP.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: CCADI's recommendations for policy development for Colombian government institutions
Description:
Two (2) policy briefs to contribute making all financial flows in Colombia consistent with the Paris Agreement and continue to expand its advocacy with public officials.  There will be bilateral meetings to support the implementation of 2020 and 2021 policy briefs. From last years’ experience, the construction of the briefs is made by first having bilateral meetings with public official from the Department of National Planning (DNP), the Ministry of Finance and Public Credit (MHCP), the supervisor (SFC), the Ministry of Environment (MADS) and other stakeholders to identify possible topics that are strategic for the Covid-19 recovery and COP-26; as well as aligned with CCADI’s main objectives. Some of the topics identified and that could be used to write those policies are: financial sector role on green recovery; fiduciary responsibility and changes in minimum return regulations, with the purpose of incentivizing green investments; recommendations for including the financial sector in DNP’s green growth mission; including the financial sector progress in Colombia’s NDC compliance and observation, as well as article 2.c.1 of the Paris Agreement; making policy recommendations to incentivize investors to use the information published by private companies in the country, and eventually promote sustainable investments. These topics will be evaluated once the bilateral meetings with public officials start, which can mean that they might suggest new topics or modify these new ones (under the objectives and outcomes of CCADI).
In 2021-Q3 the first out of the two policy briefs, will be presented.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Money owners assessment report
Description:
The assessment report will identify the gaps and barriers that money owners have regarding climate smart investments, hence, it will provide a baseline context that contributes to develop a communication strategy and an action plan that incentivise money owners to demand more sustainable financial products and to include climate change risks and opportunities in their financial decisions.

This output is expect to expand the impact of CCADI to a larger set of stakeholders in the financial system, thus supporting the awareness of climate smart investments in money owners.

Money owners of the Colombian Financial System, who will receive this through the communication strategy, include money savers, consumers, insurance buyers, pension contributors, etc.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Infographics published and shared through social media
Description: Three (3) infographics that contribute to climate change awareness and skill enhancement to a broader set of stakeholders will be published and shared through social media.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: 1 Op-ed published in mainstream media to help mobilize public opinion
Description:
1 Op-ed published in mainstream media will help mobilize public opinion around the issue to contribute to climate change awareness and skill enhancement to a broader set of stakeholders.
It is targeted to a broader public and money owners of the Colombian financial system.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Podcast episodes in established  climate/environmental podcast
Description: Two (2) podcast episodes that will contribute to climate change awareness and skill enhancement to a broader set of stakeholders. It will be broadcasted in Brújula Sonora Podcast and/or 1.5º en 1.5 minutos Podcast

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Periodical newsletter to stakeholders
Description: Development and delivery of periodical Newsletter to stakeholders. Newsletters will be delivered twice a month from April to January 2022.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Mentorships to local leaders to build capacity on sustainable tourism and conservation
Description:
40 key individuals trained in at least three of the following topics: environmental education, leadership, conservation and/or tourism. Specific themes and topics will be prioritised after an initial diagnosis. These mentorships aim at showcasing practical application of all teachings, through a close accompaniment of the mentors. 

A specific training program regarding environmental education, leadership, conservation and tourism will be designed and implemented.

This training process hopes to generate impact in the conservation and sustainability of each region, through the training of local key leaders. 

Number of trainings: 3 mentorships, each with an expert.
Duration: 4 to 8 weeks per mentorship. 
Number of trainees: 40 people in total.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Conservation agreements signed amongst tourism organisations
Description:
20 conservation agreements signed between nature tourism organisations and Awake, that include the description of conservation commitments. Details depend on GIS analysis and monitoring results. 

10 organisations out of the 20 that sign the conservation agreements are the same 10 organisations that will participate in an acoustic monitoring process.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Trainings to local nature tourism organisations in community-based monitoring of ecosystems
Description:
Train at least one person of 10 nature tourism organisations on community-based monitoring of ecosystems. Each person will receive at least 8 hours of training. 
Modalities of the training will ideally be 100% on-site, but depending on COVID-19 restrictions, part of the trainings will be virtual. 
Number of training sessions to cover the 8 hours of training will depend on the modalities defined.

Topics that include the training are:
1) Flora monitoring
2) Forest replacement dynamics
3) Fauna monitoring
4) Forest structure

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Trainings to local nature tourism organisations on acoustic monitoring system
Description:
10 organizations involved in the community based monitoring process will receive training in:
- Deployment of the offline devices ("Edges") and the real time monitoring-acoustic sensors ("Guardians") that will monitor the ecosystem soundscape at selected locations, offering important information in biodiversity data and illegal activities (logging, poaching). 
- The Rainforest Connection Arbimon platform for continued use of the data for more species modeling and in-depth analysis, biodiversity presence over time and tracking 15 specific species, among others. 
- Illegal activities alerts on the platform. 
- Utilization of the AI models in the platform for understanding how specific species are faring in their land, empowering them to take action to improve presence. 

The goal is to empower hosts with this technology so that they can automatically see for themselves how biodiversity is faring on their land. Acoustics are an excellent way to truly understand how communities' ecosystems are being affected on a large-scale that isn't possible with any other type of monitoring. Empowering local people with the tools scientists use to understand species communities will inspire pride and expand local knowledge. 

This system will build off of and expand local knowledge, resulting in real-time, automatic tracking of the most critical species in Colombia in addition to the soundscape as a whole. This is an excellent measurement of how conservation practices are impacting the ecosystem and can also be used to guide changes in management plans. 

This training process will include 1 visit of the Rainforest Connection team and a remote training program with the Rainforest Connection Team. Beneficiary organisations will have 4 hours  of training for at least 1 person of 10 organisations.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Set of recommendations proposed for relevant policies, legislation, and regulation on climate change mitigation, related to nature tourism.
Description:
Based on the results of this project, the measurement analysis data, all insights and conclusions, an official recommendation will be created to the local authorities regarding nature tourism and conservation, useful for policy making, regulation and norm design.

An important component is that all data and results will be shared, and will hopefully be useful to create new policies, regulations and norms. This is one of the main deficiencies of local governments.

Recommendations will be targeted to relevant national authorities such as: PNN, MinCIT, MADS, Humboldt and Colciencias.
Similarly, local authorities will be targeted.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Funding platform for tourism and conservation projects, that showcases the impact measurement and report of nature tourism and conservation initiatives
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
Funding platform where 10 tourism organisations involved in the monitoring process will display their conservation agreements, their impact measurement, and have the possibility to receive donations and other income for their impact generation. This platform will display and visualize all contributions made by local tourism organizations for the conservation of forest coverage and GHG emission reduction. The platform also aims at mobilizing resources to these initiatives, where travelers can make direct contributions. 

A virtual page hosted in a subdomain of Awake.travel using a wordpress such as Content Management System. The page will include: a profile of each of the 10 organisations involved in the monitoring pilot, the conservation agreements, data and other results of the monitoring process, hectares of forest conserved, data from the Geographic Information System and data from the acoustic monitoring system, among others.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: CO2 emission calculator integrated within the Awake.travel website, so that travellers can calculate and compensate the carbon emission generated on their trip
Indicator: Output 2.3. 'Project application/ tools developed to access funds'
Description:
CO2 calculator displayed on the Awake web page, so that travelers can measure their GHG emission during their trip, and can decide to compensate it by contributing directly towards the local organisations. This first version will seek to have at least 20 trips with emission calculation option integrated into the Awake page and with the compensation option available.

Awake will not obtain any commission or profit from the donations (100% will go to the beneficiaries). Nontheless the bank fees and online payment comission will be charged. The payment method will be online or offline, depending on the payment method use by the traveler, but in case the payment method chosen is online it may include a commission for the online transaction that is a percentage of the total cost of the transaction.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Scientific report published and disseminated with the results of the acoustic monitoring system and the implementation of the pilot of community-based monitoring and measurement of ecosystems with 10 locations
Description:
Scientific report with data, results and conclusions from the community-based monitoring pilot program. These processes aim at strengthening community monitoring efforts, and give them important tools, information and technology that they can use.

The report is targeted to stakeholders that are interested in conservation of the forest coverage, biodiversity protection, and the impact that tourism has on GHG emission reduction. It is expected that this knowledge can be replicated in other regions and by other tourism organisations.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Guideline for Acoustic Monitoring with a Community-based approach in tourism destinations
Description:
Guideline for Acoustic Monitoring with a Community-based approach in tourism destinations, as a result of the training process. 

A guide will be constructed, following the national elements regarding community based monitoring, that will contribute to the know-how of forest coverage at a national level, including its analysis of flora and fauna; all with a community based perspective.
 
All of this will be consolidated in thematic guidebooks for the adequate implementation of specific activities in monitoring, such as: forms, reporting spreadsheets, and protocols for information use.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Training materials for leaders,  regarding environmental education, leadership, conservation and tourism
Description: During the project 3 mentorships for local leaders will be designed. These materials and recordings can be used as guidelines for the training and capacity building of other local leaders.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Guideline for Conservation Monitoring with a Community-based approach in tourism destinations
Description: Document with Guidelines for acoustic monitoring, as a result of the training process.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Scientific report with key findings from the control trial experiment measuring socio-economic and environmental impacts generated by the project, and showcase the potential of nature tourism as a tool for deforestation reduction
Description:
The Universidad del Rosario will be in charge of measuring the impact generated by the project, which will evaluate the socioeconomic and environmental results of Awake's intervention on the project’s destinations and beneficiaries. This is fundamental for understanding the impact of tourism interventions on forest conservation. To carry out these activities, a subcontractor will be hired to collect the information on the project destinations, which includes: phone survey to participants in 76 municipalities and an in-person survey to participants in 76 municipalities.

This component is very important as it’s a continuation of the measurement done during the project’s first phase, and will help understand the conservation processes that are being implemented in each destination. With these results, comparison of the deforestation rates in each of the 36 “control” municipalities and in the 36 municipialities where the project was implemented, and understand the socio economic impact that the project has on its beneficiaries.

Target survey participants: reaching 823 individuals  to have 710 successfully involved. The Universidad del Rosario will create and disseminate a scientific report of this second measurement phase.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Pedagogical pensum and 25 online courses, dedicated to conservation and sustainable tourism,  in the e-learning platform AwakeU
Description: Pensum with 25 new courses on the AwakeU platform, in themes regarding conservation and sustainable tourism. These courses and topics are the result of a conservation and sustainability pensum that has been co-created with experts (academic, NGO's, government). These courses will be available during and after the project ends, for the beneficiary organisations and others outside this project.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: High-quality audiovisual content that showcases the tourism experiences, the hosts conservation efforts, impact of GHG emission reduction and the results of the monitoring and measurement pilot program
Description:
High quality audiovisual content for 10 destinations, with the following results:
- 4 destionations with a 1 minute long video, 1 30 second long video and 50 photographs.
- 6 destionations with a 5 minute long video, 1 30 second long video and 50 photographs.

The audiovisual content will not only showcase the most important and significant destinations and nature highlights, but will also showcase the community, their conservation efforts and monitoring results. 

This content will be used for the marketing and positioning strategy but will also be shared with the local organizations for their own marketing.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Novel course material based on the principles of climate transition risk management and the methodologies existent to assess it
Description:
Course material for 12 hour training on climate transition risk principles and methodologies. The course material will be created for virtual training based on learning-by-doing. This course material, based on research and methodologies of 2DII, WTW (ex CPI Energy Finance) and the CFS-Uniandes, includes the syllabus, facilitator guidelines for each session, materials per session (power point, exercise, and reading material).

This course would be targeted to:
-Public sector representatives (Superfinanciera, DNP, BanRep, MADS, etc)
-Financial sector representatives (Fasecolda and insurance companies, banks and financial institutions like Bancolombia)
-Uniandes and other 2 local universities (to be determined)

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Module I of Course: The principles and methodologies of climate transition risk
Description:
80 professionals trained in CTR management for 12 hours of training.  
Out of the 80 people trained in Climate Transition Risk principles and methodologies, 70 will be professionals (30 representatives of public institutions, 40 representatives of private financial sector) and 10 professors of local universities for scale up.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Report on the transition risk assessment of investors’ portfolios
Description:
This output consists of two pieces of research: i). Scenario analysis and stress testing of Colombian insurers investment portfolios using 2DIIs methodology and ii). in-depth portfolio risk assessment and development of risk management strategies for one Colombian insurance company using CPIs methodology.

It is targeted to:
-Fasecolda and insurance companies (e.g. Sura), banks and financial institutions like Bancolombia.
-Public sector institutions (Superfinanciera, DNP, BanRep, MADS, etc)

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Module II of the Course: Applying Climate Transition Risk Management
Description:
80 professionals trained in CTR management*12 hours of training.
This second module aims to develop a learning-by-doing course using the applied research carried out by CPI,CFS-Uniandes and 2DII in output 4. It will guide the 80 participants (described above) to design action plans for policy makers and projects for financial sector companies, in order to apply the tools and knowledge acquired through both modules of the course.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Online platform for the communication of project's progress and sharing lessons learned
Description: An online platform with description of activities and progress of the  project. The platform will also have a section for showcasing projects designed to manage CTR.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Webinars to disseminate results of the project and motivate stakeholders to manage climate transition risks
Description:
First webinar (out of two) with 40 attendees in which progress and results of the project are communicated to a broader audience including leaders of public and financial sector entities participating in the project as well as other stakeholders interested in replicating the experience.

Targeted to Fasecolda, Asobancaria and their associates. Superfinanciera, DNP, MADS, Banco de la República, as well as other stakeholders interested in building upon the progress of the project to replicate or scale up.

Project: Preparing the public and financial sector for CTR: Capacity building and call to action
Result_Title: Graduation event to present the results of the project and grant certificates to participants of the CTR course
Description: Graduation event (face to face or virtual according to the Covid-19 situation) presenting the results of the project, a panel with key project participants (public institutions and financial sector representatives), and handing out the certificates for participants of the course.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Recommendations for policy makers on policy/legislation for reducing emissions in Road Freight Transport operations
Description:
As part of developing Best Practices Guides for the RFT sector, recommendations will be delivered to the Ministry of Transport (Min.Transporte), Ministry of Environment (MADS) and Dept. of National Planning (DNP). The recommendations will include:

1. Propose strategies for monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia
2. Propose changes for policy/legislation

It is expected that with the recommendations:
a) DNP will be able to define, recommend and promote public and economic policy aimed at monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia.
  
b) Ministry of Transport: will be enabled to develop sustainable projects and implement green freight policies, aimed at equipping the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector with cleaner vehicles and easing the implementation of the best practices recommended by the project.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Recommendations for industry association on strategies for reducing emissions in Road Freight Transport operations
Description:
As part of a Best Practices Guide, recommendations will be made to industry representatives such as COLFECAR, ANDI, Road Freight Transport and logistics operators, regarding:
1. Propose strategies for monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia
2. Propose strategies for facilitating information sharing on the adoption of green technologies and practices
It is expected that with the recommendations: Associations will facilitate the implementation of small trials/pilots and business plans aimed at monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Industry Review Report on the current state of green technologies and practices in the trucking industry in Colombia
Description:
RFT Industry Review Report on: 
1) Identification sustainable Road Freight Transport KPIs, best practices applied in industry (e.g. vehicle and alternative fuel technologies, digitalisation
of logistics networks, green road infrastructure), and determine the feasibility of their adoption in different segments of the industry.
2)  Identification of drivers, barriers and latest trends related to the adoption of green practices within the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector
The results of this report will also be an input for an evaluation toolbox and strategic business plan.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Interactive toolbox that evaluates Road Freight Transport performance on green practices
Description:
Evaluation tools of Road Freight Transport performance accessible via web-based platform, record of subscribers and anonymised user and usage information.
The toolbox will allow actors to implement small trials/pilots and develop business aimed at monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia, following best practices in other sector initiatives e.g. GiroLimpio.cl

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Strategic business plan to identify feasible and impactful green practices applicable to the Colombia Road Freight Transport sector
Description: The strategic business plan will demonstrate the feasibility of the implementation of best practices identified at Phase 1 according to their impact on CO2e emissions reduction and cost. Purpose: Close the gap between COP21 targets and the current credentials of the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector by facilitating the adoption of clean technologies and practices.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Roadmap towards a zero emissions Road Freight Transport sector
Description: The Roadmap will provide the stakeholders with a plan that will inform future decisions, strategies and actions to enable significant reduction in CO2e emissions in Colombia Road Freight Transport sector. Purpose: Close the gap between COP21 targets and the current credentials of the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector by determining the feasibility of the adoption of green practices within the sector.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Sustainable Performance Index
Description: This is an integrated index that will be composed of set of indicators that consider economic and local societal conditions, environmental factors and Road Freight Transport characteristics of the region under investigations. This tool will enable a better understanding of the negative impact of freight transport on Colombia’s environment, ensuring a comprehensive evaluation of RFT sustainability performance that is focused on local requirements and is measurable overtime.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: KPI dashboard
Description: This is an online tool that will allow the stakeholders to visualize a set of energy, emission and operation related KPIs or metrics. The data generated by this tool will be used by road freight Road Freight Companies and logistics operators to monitor the environmental performance of their fleets and inform their decision making on the planning and execution of their logistic networks.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Scenario simulator
Description: This is a tool that will be available to project stakeholders and beneficiaries, and will allow them to build and simulate scenarios regarding the adoption of green logistics innovations within their logistics networks. Specific innovations that we will include in this tool are logistic planning, vehicle and fuel technologies. The tool will take into account operational and financial restrictions, as well as policy and regulation.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Four Best practices Case-Studies in the RFT Sector
Description: Four (4) case studies that will address the four dimensions of actions of the project (fleet configuration, fleet management, safe and efficient driving, and optimized logistics) and will synthesize best practices in Colombia and the UK in terms of industry emissions reductions strategies. The case studies will help beneficiaries and stakeholders to learn about implemented solutions. Thus, the case will underline the feasibilities of change in the road freight sector.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Online repository of project outputs, including the Sustainable Performance Index, KPI dashboard, scenario simulator, cost estimations, case-studies and roadmaps
Description:
The repository will be hosted in a public website/on-line platform that will encompass the collection of evidence that will be derived from the project along with the tools developed during the project. This repository will support project’s stakeholders in establishing priorities that fit better the realities and localities. Hence, they will be better equipped for monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia. 

It will be shared with: Ministry of Transport (Min. Transporte), DNP, COLFECAR, ANDI, and trucking companies.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Workshops with key project stakeholders on gap analysis and agenda setting
Description:
3 workshops (one per region) and 3 seminars (one per region) of 2 hours-long each, that will focus on sharing and understanding key stakeholders primarily from the associations, defining current gaps and possible agendas for future and green logistics strategies in the RFT. 

Total number of attendees of workshops (sum of the three): minimum total participation of 30 people.

Total number of attendees to seminar (sum of the three): minimum total participation of 60 people.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Capacity building workshops and seminars to train key stakeholders in the state-of-the-art industry practices and on projects results
Description:
These seminars and workshops will provide the training to key stakeholders primarily from the associations contributing to the project so that they could transfer this knowledge to the rest of their members. In simple terms, these activities are designed to train the trainers, and those trainers will be the project ambassadors. 
Purpose: to enhance the skills and capabilities of decision makers within the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector and indirectly will have an influence on three objectives of the project below. 
1. Close the gap between COP21 targets and the current credentials of the Colombian Road Freight Transport sector by determining the feasibility of the adoption of green practices within the sector. 
2. Develop a strategic business plan for the acquisition and operation of low-emission truck fleets. 
3. Propose strategies for monitoring and enhancing the green credentials of truck fleets and Road Freight Transport operations in Colombia.

Total of 14 workshops @ 2hours each with a minimum total participation of 360 people.
This will also result in a total of 6 seminars @ 2hours each with a minimum total participation of 120 people.

Topics include:

Workshop A: Best practices in green logistics innovation  (for industry, min 20 participants, in person in 3 regions)
Workshop B: Best practices in green logistics operation  (for industry, min 20 participants, in person in 3 regions) 
Workshop C: Key Performance indicators and measurements (for industry, min 20 participants, in person in 3 regions)
Workshop D: Lessons learned and possibilities for green logistics in Colombia (for industry, min 20 participants, in person in 3 regions)
Workshop E: Elements and proposals for regulations, policies and strategies for zero emissions logistics (one for public and one for private sector, min 60 participants, hybrid). 

Seminar A (x2 one for private and one for public sector): Green Logistics Management (for public and private sector, min 20 participants, hybrid)
Seminar B (x2 one for private and one for public sector): Decision-making in Green Logistics Management (for public and private sector, min 20 participants, hybrid)
Seminar C (x2 one for private and one for public sector): Policies and regulation  (for public and private sector, min 20 participants, hybrid)

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Academic working papers on the adoption of green technologies and practices in the Colombian Road Freight Sector
Description:
Two (2) academic papers based on the outputs and outcomes of this project, targeting top transport and logistics journals including Transport Science, Transport Research Part A/B/D/E, International Journal of Physical Distribution & Logistics, and Journal of Business Logistics. 

The purpose of this outcome will enhance the academic and industry knowledge on sustainable Road Freight Transport that will naturally influence academic and industry community in Colombia on matters related to the remit of this project.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Final GIRO Zero project report
Description:
The final project report will give an overview and summary of the all main project findings. 
This includes summaries of all trainings, seminars and workshops, as well as of the draft version of the academic papers.
The final section of the report will present a reflection on the future challenges and an outlook on the future evolution and possible agenda of the Giro Zero project.

Targeted to: Min. Transporte, DNP, COLFECAR, ANDI, RFT and logistics operators, MADS, UPME, stakeholders from other countries, academics, and auctioneers.

This will enable them to assess the impact of physical risks associated with climate change in the Colombian financial system. The ultimate evidence of sustainability will be an ability to run informed stress testing, which will support future working.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa

Increased capacity/capability of the NEVPC on EV policy. Knowledge and skills developed throughout the EV policy workshop have been embedded, incorporating UK best practice, with an understanding of EV policy and commitment, policy formulation, the implications for CO2 emissions from transport, and policies and tax based incentives to promote the adoption of EVs. 

The EV policy workshop will help NEVPC to realise their ambitions to commit to a specific EV target for the country, adopt proposed policy recommendations based on learnings from UK best practice and create a EV policy for Thailand.

Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Beneficiaries  implement an energy access program using the financial schemes developed during the workshops and in partnership with the possible investors
Implementor: Ilumexico (Eres Energía Renovable SAPI de CV)

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: *Disclosure Procedures Regulation for Financial Intermediares issued by CNBV
Indicator: Int. Out 1 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: This intermediate outcome is expected to result in enhanced skills and knowldge on ESG Standards and Climate Risk developed through training. Analysing and systematising  best practices on ESG integration and disclosure, climate-related risk and financial inclusion will provide relevant information to decision makers within the CNBV towards developing, issuing and supervising new regulatory changes so that financial intermediaries incorporate ESG standards and climate related risks in their operations and decision making processes. Policy briefs will provide further insights and guidance on how to integrate and disseminate ESG in the financial sector. Training webinars and modules, supported by iplementing a strong communication campaign, will increase capacities and skills and raise awareness of ESG and climate-related risk among CNBV staff so that they can internalise new knowledge and skills in their daily work.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: *Financial Intermediaries use ESG and climate risk screening tools
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description: This intermediate outcome is expected to result in the use of ESG and climate risk screening tools by Financial intermediares.  A tool that allows regulated actors to assess where they stand on integrating ESG standards into FIs operations and decision-making processes and what specific actions they can undertake to increase their ESG capacities and integrate climate related risks into their operations and analyses. The tool will be disseminated so that  FIs use it. The tool will guide FI to identify the gaps they need to close regarding environmental, social, gender and climate-related risk to green their portfolios and mobilize green resources

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: *Communication products used by CNBV's Social Communication Directorat
Description: This intermediate outcome is expected to result in climate-related networks' adoption of joint activities related to emissions reductions, including increased capacity to coordinate with other actors, present and systematise Mexico’s progress in national and international events and capacity to adopt and adapt good practices from other countries

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: CNBV, SEMARNAT/PROFEPA and the Ministry of Economy promote SBTs as a reference and/or complementary tool to their existing mechanisms and platforms.
Indicator: Int. Out 1 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description:
The 3 primary beneficiaries already count with programs and platforms with which we could promote synergies with the SBTi. We expect them to start integrating SBTs as a reference and/or complementary tool to their existing mechanisms as a result of the skills and knowledge developed through the 3 training workshops. Specifically, we would expect:
1) CNVB to start disseminating the SBTi as part of their engagement with financial institutions in Mexico.
2) PROFEPA to start using the delivered materials in the redesign and enhancement of their programs to track and improve industrial environmental performance.
3) Ministry of Economy to incorporate the trainings and materials into a module of their learning platforms from MiPymes. We would also expect that they could start conversations with other institutions to include SBTi as a reference for the certification of trust and integrity for companies.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: The Community of Practice (CP) serves as a catalyst to increase climate action among the private sector, promoting the growth of the network by the integration of the value chains of its members and the incorporation of new companies interested in learnin
Description:
We expect 3 main short-term actions depending on the level of engagement of the members of the CP:
1) Committed companies and associations boost their value chain to adopt SBTs.
2) Committed companies without approved SBTs start developing targets using the CP's materials.
3) Companies that are not yet committed to the initiative commit or start preparing to commit to the SBTi.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: Mexican companies use the developed corporate support model (CSM) to set SBTs and encourage other companies to take action.
Description:
The developed corporate support model (CSM) helps high-emitting companies in designing their SBTs, which they could voluntarily submit to the SBT Initiative for an official validation, demonstrating their leadership in Mexico and encouraging other companies to take action.

2 main actions are expected depending of the level of engagement of the 4 selected companies:
1) The companies commit to develop their targets, as well as corporate climate strategies to support the achievement of these.
2) The companies submit their science-based targets for validation by the experts of the international initiative.
In addition, we expect to have other companies interested in replicating the CSM.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: The created learning platform serve as a guidance for all stakeholders, including government institutions and the private sector, on the importance of corporate participation in the national climate action, boosting the adoption of SBTs.
Description: The learning platform is used as a guidance by project's beneficiaries and is disseminated to promote with other stakeholders a better understanding on what is required to accelerate climate action through private and public sector cooperation.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Paving the Way for Setting Ambitious GHG Emissions Reductions in the Private Sector to enhance the National Climate Change Policy
Result_Title: The report with insights and lessons learned from the project serve as a guidance for all stakeholders, including government institutions and the private sector, on the importance of corporate participation in the national climate action, boosting the ado
Description: The report is used as a guidance by project's beneficiaries and is disseminated to promote with other stakeholders a better understanding on what is required to accelerate climate action through private and public sector cooperation.
Implementor: South Pole Carbon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Increased number of high-quality rural electrification SGR projects developed by prioritized sub-national entities
Description:
What: Sub-national entities build their internal capacity to access SGR resources.
How: Working closely with MME’s SGR team and prioritised subnational agencies to secure SGR funding for priority rural electrification projects via development of knowledge products and technical assistance to projects design and structuring.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: At least 3 bankable private-sector led off-grid projects have reached ready-to-build stage and financial close
Description:
What: development/identification of scalable and replicable commercial rural electrification business models
How: By working with MME to select and structure private-sector led scalable project ideas and market them to potential investors and providers of finance to secure investment commitments leading to funding and implementation.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: Sub-national entities have increased capacity to plan, design and structure renewable energy rural electrification projects and develop high-quality to public funds and programs
Indicator: Int. Out 1 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description:
Sub-national entities build their internal capacity to design and structure rural renewable energy projects and develop high quality funding proposals to the SGR system and public energy funds. 

This is expected to be achieved through the development of online training modules targeting subnational entities’ capacity gaps to develop rural electrification projects and access funding from the SGR system and Colombia’s public energy funds, including FENOGE, FAZNI and FAER. The training will be made available to all interested parties via MME’s and IPSE’s websites and be included into the training and career development plans of subnational entities’ staff involved in rural electrification planning.

Project: Scaling up rural electrification via capacity building to public and private actors
Result_Title: IPSE´s Sustainable Rural Energization Plan (PERS) project developed for priority region
Indicator: Int. Out 3. 'Adoption of recommendation for other action'
Description:
What: The collection and analysis of primary and secondary data – included in PERS methodology – to develop rural electrification business models and deploy solutions aligned with the repayment capacity, willingness to pay, energy needs and uses of targeted communities ensuring strong ownership, appropriate maintenance and equitable benefits of the installed solutions
How: the outputs will deliver the technical and socioeconomic analysis required for the development of one rural electrification project identified in IPSE´s Sustainable Rural Energization Plans (PERS)

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology

Indicator: Int. Out 1 'Enhanced action because of training'
Description: At least 50 beneficiaries have enhanced actions in sustainable tourism in their businesses, as a result of the training process that they receive during the project implementation.  And at least 75 beneficiaries will have enhanced actions in their businesses after the project is finished.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Local and national government authorities adopt the recommendations for policy/legislation that the project will deliver as a result of the  different insights, data and conclusions
Indicator: Int. Out 2. 'Adoption of recommendation for policy/legislation'
Description: Local authorities in the destinations where the project is implemented and national government authorities (e.g. Viceministry of Tourism, PNN, MADS, Humboldt, Colciencias) adopt the recommendations made, and the data and information gathered throughout the project is used for the formulation of new policies related to nature tourism as a tool for  forest conservation and emissions reduction.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Travelers and other actors redirect resources to sustainable tourism and conservation initiatives which will contribute to reduce carbon emissions
Description: Resources from travelers and other stakeholders interested in conservation are mobilised through the funding platform (with a CO2 calculator incorporated) towards tourism organisations that signed conservation agreements and participated in a conservation monitoring process.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Knowledge products delivered by the project are adopted by key stakeholders and beneficiaries
Description: Knowledge products created as a result of the implementation of the impact measurement and the training processes, and the Awake U courses are adopted by tourism organisations within their businesses processes.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Travelers' decision-making is influenced positively towards preference of good quality tourism organisations that also work in forest conservation initiatives
Description:
The implementation of the marketing strategy and content strategy impact the decision making of travelers as they prefer the tourism organizations that also work in forest conservation initiatives. This marketing strategy bring awareness and empowerment not only for travelers but also for other local organisations, local stakeholders, and authorities that are acting towards forest conservation, emissions reductions and nature tourism. 

The marketing and content strategy will keep generating results after the execution of the project, because all the content and marketing strategies will still be published and rolling through the virtual media. 

At least we expect that 10 beneficiary tourism organizations have increased sales as a result of the implementation of this marketing and content strategy, during the implementation of the project. 

During and after the implementation of the project we expect to increase the sales for tourism and conservation initiatives, and  motivation and increase action of local organisations and stakeholders towards conservation and nature tourism.

Project: Sustainable Tourism Enhancement Project - Phase 2: Boosting conservation and emissions reduction through tourism and technology
Result_Title: Networks define specific actions and projects towards nature tourism and emissions reduction
Description: It is expected that the Networks created and formalised through the 10 signed agreements, define and adopt specific activities that are maintained and complied after the project ends to enhance the actions of tourism actors in the destination regarding tourism and conservation, articulation, and investment of resources for sustainable tourism and conservation purposes.

Description: Road Freight Companies, truck owners, and truck drivers understand the positive trade-offs, which leads to the adoption of cleaner technologies and practices.
