Result_Title: Stakeholders use product repository
Description: Road Freight Companies, members of Colfecar, the Public Sector (Min.Transporte, MADS, DNP) and academics access and use information from the repository for their strategic and operational decision-making processes. This can include, but is not limited to uses such as capacity building, strategic business planning, emissions reporting efforts, or subsequent academic publications.

Project: Steering the Colombian Road Freight Sector Towards a Zero Emissions Strategy GIRO-ZERO
Result_Title: Collaborative networks share information on the costs and benefits of adopting new technologies and practices
Description: Collaborative networks (members of COLFECAR) share knowledge on the costs and benefits of adopting new technologies and practices within the Giro Zero network or related networks.

Project: Catalysing local implementation of climate action: unleashing the potential of non-state actors.
Result_Title: Climate funds finance proposed set of  transport portfolios
Description: Proposed set of transport portfolios are financed  through climate funds in order to be implemented.

Project: Mexico inward skillshare: Carbon budgets and climate strategy
Result_Title: Carbon budget
Description: A carbon budget is produced for Mexico

Project: Malaysia outward skillshare: Developing a Climate Change Act and Climate change centre
Result_Title: CCA is passed
Description: Malaysia passes a CCA and establishes a national CCC

Project: China outward skillshare: green Asset-Backed Security (ABS) issuance
Result_Title: Issuance of a asset-based green bonds by the Industrial Bank of China
Description: Issuance of an asset-based green bonds by the Industrial Bank of China.

Project: Unlocking the Colombian government fund FENOGE to provide energy access whilst reducing greenhouse gas emissions <U+200B>
Result_Title: UPME is able to use the funds from FENOGE in the most cost-effective way
Description: The Ministry of Energy and Mines (UPME) can use the funds from FENOGE in the most cost-effective way before a December 2019 deadline, ensuring that critical projects to bring sustainable energy to Colombia’s remote regions can go ahead.

Project: Colombia Climate Finance Accelerator Follow-Up
Result_Title: Development of an innovative climate project pipeline in Colombia
Description: Increase in the number of private sectors sponsored bankable projects needed to deliver Colombia’s NDC.

Project: Colombia outward skillshare: Mission for Energy Transformation
Result_Title: The Mission's recommendations are passed as policies through Congress
Description: The Mission's recommendations are accepted, and related policies pass through Congress. There is an expectation that, in addition to their own recommendations, skill-share experts give international legitimacy and credibility to the Missions' own recommendations, supporting its passing through Congress.

Project: Mexico inward skillshare: Green Finance
Result_Title: Green Finance Strategy
Description: Mexico delivers its own Green Finance Strategy

Project: China Green Bonds: Effective Implementation; Economic Impacts
Result_Title: Implementation of recommendations
Description: Implementation of the recommendations (MRV system for green bonds, policy changes to support the growth of the green bond market) made to policymakers.

Project: Updating Mexico’s Climate Change Policies
Result_Title: Full cross-cutting integration of climate change into the public policy instruments
Description: Full cross-cutting integration of climate change into the public policy instruments.

Project: UK-China Green Finance Programme
Result_Title: Investment into green assets
Description: Increase investment into green assets to mitigate the impact of climate change.

Project: Capacity Building for Chinese Financial Institutions on Climate Transition Risk Methodologies
Result_Title: Enhanced capacity of key stakeholders
Description: Enhanced capacity of key Chinese financial institutions and policy makers in their understanding of the climate transition risk assessment methodologies and tools that exist.

Project: The Green Performance Premium: examining historical green asset performance and the contribution of ESG-practices to micro- and macro-economic performance
Result_Title: Investment in green assets
Description: The increased commercial interest in green assets as a viable and profitable investment opportunity leads to further investment in green assets.

Project: 2030 sectorial decarbonisation plans<U+200B>
Result_Title: Implementation of the three 2030 Sectoral Decarbonisation Pathways
Description: Implementation of the three sectorial  pathways for the country to increase mitigation ambition, comply with the Paris Agreement commitments, foster low-carbon, and resilient development, and alleviate poverty in Mexico.

Project: Implementing ESG disclosure and integration for a green and sustainable ‘two-way opening’ of the investment market in China
Result_Title: Implementation of recommendations on a ESG disclosure framework
Description: The CSRC to integrate the recommendations on a ESG disclosure framework on their new policy for a ‘two-way opening’ of China’s investment market that integrates sustainability considerations.

Project: Community-based Sustainable Tourism Enhancing Project
Result_Title: Increased offer of sustainable tourism
Description: Scientific Tourist Programme is implemented. Increased offer of sustainable tourism in the Amazon, Pacific and Orinoquia regions.

Project: Harmonising Colombia’s Greenhouse Gas Measurement, Reporting and Verification with the National Inventory for Transparent NDC Tracking.
Result_Title: Informed policy decisions based on a more effective and transparent MRV
Description:
The project will improve the quality and alignment of the technical inputs and data management systems with the Colombian government, which will support a more robust and sustainable inventory process. 
A more effective and transparent MRV will empower the government to make informed policy decisions to increase their climate ambition.

Project: Supporting Mexico’s Green Finance Hub<U+200B>
Result_Title: Implementation of 'greening' recommendations
Description: The Mexican government implements public policy recommendations that contribute to the 'greening' of the Mexican financial system.

Project: Solar bonus programme development and pilot implementation plan<U+200B>
Result_Title: Investments for massive adoption of photovoltaic distributed generation (solar rooftops) in Mexican homes
Description:
The program aims to incentive and to catalyse investments for massive adoption of photovoltaic distributed generation (solar rooftops) in Mexican homes.
The  purpose is to redirect the current residential electricity subsidy, presently at 120,000 million pesos per year, and transform a part of it into the required funds for the implementation of energy efficiency measures and solar rooftops of enough capacity to cover the residential user current consumption.

Project: Sustaining the Growth of China’s Green Bond Market and Facilitating Inter-Country Green Capital Flows
Result_Title: Local issuance of green bonds and ABS aligned with environmental policies and green standards
Description: More local issuance of green bonds that are aligned with China’s environmental policies and international green standards.  More issuance of Chinese green ABS

Project: China Skill Share: Training to enhance understanding of domestic and global green finance development and Shenzhen's newly-issued Green Finance Regulation
Result_Title: Enhanced individual and organisational capability of Shenzhen government and financial institutions to meet TCFD recommendations
Description: Capacity building training programmes will aid Shenzhen’s financial institutions and government with the successful and mandatory implementation of TCFD recommendations. Training will help them to report increased individual and organisational capability to implement their TCFD disclosure aims in line with their ambitious timeframes (from March 2021).

Project: Operational and environmental sustainability of solid waste management projects
Result_Title: SWM projects are implemented
Description: New projects on SWM reach financial closure and implementation occurs.

Project: Operational and environmental sustainability of solid waste management projects
Result_Title: Structural reform on SWM is implemented
Description: New municipal SWM plans and actions are implemented.

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Result_Title: Medium Term (2024): Aware and empowered Kakinada city with infrastructure and institutional capacity in place to accelerate adoption of electric mobility
Description:
"1. City Officials: Capacity development of city officials from Kakinada Municipal Corporation and Kakinada Smart City Corporation etc. will provide strategic inputs on technology, planning, procurement and program design, enabling them to implement e-mobility by introduction and or replacing existing stock of vehicles used for public transport. 

2. Power Sector Stakeholders: Engineers from distribution company and officials from the state electricity regulator will use outputs to design tariff, incentives for e-mobility, support mechanisms for electric charging infrastructure. In addition, they will use outputs for enhancing renewable energy capacity in the grid.

3. Business and Entrepreneurs: Businesses will use outputs to assess risks, establish feasibility and to expand their firms to include e-mobility equipment, charging infrastructure and related services. 

4. Students and Employees: They learn new trades and skills related to e-mobility, enabling them to identify, secure green jobs and improve livelihoods.   

5. Women and Children: Women and children are key decision makers in families, especially for mobility solutions. They will use outputs to understand advantages of e-vehicles, enabling demand and driving increasing adoption.  

6. Think Tanks: They will use outputs to sensitize policy makers, regulators and media, thereby positively impacting the overall environment and demand for electric vehicles."
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: Utilities can send signals to a network of chargers to manage the electricity demand from EV charging using a protocol that is suitable for India and can be nationally scaled.
Description:
"Any managed charging implementation requires two key elements. First, a transport layer in the form of wifi or cellular connection which can help achieve 2-way communication between the utility systems and a network of chargers. Second, a suitable messaging protocol or standard, which serves as the language that helps the charging devices of 3-wheelers and 4-wheelers to understand and execute the instructions from the utility's system. 

The project will establish how a distribution utility can bidirectionally communicate with a network of chargers. By demonstrating this in the Indian context, the project will help BYPL and other utility stakeholders develop an in-depth understanding of the protocols available, the demand response capabilities afforded, and technical requirements in terms of the utility's back-office systems. It will help utilities better appreciate the possibilities and limitations of managed charging. 

The project will help also enhance mutual understanding between utilities and charging network operators for each other’s limitations and motivations. Through the project’s activities, it is anticipated that a foundation will be established for vehicle grid integration and vehicle to grid pilots, paving the way for more advanced grid technologies and a resilient, flexible, and cleaner electric grid in India."

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Result_Title: The economic benefits of managed charging are widely understood by utilities, policymakers and charging network operators and suitable tariff mechanisms are identified to lay the groundwork for managed charging.
Description:
"The project will elevate the understanding of EV charging as a flexible grid resource. Through the analyses conducted, the project partners expect that BYPL and utilities across India will gain a better understanding of the economic benefits and possible pricing and policy approaches to actively and passively encourage demand management from EV charging. 

For changing network operators, the project will showcase the opportunity for viewing demand response as a means of achieving cost-savings. As Indian electricity markets evolve, the economic and policy mechanisms developed as a result of this project could pave the way for increased revenue-generating opportunities for network operators through participation in flexibility management. 

For policymakers, the project will help generate an evidence base with local data about user behaviour and implementation challenges, feeding into better-informed policymaking on critical aspects such as time of use tariffs for EV charging. This will create the policy framework to incentivize charging in a manner that helps achieve the country’s overall climate objectives of greater penetration of renewable energy. 

Ultimately, the aim is to help utilities embrace a faster and better-managed rollout of EV charging, without incurring expensive upgrades to their distribution infrastructure."

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Electrification of public transport and intermediate public transport at a local level providing sustainable, affordable and inclusive low carbon mobility
Description:
"The project outputs would be of relevance to the local authorities in both the cities. In case of Ahmedabad, the project outputs would be useful for carrying out bus electrification by procuring buses, setting up supporting infrastructure and securing state government collaboration for policy interventions and funding support. Further in Mehsana, the electrification strategy of IPT will help to decarbonize as well as to recognize and improve the existing IPT as a PT and therefore it would be useful for the IPT operator/drivers, city authority as well as users.
 
The project has significant focus on developing strategies that facilitate improving the present PT/IPT service levels in terms of accessibility, affordability and sustainability. The city authorities can use the strategy document for planning the electric bus procurement, sourcing of funds, planning for the charging infrastructure and proceeding with the implementation. Further, the knowledge products developed will be disseminated in the form of workshops and training and creation of stakeholder’s networks, all contributing towards the capacity building of the involved stakeholders. The importance of bottom up approach, stakeholder networks, inclusivity and city level long term strategy development mechanism are a few noteworthy aspects contributing towards the planning machinery of the city."

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Mainstreaming of women in public transport and IPT services securing livelihoods and improving safety levels for women passengers
Description:
"According to the study by Mckinsey Global Institute (The power of parity: Advancing women’s equality in India, 2015), Indian women contributed just 17 percent of national GDP, less than half the global average of 37 percent. By mainstreaming women in operation of public transport and intermediate public transport systems in the case cities, the project aims to not just provide a livelihood opportunity but also promote safety and security in the system for women users. Ultimately, strategies developed as part of this project are an attempt to improve accessibility and safety for women in transport. 

Outputs would be relevant for the city authorities and public transport agencies while they plan to implement and bring women into service delivery. This outcome is expected to build capacities of women as they participate as workforce with the support of local authority and NGOs that would work with women to organize capacity building and training activities for them."

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Result_Title: Capacity building of the local authorities to sustain actions towards de-carbonizing urban mobility through public transport and IPT electrification
Description:
"Government of India has been promoting electric mobility through various policies and regulatory measures. At city level, the translation of these policies has been limited in the form of standalone plans. This project of electrification strategy and action plan is a comprehensive and multi-pronged approach towards a seamless transition to electric mobility in PT and IPT mode segments. Therefore, the project is developed keeping in view the capacity building and strengthening initiatives for local authorities to sustain actions that promote sustainable transport in the cities. 

The capacity building workshops and training sessions to be undertaken as part of this project is expected to develop competencies and skills of the trainees enabling them to continue with this initiative of PT electrification beyond the project.

The decision support framework along with training modules developed as part of this project will help other city authorities, public transport agencies and IPT operators to electrification strategy for their respective cities. Capacity in terms of sensitization towards climate change, opportunity to transform the PT and IPT segment through electrification, directing urban mobility towards clean energy and to establish the need of mainstreaming women in service delivery."

Project: South Africa Skill share: Hydrogen Society Roadmap
Result_Title: Creation of hydrogen roadmap and policy framework for the development of the hydrogen economy in South Africa
Description: Building on the MEL skills enhanced in-country, the DSI and its partners will: develop a robust, implementable, and measurable Hydrogen Society Roadmap that enables delivery of the associated economic, social (including GESI), environmental and climate outcomes; enhance cross-sectoral knowledge about hydrogen; and set the policy framework for the development of the hydrogen economy in South Africa.

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability
Result_Title: The Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera upskill wider teams/departments on the impact of physical climate risks
Description: Building on the skills enhanced in-country around the impact of physical climate risks, the Banco de Republica and Superintendencia Financiera will disseminate knowledge to upskill others in both institutions and further increase organisational capacity.

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability
Result_Title: The Banco de la Republica and Superintendencia Financiera will help other Colombian financial institutions to understand climate change risks and support new policy making to reduce emissions
Description: Building on the adoption of scenarios and top-down stress testing methodology, the Banco de Republica and Superintendencia Financiera will be able to support other Colombian financial institutions (other state agencies, research centres and the private sector) in having a better understanding of climate change risks so they can include them in their risk management strategies. This would support new policy making and in turn shape financial flows to reduce emissions for lower carbon growth.

Project: Building a sustainable and scalable low carbon future in Mexico<U+200B>
Result_Title: Regulator and finance professionals with increased capacity in the green market
Description: Trained regulator and finance professionals, particularly outside the capital, show increased capacity in green bonds, markets, labelling, certification, and taxonomy

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: Ride-hailing operators and the Jakarta Government commit the resources necessary to implement the action plan and timetable to electrify ride hailing fleets in Greater Jakarta Area and include the timetable and roadmap in their planning document
Description:
"1. The ride-hailing operator team will rely on the fleet electrification planning documents in the following years after this technical assistance project is completed, considering the future changes in the company’s ecosystem, business plans, or other internal or external factors. 
2. The ride-hailing operator team will be able to identify and develop new business models, contracting practices, or partnerships (e.g. with utility provider companies) to ensure the economical sustainability of fleet electrification and possible infrastructure provision, guided by the investment plan devised in this project.
3. The Government of Jakarta and BPTJ establish a local task force on electric mobility which continues the tasks and responsibilities devised for this project.
4. The Government of Jakarta and the Government of Indonesia will use the fleet electrification timetable to push infrastructure provision by PLN and implement supportive actions e.g. opening up access of government-owned land and building assets for charging facilities
5. PLN/State Utility Company will use the electric fleet deployment roadmap to develop a charging infrastructure and grid supply plan. 
6.Charging infrastructure providers will use the fleet deployment roadmap to develop investment plans on charging facilities for e-motorcycle
7.The ride-hailing drivers will have the skills necessary to operate and maintain e-motorcycle"

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: The Government of DKI Jakarta, the national government, and other local governments issue policy packages and plan investment needed to support motorcycle ride hailing fleet electrification
Description:
"1. The Government of Indonesia streamlines existing policies and develops national policies on ride-hailing electrification, guided by the policy recommendations presented in the report. The policy package could include fiscal and non-fiscal incentives for the supply and demand side, ride hailing fleet electrification mandates, and green procurement schemes.
2. The Government of Jakarta uses the policy recommendation document to create supportive policies and give non-fiscal and fiscal incentives needed. In addition to policies which directly impact the deployment of ride-hailing e-motorcycle and the provision of supporting infrastructure, the non-fiscal policies such as the implementation of Low Emission Zones, inclusive complete street improvements for e-motorcycle, or priority passenger pickup zones for e-motorcycle will also give impact to the air quality and GHG reduction and more sustainable mobility.
3. The Government of Jakarta set a ride hailing electrification target based on the developed roadmap and timetable document.
4.The Government of Indonesia and other local governments could also use the policy recommendation document to develop national and local policies. Moreover, they can also utilize the TCO and environmental benefit calculation tool to adjust the policies and develop a timeline based on national or citywide GHG reduction objectives and local contexts affecting e-motorcycle TCO."

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Result_Title: State Electricity Company (PLN) addresses the grid issues related to the additional demand given the large uptake of e-motorcycle by ride hailing according to the roadmap and timetable and pursue more sustainable energy source for their grid supply
Description:
"PLN as the single entity to provide electricity in Indonesia will plan grid supply provided and ensure the stability of grid to accommodate the additional demand from e-motorcycle uptake by ride hailing fleets. The roadmap and timetable should be put into consideration when planning their 10-year electricity supply plan. The PLN will pay particular attention to certain areas projected to have more additional demand and prone to grid instability, since the demand of EV charging tends to be concentrated in certain areas.

One of the strongest rationales for electric vehicle development is its ability to mitigate emissions in the transport sector. However, GHG reduction measures should be seen as a well-to-wheel approach, hence it should include reductions of upstream emissions from electricity generation by introducing more aggressive renewable energy mix policies. Considering the forecast of electricity needed for e-bus operation and policy recommendations on well-to-wheel emission reduction, PLN will devise strategic and operational plans to increase sustainable energy mix in their electricity supply."

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: Transjakarta fleet electrification by 2030 and increased mobility and accessibility for women, low-income, and marginalized communities.
Description:
"Transjakarta will use the timetable and investment plan to plan their transition to electric buses and have the capacity to iterate the fleet electrification planning documents. They will be able to develop new business models, contracting practices, partnerships, and internal capacity building to ensure the economical sustainability of fleet electrification, guided by the investment plan from this project. They will use inputs from GESI community groups to ensure the continued incorporation of accessibility and safety concerns in implementation plans.

The Government will use the roadmap and investment plan to develop subsidy schemes, commit sufficient funding to subsidize the operation of electric fleets, incorporate electrification plans in Transjakarta’s Key Performance Indicators in their contractual document, and establish a task force to continue the tasks of the PIU devised for this project.

PLN will use the deployment roadmap to develop charging infrastructure provision plan and grid supply plan.
The National Government, Government of Jakarta, and local governments will have the guidance to develop the policies and subsidies to support electrification and will have a reference document to set electrification targets. Moreover, they can utilize the calculation tool to adjust the policies and develop a timeline considering GHG reduction objectives and local contexts."

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: The bus operators will have the capacity to shift to electric buses including choosing the most reliable and suitable buses and charging technology for their operations, as well as providing the charging infrastructure at their depots.
Description: The main beneficiary of this outcome are the bus operators. They will use the timetable and investment plan document to prepare the new business model and financial model to shift from ICE buses to e-buses. Given the capacity building programs in Output 4, bus operators will also have the staff who have the capacity to maintain the electric fleet. The bus operators can also replicate the capacity building programs to their existing and future maintenance staff. Based on the charging plans, bus operators will be able to plan investments on depo charging infrastructure, including determining the technology and number of chargers and conduct depo retrofit to accommodate the chargers. Bus operators will also have knowledge to choose the bus technology which suits their operational requirement and pursue collaboration with the bus manufacturers to maintain the buses, especially maintaining the battery performance.

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Result_Title: State Utility Company (PLN) addresses the grid issues related to e-buses and pursues more sustainable energy sources.
Description:
"Based on the fleet deployment and grid supply plan documents in Output 2, the state utility company (PLN) will ensure that their grid supply is sufficient for the large scale e-bus deployment, and address grid stability issues which is currently still experienced often in the Jakarta area. 

One of the strongest rationales for electric vehicle development is its ability to mitigate emissions in the transport sector. However, GHG reduction measures should be seen as a well-to-wheel approach, hence it should include reductions of upstream emissions from electricity generation by introducing more aggressive renewable energy mix policies. Considering the forecast of electricity needed for e-bus operation and policy recommendations on well-to-wheel emission reduction, PLN will devise strategic and operational plans to increase sustainable energy mix in their electricity supply."

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Result_Title: Enhanced and sustained action on climate change - reduction in emissions from transport and improved air quality resulting from the increased uptake of EVs and e-mobility solutions
Description:
The creation of an enabling environment for electrified transport solutions including capacity and awareness, business models, and financing tools to support individual public transport operators, MSMEs, cooperatives, and large urban mobility service providers to scale up their EV uptake in Bangladesh. This would contribute to the achievement of the overall programme outcome of achieving reduction in emissions from transport and improved air quality. 

The project outputs contributing to the achievement of this outcome include:
(i) Output 1: Knowledge Product on the EV Financing Tool, would be used by the Government of Bangladesh, Development Partners and FIs as the fact-finding and evidence report used in the roll-out the EV Finance tool. This would provide affordable and accessible finance to businesses and facilitate the transition to EVs. 
(ii) Output 2: Capacity development of MSMEs through the business support services to support the transition to EVs in their existing business models as well as to develop new EV enabled business models. These supported MSMEs would form the core body of ‘champions’/ ‘knowledge disseminators’ to achieve sustained reductions in emissions. 
(iii) Output 3: Sensitising MaaS providers and partner corporates on the importance and business value of integrating sustainable transport into their business strategies.

Project: Scaling up Colombia Green Growth Policy implementation and investments via capacity building of state and non-state actors
Result_Title: Improved capacity of local government on implementation and monitoring of the country's GGP
Description: The project aims to increase the capacity of state and non-state actors to implement, track and monitor Colombia's Green Growth Policy GGP - (CONPES No. 3934).  It will improve the capacity of local government officials to identify and pursue sub-national green growth policies and projects.

Project: Scaling up Colombia Green Growth Policy implementation and investments via capacity building of state and non-state actors
Result_Title: Implementation of the National Biodiversity Strategy
Description: Implementation of the National Bioeconomy Strategy.

Project: Scaling up Colombia Green Growth Policy implementation and investments via capacity building of state and non-state actors
Result_Title: NCRE and bioeconomy projects are implemented
Description:
The improved enabling conditions trigger bioeconomy businesses to develop and prosper while creating value for biodiversity-rich forests, which are key for climate change mitigation.
Disbursement of funds to non-conventional renewable energy projects.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Mpumalanga Provincial Government Green Economy Training and Strategy Support -Enabling the ecosystem for the growth of the Mpumalanga green economy with a specific focus on renewable energy.
Description: Local government decision makers better equipped to take advantage of the growing  green economy opportunity and to establish the province as a key green economy hub in South Africa.

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Policy adaption based on the South African Renewable Energy Master Plan
Description:
A SAREM process can impact South African policy to set a path for renewable energy market expansion over the next 30 years as determined by the Department of Minerals and Energy, Department of Trade Industry and Competition and Department of Environmental Affairs

1) Growth of local renewable energy manufacturing - South Africa becomes an exporter of locally manufactured renewable energy components
2) A consistent annual growth of renewable energy in South Africa
3) South Africa becomes an exporter of Climate neutral liquid fuel 
4) Decommissioning coal stations across South Africa 
5) A Just Energy Transition in South Africa

Project: The development of a Green Economy Cluster organisation to support Mpumalanga's role in the validation, implementation and follow-on research of the South African Renewable Energy Industry Masterplan (SAREM)
Result_Title: Market Intelligence Report highlighting the green economy investment potential in Mpumalanga
Description: With a thriving renewable energy economy in Mpumalanga and investors able to access accurate market insights. There is a possibility to see large scale reskilling underway with a net decrease in unemployment in Mpumalanga based on 20 000 jobs and additional investment of R40bn (2bn GPB).

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: CoJ Institutional and Operational Readiness for EVs
Description: CoJ staff are capacitated to develop an EV policy clarifying what is allowed and what is not allowed in the City. In the longer-term, the CoJ organogram could reflect EV needs, relevant KPIs could be introduced for key staff, and by-laws could be developed to make policies legally binding. Operational readiness would include a clear registration process and record keeping of approved EV chargers

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: Electric vehicle policy
Description: When coupled with renewable energy charging, the decarbonization potential of EVs is potent. The City therefore rolls out renewable energy powered charging stations and the City's transport emissions are reduced drastically. Initial modelling suggests that ambitious action can lead to a 9% reduction in transport emissions by 2025.

Project: City of Johannesburg Electric Vehicle Readiness Support
Result_Title: EV tariff approved by NERSA
Description: City Power implements a sensible EV tariff that incentivizes EV charging during periods of high renewable energy generation.

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Anticipatory Governance training
Description: Capacity and knowledge of participating organisations to facilitate the green hydrogen economy improved/increased - majority of staff are knowledgeable about the climate change issues which directly relate to their work and best practice(s), and implementation of relevant programmes are being overseen by individuals with in-depth knowledge

Project: Building the Green Hydrogen Economy (GHE) Just Energy Transition: Co-creating a Just Labour Transition through the TVET College System in South Africa
Result_Title: Hydrogen skills transition plan
Description: Implementation of policy recommendations on hydrogen skills transition plan results in just labour transition towards lower carbon emissions through more effective and targeted skills development matched with industry expectations

Project: Thailand Skill Share: Workshop to support Thailand to develop and adopt a cross-cutting policy for the promotion of electric vehicles on Thai roads
Result_Title: Implementation of Thailand’s EV policy
Description: The NEVPC will further develop and implement a robust and comprehensive EV policy that will align with Thailand’s economic strategy. Thailand’s aim is to become a hub for electrical vehicles within 5 years, aiming to produce 60,000 EVs by 2022 and committing to 30% of vehicles sold in 2030.

Project: Colombia inward skillshare: Green finance
Result_Title: Implementation of actions to achieve regulatory and framework modifications
Description: Implementation of the actions to achieve regulatory and framework modifications, potentially through the 'Green Act' proposed by the Ministry of Finance, which will contribute to the expansion of the green market in Colombia and integrate climate change standard in investment strategies.

Project: Colombia outward skillshare: Sustainable tourism in the Amazon
Result_Title: New sustainable tourism models that can reduce deforestation are developed
Description: National and regional policy makers, and local communities in the Amazon, develop new sustainable tourism models that can reduce deforestation and have associated environmental and social benefits.

Project: Colombia outward skillshare: Sustainable tourism in the Amazon
Result_Title: Applications of the guide by local fishermen, which leads to better interaction with them
Description: Application of the guide by local fishermen that leads to better observations of the dolphins in their natural habitats, reduces negative interactions with the dolphins that may affect them, and leading to better economic income to the sustainable tourism sector.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Municipalities and national officials have increased capacity to develop and finance renewable energy embedded generation
Description: Capacity and knowledge of municipal and national officials is increased on developing and financing renewable energy embedded generation projects at the local level - so that key staff are knowledgeable on these issues.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Recommendations noted and lessons shared with government officials in the renwable enrgy sector to reduce greenhouse gas emissions
Description: The policy recommendations and lessons learnt taken up by government officials lead to an increase in renewable energy being used to supply electricity in South Africa and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Result_Title: Municipality renewable energy funding increased to fast-track emission reduction, resulting from increased capacity, awareness, collaboration and recommendations made
Description: Municipalities are better positioned to access climate funds and a strong pipeline of bankable projects from municipalities is developed for finance institutions to fund.

Project: Driving the green agenda through aligning SA's climate-related financial disclosure with best practice
Result_Title: Beneficiaries understand how to apply/undertake transition risk analysis & disclosure and have the necessary tools to do so
Description: The knowledge that has been shared and the capacity that has been built within financial sector institutions with respect to the importance of climate-related financial risks in South Africa has led to a  significant increase in the number of entities that engage with the TCFD recommendations and start their disclosure journey.

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: Local stakeholders have: a deeper understanding of the JT and its impacts; understand their agency and role in the JT
Description: Capacity and knowledge of participating  organisations improved/increased - majority of staff are knowledgeable about the climate change issues which directly relate to their work and best practice(s), and implementation of relevant programmes are being overseen by individuals with in-depth knowledge

Project: Distilling the JET in South Africa: Harmonizing conflict and seeking opportunities
Result_Title: Policy recommendations formulated by the project are internalised and implemented by policymakers and other relevant stakeholders
Description: Recommendations are included in policy documents and implemented

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use

Project: STRAPSA - Shifting the transport  paradigm  for South Africa

Description: National Government (Department of Transport; Department of Trade, Industry and Competition; Department of Environment, Forestry and Fisheries; Department of Mineral Resources and Energy; National Treasury); Provincial Government (Western Cape Government) and State-Owned Enterprise (Eskom) advance and implement green road transport plans for South Africa, including the standards and guidance designed by the project and roll out green procurement strategies.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Wide-scale adoption of the EPC mechanism and mainstreamed energy efficiency performance management throughout the built environment, driving improved economy-wide energy efficiency
Description: A register of all buildings that have obtained EPCs, along with their actual EPC, will be made publicly available through the NBEPR. EPC certificates will be valid for 5 years, after which a new EPC audit will be required and a new certificate issued. It is anticipated that only at this 5-year interval that improvements to individual buildings energy efficiency will captured in the NBEPR, and that the NBEPR will be able to monitor building by building EE improvements.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: NBEPR system providing facilitated access to data and baselining and informing EE policy making and programme development to further drive EE
Description: SANEDI and DMRE will be responsible for reporting on instances in which data obtained from the NBEPR has influenced policy making, and SANEDI will be responsible for monitoring and reporting on actors that have used these data for informing EE related programmes.  Between 1 and 5 EE related policies have been influenced by NBEPR data, and between 1 and 5 EE programmes have been informed by NBEPR data

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Result_Title: Developing market of services and financial products associated with energy performance
Description: At least 10 tailored financial products (from a baseline of 6 i.e. 4 additional) have been introduced in South Africa to support buildings EE initiatives informed by NBEPR data

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: *Financial Intermediaries will implement ESG and climate-risk to comply with CNBV issued regulation and reduce their exposure to climate-related risks
Description: One of the overall outcomes of the project is increased capacity for relevant organisations, particularly financial intermediares to integrate ESG and climate related risks into their operations. Once the CNBV issues new regulation related to ESG and climate risks, FIs are mandated to adpot such regulations. We expect the CNBV to make regulatory changes within the next 4 years, in line with their strategic plan. When the CNBV issues Unique Banking Memos (CUBs in Spanish), Financial Intermediaries have a grace period, which can range between 3 months to 1 year according to the complexity of changes, to incorporate new regulations. However, some Financial Intermediaries are already taking actions and expect these number to increase through the communications efforts of CNBV signalling their intention to issue regulation on ESG and climate-risks in the future.

Project: Accelerating Green Finance Flows Through the Strengthening of the Mexican National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV)
Result_Title: *Improved communications among key actors of the financial system t as measured through 1) a self assessment survey completed by beneficiary institutions, 2) Meetings between key stakeholders, agreements reached and public statements
Description: The second expected outcome of the project is that climate networks implement identified projects, particularly that CNBV effecitvely coordinates with financial sector actors on green finance. The project includes capacity building efforts and knowlegdge sharing activities with Mexican regulators, as well as Financial Intermediaries and National Develeopment Banks, will enable to increase awareness and mobilize green finance.  Establishing and institutionalizing  green finance task force within CNBV will support joint coordination and decision making on green finance , as well as develop strategies to communicate and coordinate with other financial sector actors regarding green finance.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum
Result_Title: asset managers and asset owners have increased capacity on ESG
Description: The ESG capacity of asset managers and asset owners is enhanced through a better understanding of the stewarship/engagement process. Asset owners and managers will adopt engagement practices more broadly. This will lead to change in the activities of investee companies, or if no action is taken on emissions, to divestment. Additionally, The ESG capacity of asset managers and asset owners is enhanced through a better understanding of how to overcome the product and data related challenges to scale ESG across different asset classes and across public and private markets. With this knowledge, the investor community in China increases their portfolio allocations towards greener investments and reduced exposure to high-emitting activities.

Project: Accelerating capital allocations to transition-aligned solutions through the UK-China ESG Leaders Forum

Description: Key actors have increased their technical capacities to manage and monitor the ecosystems, water, soil and forest and start implementation at regional scale. Funds are provided by the institutionalized funding mechanism and new governance mechanisms will ensure coordination and cost-efficiency. Solutions are implemented in different sectors (agriculture, urban, industry …) and therefore main actors in these sectors are responsible for their maintenance. However, the value of having a shared governance and funding is that is binds all actors together and increases the pressure on due maintenance of solutions that contribute to the common strategies.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Financial actors, from both the public and private sectors, understand the challenges posed by the climate crisis, and respond by transforming their organizations so they can identify potential risks in this new economic scenario
Description: Through the newly applied risk methodologies, investments that are high on emissions are riskier, and therefore, financial actors (both public and private) stop prioritizing the oil and gas sector as an attractive investment, decarbonizing their portfolios and financing agenda.

Project: Consolidation of the Mexican Climate Finance Hub - mobilizing resources to mitigation and adaptation activities and achieve Mexico´s emission reduction goals
Result_Title: Local investors are able to identify the relevant investment opportunities being developed by both public companies and subnational entities, and are able to mobilize capital towards those opportunities through newly developed investment vehicles
Description: Subnational entities get funding from local institutional investors, becoming study cases for other entities looking for funding to execute their green pipeline.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Description: The models are methodological guides, based on the FAO farm field schools’ model, adapted to the context of each of the project municipalities. Jalisco´s Coastal Watershed region in addition to requiring the alienation of public incentives and financial instruments, it requires that its livestock producers have a paradigmatic change. Thus, a capacity building process becomes a fundamental tool to detonate this change.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Description: These models integrate theorical-practical techniques used in pine resin extraction, in order to obtain more product per indiviudal tree and increase the total resin production. The models will contribute to improve resin production, marketing, financial aspects and internal control systems in each ejido. They will also lead to a second-level organization structure that integrates beneficiaries under consolidated commercialization schemes in order to increase their profits. The high rates of marginalization in the municipalities of this area affect the local capacities to manage and protect their forests, putting them at risk of deforestation and leading their inhabitants to increase marginalization and vulnerability. Thus strengthening producers capacities in this region will contribute to a better forest governance, which represents an opportunity to reverse negative trends and favors community forestry performance.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Description: The  model integrates traditional and sustainable practices for the cultivation and transformation of cocoa, and for the integral management of the agroforestry system. The outcome will contribute to support the communities that help conserve this important forest carbon stock area, that also represents an economical platform to improve their livelihoods.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Description: Improving the honey practices in these communities will result in having impacts in the conservation of Calakmul Biosphere Reserve forests. In this region, apiculture represents the third most important productive activity after agriculture and livestock, therefore the capacity-building models integrate strategies for the productive reconversion, in order to increase profits as an incentive to continue conserving the important forest areas and carbon stocks of this Biosphere Reserve. However, beekeepers in these municipalities have not only been affected by the economic crisis of COVID-19, that has impacted the prices and profits by 80%, but also the meteorological events of this year have severely affected their apiaries causing the loss of the 30-50% of their hives. Therefore, the capacity-building models also integrate a baseline to know the current status of the apiaries.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Description: This apiculture capacity building process aims to cotribuite to the forest conservation and to the emissions reductions in the PUCC Biocultural State Reserve, by strengthening productive and marketing capacities of the 650 beekepeers. It also aims to contribute to increase the budget of the apiculture sector, by promoting changes at the municipal public policy level and by strengthening the relationship and interaction with the private sector in the region. The capacity building training models in Yucatán have a regional approach, since the level of progress of the activity in this region is considerable, therefore contribute to strengthen the collaborative regional work is one of the main needs and challenges of the region.

Project: Improve and replicate local capacity building processes linked to value chains and networks in the Agriculture, Forest and other Land Use Sector in six jurisdictions of the GCF Task Force Mexico
Description: The models integrate good practices for honey production and other beehive products based on organic production standards. The South Region of Quintana Roo is an area of great importance from the point of view of connectivity, as it is a biological corridor between two Biosphere Reserves: “Calakmul” in Campeche and “Sian Ka’an” in Quintana Roo, which are part of the Mesoamerican Biological Corridor. In this environment of rich biodiversity, more than 70% of the apicultural activity from Quintana Roo happens; ttherefore, improving the productive capacities of the producers is of great importance both for their well-being and for conserving this important forest area considered the second best conserved in Latin America after the Amazon region. Good practices of forest management and production, are friendly with pollinators and represent an opportunity to increase apicultural productivity as well as the long-term viability and profitability of food production systems.

Project: Expanding the Colombian Climate Asset Disclosure Initiative (CCADI)
Result_Title: Resources are mobilised to address climate-related impacts, redirecting resources to activities with positive climate impact and better allocating of capital to avoid resources going to highly emission activities.
Description: The project will support the mobilization of resources to address climate-related impacts through several channels. (1) the project will accelerate the ongoing behavioural change in investment decisions, therefore financial institutions could redirect financial flows towards economic activities that have a positive climate impact and projects that support mitigation and adaptation to climate change. (2) by including climate risk management in the investment decision process, a better allocation of capital will be promoted in order to avoid financial flows going towards activities with high emissions. (3) by supporting the companies in the real sector to implement the TCFD recommendations, the business sector will align with low carbon strategies that are resilient to climate change impacts. Finally, the continuous articulation, support and capacity building given to the main stakeholders in the financial sector will have a positive impact in the country's abilities to mitigate and adapt to the effects of climate change.
